The couple has been married since 1995. They have three children--two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. The family lives in a village along National Road Number Five, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to buy a new tuk-tuk for her husband

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Restaurateur depuis 10ans Kodjo tient son café dans un secteur de la capitale, jeune père de famille de 27 ans il sollicite ce premier crédit pour s’approvisionner sur place   en nourriture de base. Il aime son métier et voudrait l’élargir plus tard.
texts.en: A restaurant-owner for ten years, Kodjo runs his café in an area of the capital. At 27 years old, he is a young father. He is requesting this first loan to locally procure basic food supplies. He loves his work and would later like to expand.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for the restaurant.

loans.name: Karina Melisa

texts.es:
Karina es madre de familia  de 20 años de edad, vive con sus hijos y esposo en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope a unos 45 minutos de distancia del departamento de Lambayeque.  Se caracteriza por ser una zona con actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Karina  se dedica hace 2 años a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas, pavos, patos y gallos), tiene su corral en la parte posterior de su casa para mayor seguridad de sus animales, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos naturales,  una vez que han completado su desarrollo los vende a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Lambayeque y Chiclayo, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus necesidades diarias.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas necesita un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más animales y alimentos balanceados para sus aves de corral, al tenerlas bien alimentadas puede ofertarlas a un mejor precio a sus clientes, lo que le permitiría tener más efectivo para poder pagar el crédito y darles una mejor calidad a su familia.  Karina es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y empeñosa conocida por los pobladores del distrito donde vive y que el sueño que se ha trazado es el poderle dar una profesión a sus hijos en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Karina es madre de familia  de 20 años de edad, vive con sus hijos y esposo en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope a unos 45 minutos de distancia del departamento de Lambayeque.  Se caracteriza por ser una zona con actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Karina  se dedica hace 2 años a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas, pavos, patos y gallos), tiene su corral en la parte posterior de su casa para mayor seguridad de sus animales, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos naturales,  una vez que han completado su desarrollo los vende a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de Lambayeque y Chiclayo, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus necesidades diarias.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas necesita un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más animales y alimentos balanceados para sus aves de corral, al tenerlas bien alimentadas puede ofertarlas a un mejor precio a sus clientes, lo que le permitiría tener más efectivo para poder pagar el crédito y darles una mejor calidad a su familia.  Karina es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y empeñosa conocida por los pobladores del distrito donde vive y que el sueño que se ha trazado es el poderle dar una profesión a sus hijos en un futuro cercano.

loans.use: Compra de más aves de corral y su respectivo alimento

loans.name: Filchester

texts.en:
Filchester is a-26 year-old farmer in Mocag Baggao, Cagayan, where he has lived for two years. He is requesting a loan of PHP15,000 to buy rice and corn varieties. Every harvest, Filchester is able to generate the average net income of PHP50,000 in corn. This income is used to expand his farm land area. 

He is married and soon will have his first child. He is so excited and hoping for a healthy baby. Filchester says he will work harder for his family's future.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn varieties to plant.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo is a 34-year-old woman who lives in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. Keo has been selling a variety of types of fish at the market for years. She normally earns an income of $3 per day. She is married and has five children. Two of her children are employed and share their salary. Besides this, Keo and her husband plant rice crops according to the seasons, the rainy season and the dry season. Currently, their fishing is temporarily interrupted because the fishing equipment is broken. For this reason, Keo has requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing equipment. She will use the remainder of the loan funds to plant a rice crop.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment and to plant a rice crop.

loans.name: Romel

texts.es: El señor Romel trabaja como  chofer de minibús de transporte de pasajeros en el sindicato San Cristóbal de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor, pues así mantendrá en buen estado su herramienta de trabajo. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Vino Tino en la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene un hijo. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con el crédito anterior  que obtuvo también a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Romel works in the city of La Paz’s San Cristobal Transportation Syndicate as a minibus driver transporting passengers.  He needs the loan to buy a motor to keep his vehicle in good working order.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s Vino Tinto zone.  He’s married and has a son.  He is very satisfied with the previous loan that he also got through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motor for his minibus.

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Prom is the big head of a family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. For improving his financial status, he works driving a motorbike in this province everyday. He can earn about $3 per day to give to his wife. His wife isn't lazy, she works raising animals like ducks, chickens and pigs. They have birthed five kids; a big family, very happy. To assist their efforts, Mr. Prom wishes to borrow some funds to sponsor his family, about $1,000, in order to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Rosibel, tiene la edad 24 de  años, está casada y vive con su esposo . Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de almacigo para su plantación de café. Ella cuenta con un terreno para sembrarlo de café y pretende invertir en mano de obra e insumos como abonos y fungicidas para obtener un buen resultado. Ella quiere implantar un cafetal que de buena producción para vender un café de calidad. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  familiar  y crecer con el proyecto del café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rosibel is 24 years old, married, and lives with her husband. She intends to use this loan to buy supplies to make a seedbed for her coffee plantation. Rosibel has a plot of land for growing coffee and plans to invest in labor and supplies, such as compost and fungicides, so that she can obtain good results. She wants to have a coffee farm that has good output so that she can sell a quality product. Rosibel wants to generate more revenue so that she can provide for the welfare of her family and grow her coffee venture.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. Rosibel has not had any other loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies for growing coffee and to pay for labor.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Jeseck

texts.en:
Jeseck is 42 years old, married and has three children.  To earn a living, he runs a retail shop.  He has been in the business for six years and he has managed to employ two people.  He joined Faulu Kenya so that he could access financial resources easily.  He used his previous loan to boost his business.  He has also become more financially literate because he has been trained in financial management.

Jeseck hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He needs a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of sugar, cooking fat, soap and maize flour.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, cooking fat, soap and maize flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 43 years old and is married. She has three children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

She and her husband have run a general store at their horse for five years. They sell milk, beverages, stationery, and confectionery. Hanh intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell in her store such as eggs, sugar, and personal sanitary items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy basic products and foods such as eggs, sugar, and sanitary items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jilani

texts.en:
Jilani is a married man who lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past eight years, he has operated a shoe designing business,  selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of purchasing materials in his business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase a machine for shoe designing. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for shoe designing.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, 25 years old, is working in a cigarette company earning $7 per day. His wife has a pretty salon (a beauty shop) at home and earns $6 per day. The couple does not yet have any children. Every month, Vanna has to spend $40 on food, $10 on electricity, and $49 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for transporting cigarettes to sell. The rest of the money, he will spend to extend his wife’s shop. In the future, he wants to extend his wife's shop so that she can provide more services to her customers and earn a better income.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transporting cigarettes to sell

loans.name: Antonio Edalberto

texts.es:
Antonio Edalberto tiene 48 años de edad es casado tiene tres hijos, vive  con la esposa y con los tres hijos de veinte, catorce y dos años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC NUEVA UNIÓN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Guamayacu, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul.
Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza Echeandia. 

Con el dinero  del prestamo anterior pudo comprar semillas e insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

En la familia la relación ha mejorado porque ahora puede aportar un poco más para el bienestar de la familia, en el trabajo le va mucho mejor porque a aumentado la producción en los ingresos a mejorado mucho porque ahora con la venta de los productos obtiene más ingresos.Con el apoyo de anterior crédito le ha ayudado a superarse y no tuvo ningún problema para poder cancelar las cuotas establecidas por la cooperativa. 

Este nuevo Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá  comprar semilas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos y podrá sembrar maíz, arroz y cosechar para tener utilidades.
El sueño es poderse comprar un carro.En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar futbol y salir con la familia a pasear.
"Esta muy agradecido por la ayuda brindada".
texts.en:
Antonio Edalberto, 48, is married and has three children.  He lives with his wife and three children who are 20, 14 and 2 years of age in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “Nueva Unión” communal bank is located in Recinto Guamayacu belonging to Echeandía Canton.  This communal bank’s members are short cycle corn, rice and pigeon pea farmers.

He used the previous loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to keep his crops in good condition.

Relations in his family have improved because now he’s able to contribute a bit more toward family wellbeing.  At work he’s doing much better because production has increased and income has risen quite a bit because he earns more income when he sells his products.  
Support from the previous loan has helped him improve himself and he didn’t have any problem making his installment payments as established by the communal bank.

This new loan will be of much help because he’ll be able to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer and manure and will be able to plant corn and rice and to harvest to earn profits.

His dream is to be able to buy a car.  During his free time he likes playing soccer and going out on family excursions.  He is very grateful for the help provided.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has two children.

Since 2000, Mohamad has been an owner of a food market that sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are many customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to paint his market’s walls and to add more foodstuffs. He wants to earn more profit in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to paint his market’s walls and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Jiael

texts.en:
This is Jiael, 26, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Jumar, 34, a timekeeper. She is also the mother of one child who is now in grade IV. While attending to her husband and child, she also keeps herself busy with her business as her way of helping her husband pay for the family's daily expenses. 

Jiael is a bayong maker. Bayong is a native bag in the Philippines made of rubberized plastic and hand woven. Jiael makes different sized bags depending on the request of clients in the market and malls. She also creates different designs such as square, triangle, and oblong. She earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more raw materials. With the Christmas season fast approaching, her numerous customers will place many orders for bayong to be used as fruit trays and vanity kits. 
  
Jiael hopes that her business will continue to generate an income that will provide for the needs of her family. She dreams that she can continue making bayong and attending to her family needs at the same time. She hopes that her family will remain simple and happy. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her to have time in reading Bible verses and understand the sacrifices of our Christ Jesus. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Vickie

texts.en: Vickie is married with no children. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. Vickie is a farmer and she raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional feed for the pigs. Vickie has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel tiene 31 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene tres hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 9, 3 y 7 meses de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la  VRC  SAN JUAN, Se encuentra Ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan se dedican a Labores Agrícolas.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz hace 5 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para invertir en la agricultura para el ciclo corto y comprar insumos agrícolas. 

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder comprar semillas. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. 

El sueño es tener terreno propio.
En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is 31 years old, in a common-law marriage, and lives with his wife and three children (ages 9, 3, and 7 months) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

Juan Manuel is a member of the San Juan Communal Bank, which is located in the neighborhood of San Francisco and part of the parish of San Juan. The members are farmers.

Juan Manuel is a farmer who has been growing corn for five years. He buys and sells in Ventanas. The loan he is requesting will be invested in short-cycle farming, so he plans to buy agricultural supplies. The loan will be of great help because he will be able to buy seeds. At the moment, he is not encountering any problems. His dream is to have his own land.

In his free time, Juan Manuel enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 22 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is  single and has a 1-year-old child.

For the past  four years, Victoria has been selling slippers in the local market. She makes a lot of money during the dry season,  especially during holidays. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase slippers cartoon(Lady Slippers )  for her business. She plans to build a house and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers  for her business.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Banquito.

La señora Gloria es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy  fáciles para conseguir. Tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 7 años de edad que estudian en  escuela y colegio. Su esposo es artesano trabaja con tagua.

Ella tiene una tienda en su casa, en la cual vende desde  arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, hasta productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, los productos los compra en Montecristi y Manta aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local. Lleva en su tienda ya por 5 años y le va bien ya que dia a dia trata de mejorarla.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar productos de primera necesidad, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
In the city of Los Bajos de Montecristi, which is known for the diversity of its typical products such as the well-known Panama straw hat, the communal bank "Mi Banquito" meets every two weeks.

Mrs. Gloria is a founding member of the group which she likes because the loans are easy to obtain.  She is 35 years old, married and has two children, ages 14 and 7 who are in school.  Her husband is an artisan who works with ivory palm.

She has a store set up in her home where she sells rice, sugar, oil, detergents and even Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. and some times even later.  She buys her products in Montecristi and Manta although most of the products are delivered.  She has been in business for five years and it going well since she tries to improve it everyday.

The loan she has requested will be used to restock the store.  She plans to buy basic goods, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

Her goal is to continue her business and keep expanding the store.

loans.use: To buy basic goods, perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: La señora Yadira es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien inicio con la venta de tortillas y frijoles cocidos hace 10 años poco fue aumentando su negocio e invirtiendo en otros productos como cuajadas, queso, crema, leche agria y fritanga. Ella invertirá el crédito en frijoles, maíz, leña, aceite, plátano…etc. Con el propósito de salir adelante y mejorar cada día màs.
texts.en: Yadira is a hardworking, enterprising woman who started selling tortillas and cooked beans ten years ago.  Gradually her business grew and she invested in other products like cuajadas [Nicaraguan white cheese], cheese, cream, sour milk and fried fast food.  She will use her loan to buy beans, corn, firewood, oil, bananas, etc. aiming at getting ahead and improving more each day.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, firewood, oil, bananas, etc.

loans.name: G.s.  Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Mujeres Unidas está conformado por 2 emprendedoras  que viene trabajando con Fundación león 2000 desde hace tiempo, son excelente clientes en el cual han demostrado ser una personas responsable y con deseos de superación, ellos mismos se motivan y se apoyan entre ellos para salir adelante, ya que ambos tiene sueños de ver su negocio bien surtidos de productos. Maura Estela es una miembro de este grupo solidario en el cual su actividad económica a la que se dedica es a una pulpería, actualmente está solicitando  financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de granos básicos, jabón, aceite, pasta de dietes, desodorante, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" is comprised of two entrepreurs who have been working with Fundación León 2000 for some time.  They are excellent clients and have proven themselves to be responsible and determined to get ahead.  They motivate and support each other in their efforts and both want to see their businesses well stocked with a variety of products.

Maura Estela is one of the members and she has a grocery store.  She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, soap, oil, toothpaste, deodorant and other items.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, soap, oil, toothpaste, deodorant and other items.

loans.name: Benkelema 2 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe BENKELEMA 2  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  36 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KALAKAN, commune de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est: le riz, l’arachide et le mais avec FANTA la personne au milieu sur la photo position assise. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter: 3 hectares. La production est vendue à KOLONDIEBA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 180 000F cfa qui la permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Achat d’intrants, de semences et frais de labours pour la campagne agricole.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Jeniffer, a 31-year-old mrembo (beautiful woman) who is humble, honest and a very hardworking mum on this planet Earth. Jeniffer adores her lovely family very much. She will always do anything good to keep them from going to bed with hungry stomachs. 

Jeniffer hails from the Kericho area of Kenya. She has never had the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job, but this has not killed her dream of wanting to succeed in life. She has been farming for the past six years. Throughout these years, she has gathered much experience and has all the farming techniques at her fingertips. 

Jeniffer practices mixed farming on her farm. With her profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her 4 children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key" to success.

Jeniffer is very enterprising. She is seeking a loan of 65,000 Kenyan shillings to buy seeds and begin horticulture farming on her farm. Jeniffer wants to take advantage of, and reap more profits from, favorable weather patterns, her village's good road network, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products. 

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Jeniffer turn their farming dreams into realities through training and loan financing. Jeniffer hopes that she will improve her living conditions through this loan. Her dreams and projections are, by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but also in international markets through fruit and vegetable exports. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. 

Jeniffer is an unselfish mum and also wants to have a positive impact on society. She will do so by employing people to work on her horticulture farm.

Contribute to this mum’s life. Grant her a loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona is 32 years old divorced woman, from Akhaltsikhe district. She has school-aged daughter and works hard to make good living condition for her. Teona works at the local hotel as a administrator and also as a bartender at the private company. She is very motivated and hard-working person, with a great desire somehow to increase the living condition of her family. Teona decided to start her own trading business parallel to nowadays works and sell the products in her community. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Teona will purchase clothing and bed linens at wholesale prices and will sell with price mark-ups. 
 It is obvious that the job is hard for Teona, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased regards Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To trade with clothing and bed linens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming business

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.en:
Maria de la Luz has two children, ages 3 and 7. Her husband, Alejandro, is a taxi driver, so he doesn't have a fixed salary and often doesn't make enough to meet all the family's needs. To make a little more income and improve the conditions her family lives in, Maria began to sell shoes through catalogues six years ago. She has since started selling jewelry as well, and through this has been able to help Alejandro with family expense and educate the children.

Maria's clients have increased, and she has not been apply to carry out some of their orders due to a lack of capital. Because of this, she needs a loan of $150, which she will be able to repay in three to six months, that will enable her to execute all orders. Supporting Maria will help improve her and her family's quality of life. They are thankful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Translator

Maria de la Luz tiene dos hijos, de 3 y 7 años, su esposo Alejandro es taxista por lo que no tiene un salario fijo y le era insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, de esta manera Maria empezó a vender zapatos por catálogo desde hace seis años, para obtener un poco más de ingreso y mejorar las condiciones en las que vivían ella y su familia. Después inició también con la venta de joyería, y de esta forma Mary ayuda a su esposo con los gasto del hogar y de la educación de sus hijos.

Los clientes de Mary se han incrementado y muchos de los pedidos no los ha podido surtir, por la falta de capital para invertir, para esto necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 150 dólares que empleara con este fin, que esta dispuesta a regresar en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Apoya a Maria de la Luz, tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buy shoes and jewelry

loans.name: Bernabe

texts.es:
My name is Bernabe B. and I am dedicated to the sales of various products for the home. I have had my business for one year, and my goal is to increase my inventory in order to have greater sales and to be able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Bernabe B. me dedico a la venta de articulos varios para el hogar, tengo mi negocio hace un año, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios para tener una mayor venta y asi poder alimentar mi familia.

loans.use: purchase of super glue, brushes, painting supplies

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Born in 1963, C. Rachel is married and has five children. She has faced a lot of challenges as a mother, the worst being the death of her two children in the space of one month.  She has also had an illness that required surgery.  Her husband does not earn a high salary.  Given the need to educate and feed her children, she became a member of GHAPE and was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline.

Given a loan of $100, she plans to fatten pigs and sell them. She also plans to sell piglets to the community and use the pig droppings as manure on her farm.  She will repay the loan in 15 months. Her first repayment will be made on the date her loan is disbursed.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Rudelania

texts.en:
Rudelania, 21, is living with her daughter, 4 years old. Before her daughter’s birth, she separated from her partner, and since then she has been working to earn their living and tend to the child.

Rudelania owns a small beauty salon and offers hairdos and hair straightening. She also sells cosmetic products and other items like shampoo, hand and body lotion, beauty and medical soap.

Now, Rudelania is requesting a loan with the intention of purchasing the entire line of Jafra skin care products, since they’re well appreciated by the women of her community. She also wants to buy a showcase where she can put her new products in order to make them known to her clientele. This way, she’ll be able to increase her income and do her best for the sake of her beloved little daughter.

loans.use: To buy Jafra skin care products to introduce in her business and to buy a showcase to put these products in

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Chuong

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuong P., 27, works with her husband buying cigarettes from a company and reselling them to wholesalers, earning collectively about $3.20 per day. She has one little child, and her father is living with her.

Mrs. Chuong P. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more cigarette packs to meet her clients' demands and improve her life.

loans.use: To purchase more cigarettes to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Shukrullo

texts.ru:
Shukrullo has been selling women's handbags for the last 10 years. He is married and has 4 children. His store is located at the Korvon market in Dushanbe, capital of Tadjikistan. To the question as to why he chose to sell this type of goods he responded that he likes to come up with designs for handbags. He has a creative soul and enjoys picking out his wares on his trips to China to restock. In the future he is hoping to open a handbag making workshop and for this purpose he is having his son study at the university as a leather goods designer. Currently the goods turnaround at his store is very fast and he is saving up money for the workshop for his son. He would like to use the loan from Kiva in order to buy additional shipments of handbags to expand his selection.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Шукрулло давно занимается продажей женских сумочек(10 лет).Он женат и имеет 4 детей.Его торговая точка расположена на рынке Корвон в Душанбе,Таджикистан.На вопрос, почему он выбрал этот ассортимент товара, он ответил, что сам очень любит придумывать дизайн для женских сумок.По натуре он творческая личность и он с удовольствием сам привозит товар, выбирая ассортимент, с Китая.В будушем он мечтает открыть цех по производству дамских сумок, с этой целью он обучает своег сына в Университете на дизайнера кожных изделий. В данный момент он имеет хороший оборот товара и копит деньги на будуший цех для сына.С Кивы он хочет получить займ на покупку нового ассортимента сумок.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mr. Mario Z. lives in his own home in the Pasankeri area of La Paz with his wife, Mrs. Celia Coaquira and their three children. Mario works as a messenger and his wife is a domestic employee. They need a loan to finish the construction of two rooms and a bathroom. This is his fourth loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies him favorably and he can obtain this loan. He has been our client since 2004. The three previous loans were repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Mario Z. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa, la señora Celia Coaquira y sus tres hijos. Mario trabaja como empleado de mensajería y su esposa es empleada domestica. Requieren el crédito para la conclusión de construcción en dos habitaciones y un baño. Esta es la cuarta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Es cliente de nuestra institución desde el año 2004. Los tres préstamos anteriores fueron cancelados en las fechas establecidas.

loans.use: Build two rooms and a bathroom on his home.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 25 years old and unmarried. He currently operates a metal fabrication business specializing in coal pots. The pots hold charcoal and are used to cook various dishes in many Ghanaian homes. He currently sell these pots at the market and some road junctions.

He is hoping this loan will help him purchase more materials so that he can increase his sales and income to raise his standard of living. He has recently moved to Kumasi from Obuasi, where he learned the trade for 2 years. He believes the market in Kumasi is better than in Obuasi.

Isaac is a member of the trust group called Nyame Wo Ho (God Is There). The trust group exerts peer pressure on individual members to repay their part of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for his operation

loans.name: Mayra De La Cruz

texts.es:
Señora Mayra M. makes a living by selling various products. She has her own mini-market where she sells all types of products like personal items and food. Her biggest dream in her career is to succeed in improving her business by way of expanding her land to improve the conditions of her store. This is why she strives greatly to carry out this goal and in this way to offer a better life to her children.

As is well known, every remodeling or expansion of a business needs a large investment, which is why she has very confidently turned to Ceprodel to benefit from the credits that they could offer her to expand her business with the aim of offering better conditions to her clients and at the same time offering better comforts to her children, who she loves very much.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Mayra M. se dedica al negocio de la venta de productos varios teniendo su propia pulpería en la que vende todo tipo de productos tales como personales y comestibles. Su mayor sueño comerciante es lograr mejorar su negocio por medio de la ampliación de su terreno para mejorar las condiciones de la pulpería, es por eso que se esfuerza grandemente para llevar a cabo esta meta y de esta forma proporcionarle un mejor estilo de vida a sus hijos.

Como bien es sabido, toda reconstrucción o ampliación de un negocio necesita una alta inversión por lo que ella muy confiadamente ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan ampliar su negocio con el fin de prestar mejores condiciones a sus clientes y a la vez proporcionarles mejores comodidades a sus hijos que los ama mucho.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes lives in the region of Loma de Guadalupe, is married and is 54 years old. She has four children aged 10, 20, 24 and 26 years of age, three of whom are married and are independent. Only the youngest one is still in her care. She has been running her eatery for four years.

One of her many worries is the poor shape that her shop is in. With the loan she will remodel the dining area to provide greater comfort and a healthy place to be for her clients. When looking towards the future she seeks to expand her business and include a small cafe, and she wishes to improve her living quarters and help her son in his professional development.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mercedes habita en el barrio Loma de Guadalupe, es casada y tiene 54 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos de 10, 20,24 y 26 años de edad, tres de ellos ya están casados e independientes, solo tiene al menor a su cargo. Su trabajo es una comideria y tiene cuatro años de experiencia. Entre sus dificultades está el local que está en malas condiciones, con el préstamo va a acondicionar la infraestructura de su comedor para dar mas comodidad a sus clientes en un ambiente saludable. A futuro es ampliarlo más y convertirlo en un cafetín, mejorar su vivienda y en la formación profesional de su hijo.

loans.use: To remodel her store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., 28 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2008. Being a tailor for a long time, after joining the TYM Fund, she talked to her husband, Mr. Tran Van Hoi, and opened a store of bed sheets, bed curtains, pillow shams. She used all of her borrowed money in this business. Since she is very experienced and has clever hands, her products are very welcomed by the customers. Her husband usually helps her in distributing the products into different areas. Although this business requires energy and effort, Mrs. N. and her husband are both very happy. They have one child who is still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 625 USD to buy cloth/ Her average income is approximately 225 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị N. 28 tuổi, năm 2003 chị tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương, với thuận lợi nghề may săn có từ thời con gái, khi tham gia Quỹ đuợc vay vốn chị đã bàn bạc cùng chồng anh Trần văn Hởi mở cửa hiệu may rèm, ga, gối, thấy kế hoạch của vợ đưa ra hoàn toàn là hợp lý chồng chị đã hưởng ứng và động viên chị làm, từ đó cửa hàng gia đình chị đã mở, trải qua các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ chị đều đầu tư vào hiệu may của gia đình, với cá tính cẩn thận cùng với sự khéo léo và kinh nghiệm nên các sản phẩm của chị đều được khách hàng ưng ý, chồng chị thường xuyên hộ trợ chị trong công việc anh thường là người đi lấy hàng và giao hàng, chị là người chuyên cắt và may. Mặc dù vất vả nhưng anh chị cảm thấy rất vui, chị có 1 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua vải. Thu nhập bình quân. 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Buy cloth

loans.name: Ndeye Coumba

texts.fr:
Ndeye Coumba F. is a married woman and mother of six children. She lives in the Cité Senghor quarter of Thiès and sells seasonal fruits with help from the IMCEC branch located in Thiès. She has taken out small loans before that she was able to repay on time. She is requesting this loan so she can increase her revenue.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

NDEYE COUMBA F. EST UNE FEMME MARIEE ET MERE DE SIX ENFANTS .ELLE HABITE AU QUARTIER CITE SENGHOR ET VENDS DES FRUITS DE SAISON A COTE DE LA DIRECTION DE IMCEC DE THIES .ELLE A EU A BENEFICIER DE PETITES SOMMES QU ELLE A PU REMBOURSER DANS LES DELAIS. C EST DANS LE BUT D AMELIORER SES REVENUS QU ELLE SOLLICITE CE PRET.

loans.use: Purchase and selling of fruits at retail

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José, is 42 years old and is a single father, he is a teacher of elementary school, has 2 wonderful kids who study and help him on his business.
For the past 2 years he has dedicated to provide service with an internet cafe, because it is near by a high school most of his clients are students. José is very active and hard worker, this is why he wants so much to keep on with this business because it seams very profitable to him, besides working as teacher on the school.
He works to pay for his regular expenses and his children’s education.
His goal is to keep on growing his business; he wants to invest the money on extending his space, because it is very small.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

José, de 42 años de edad es padre soltero, es profesor de educación primaria, tiene dos hijos maravillosos que estudian y lo apoyan en su negocio. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a brindar servicios de cabinas públicas de Internet, a razón de estar cerca de un colegio y son los alumnos en su mayoría, sus clientes. José es muy activo y trabajador, por eso que tiene esas ganas de seguir adelante en este negocio ya que le parece muy rentable, aparte trabaja como profesor en una institución educativa. Trabaja para solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar y por la educación de sus hijos. El objetivo de José es seguir creciendo en su negocio, quiere invertir el dinero en ampliar su local, ya que es muy pequeño.

loans.use: Extent the space where he has an internet cafe / Ampliación del local donde tiene cabinas públicas de Internet.

loans.name: Patricia Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Patricia inicio su negocio hace 3 años por necesidades económicas, ella aprendió este oficio de familia ya que su mama y tías venden fritangas y tamales, quienes le enseñaron el arte culinario, ella aprovecho sus conocimientos para ofrecer entre vecinos sus productos y poco a poco logre que estos la fueron recomendando ampliando así sus clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima y así poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Patricia started her business three years ago out of economic necessity. She learned the trade from her family: her mom and aunts sell fried snacks and tamales, and they taught Patricia how to cook. Patricia took advantage of her knowledge to sell food to her neighbors, and little by little these neighbors recommended her to others, expanding her client base. Patricia needs a loan of US $250 to buy raw materials to sustain her business. She’ll repay the loan in three months.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials

loans.name: Suvanar

texts.ru: Сафарова Суванар проживает в районе  Файзабад. Домохозяйка . Вдова , имеет пяьтерых детей. Занимается животноводством  уже 25 лет. Это дело помогло ей растить детей. Саршие выросли и уехали на заработки в Россию. Но она продолжает  заниматься животноводством. Возможность получить кредит  поможет ей увеличить бизнес. То есть , полученный кредит поможет ей купить овец и коз. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Suvanar S. lives in the Fayzabad region of Tajikistan. She is widowed and has 5 children. For the past 25 years she has been working in animal husbandry, and this business helped her bring up her children. Her older children work in Russia. Savrinisso keeps raising livestock. A loan from Kiva would help her purchase sheep and goats and thereby expand her business. She plans to repay the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan was born in 1978. He is a single young man, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region, Horadiz village.

Elshin has been in cattle breeding business for three years. Now he needs a loan of 800 AZN (US$1,000) to buy two calves.

loans.use: To buy two calves.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en: Maximo is a member of the Morenita Huamanga Village Bank. Maximo and his wife have a workshop called M. where they sew custom-made clothing. They receive orders from institutions and have six employees. The couple buys their materials in the city of Lima.  Maximo needs a loan to buy a variety of fabrics. He dreams of providing his children with a good education, of exporting his clothing, and of getting his children involved in his business.

loans.use: To buy fabric for tailoring shop

loans.name: Abelina Santa

texts.es:
Abelina J. D. M. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Niño Manuelito II” D. la provincia D. Huaraz.

Abelina tiene 59 años, es casada y tiene 06 hijos, Abelina comenta que no ha tenido problemas difíciles que enfrentar, y su negocio ha sido su mayor logro porque D. esta manera apoya a su esposo que es albañil, ella se dedica a la elaboración D. tejidos con lana sintética D. prendas D. vestir, como chompas, chalinas, medias, guantes, etc, que los venD. a pedido a las mujeres mayoristas desD. hace 20 años aproximadamente, este trabajo lo alterna con la compra y venta D. animales menores que compra D. las zonas rurales D. Huaraz y los venD. en la feria D. Huaraz los días lunes y jueves, ella comenta que el tejido no le brinda muchas utilidades porque produce en pocas cantidades pero siempre la saca D. dificultades, razón por la cual también realiza la  venta D. animales menores.

Con este préstamo D. s/.1500.00, que pagará en ocho cuotas invertirá en la compra D. lana sintética y así mismo cuyes y gallinas para las fiestas naviD.ñas.
 
Abelina afirma que le gustaría capacitarse para mejorar en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Abelina J. D. M. is a member of the “Niño Manuelito II” microfinance institute in the province of Huaraz.

Abelina is a 59-year-old married mother with 6 children. She states that she has not had to face difficulties, and that her business has been her biggest achievement because with it, she can support her husband, who is a bricklayer. She weaves knitwear out of synthetic wool for a living, making garments like sweaters, scarves, socks, gloves, etc. that she has been selling to women wholsalers by custom order for approximately 20 years. She also buys and sells small animals for a living. She buys the animals in the rural areas of Huaraz, then sells them at the local market on Mondays and Thursdays. She states that knitting does not bring in too many profits because she only makes a small amount of knitwork, but it always helps her out a bit. For that same reason, she also sells small animals.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in eight monthly installments, she will purchase synthetic wool, as well as guinea pigs and chickens for the Christmas festivities.

Abelina states that she would like to receive training in order to improve her business.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase synthetic wool, guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: Emma tiene 37 años, es madre de 4 hijos en edad escolara, vive con su esposo, quien la ayuda en lo posible. La casa donde viven es alquilada. Desde temprana edad Emma manifestó habilidades en el arte textil, luego tuvo la posibilidad de estudiar este oficio y perfeccionar sus ideas y conocimientos que aprendió inicialmente de manera empírica. La experiencia (5 años) y la práctica hacen de esta mujer una máquina de trabajo, por lo que casi cada uno de sus clientes ha recomendado a otras personas que también han venido en busca del buen trabajo de Emma. Su pequeño taller está acondicionado en su propia casa, y su deseo para el futuro es lograr tener un gran taller textil. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a construir un local adecuado para su taller textil y así dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Emma is a 37-year-old mother of 4 children. She lives with her husband, who helps her when possible. They live in a rented home. Emma learned the art of textiles at a very young age. Later she was able to study this trade and improve her earlier empirical ideas and practices. Her experience (of 5 years) and practice illustrate this woman's dedication, which has caused her clients to recommend her services to others. Her small workshop is located in her home. Her wish for the future is to establish a larger textile workshop. This is her third loan with MFP, and with this loan she intends to build an adequate space for her workshop and thus provide better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her textile workshop space

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma Gómez inició el negocio porque necesitaba un ingreso extra que le permitiera ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos, sobre todo después que se pensionó su esposo el dinero les alcanzaba menos. Comenzó su negocio en enero de 2007 por iniciativa propia, ya que tenía ahorrado algún dinero y decidió invertir en una tienda pequeña, la cual puso en la parte de enfrente de su casa, aprovechando que vivo en una esquina y que no había ninguna otra tienda cercana. Desde que empezó ha ido creciendo poco a poco y ya los vecinos de la zona la conocen y por lo mismo cuenta con un buen número de clientes por lo esta pensando también en vender frutas y verduras.

Ella necesita un préstamo pro MXN $3,000 que pagara en 6 catorcenas que le  permitirá comprar más abarrotes para tener mejor surtida su tienda y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Irma G. started her business because she needed an extra income to help out her husband with the household expenses and with their childrens' schooling, especially because her husband retired and their income was less. She started her business in January 2007 by her own initiative and since she had some money saved, she decided to invest in a small store, setting it up in the front part of their house. She lives in a street corner and there is no other store nearby. Since she started out she has been expanding the business slowly and all the neighbours in the area know of her and she counts on a good number of clients. She is thinking about starting to sell fresh fruit and vegetables.

She requires a loan in the amount of $3000 MXN, which will be repaid in 6 biweekly payments, permitting her to purchase more grocery items to better stock her store and provide better service to her clients.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Kry's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of four members. Its leader is N., 21, is a father of a young child. He is married to Chinda, 22, who earns an income selling clothes in front of the garment factory. N. sells different kinds of clothes in the Phum Pheak Market and he has been in this business for more than two years. Because his shop is located in the busy market, he can earn a good income and provide a better standard of living for his family. He imports clothes from Vietnam in bulk, at a low price and resell them to his customers at a higher price. He always goes by bus or motor taxi which cost him to much. To help reduce travel expense and because of N. is now tired of taking buses and motor taxies, he is looking for a loan to buy a motorbike for his business and his family transportation. 

The other loan members are: S., 34, who serves as an electrical provider in the private sector is making a loan to renovate his house for his family. KimS., 30, who sells ice to the whole commune is making a loan to build a shop for her business. And S., 27, who owns a groceries shop is applying for a loan to buy more food supplies for her shop. They all live in the Siem Reap Province. S. was not available during the photograph so his wife, Sophy, is in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his business and his family transportation

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Juan S. con gran esfuerzo y dedicación se dedica diariamente a atender su negocio de venta de ropa el cual es comercializada en su propio tramo en el mercado La Terminal de la ciudad de León donde se desempeña a diario.

La única razón por la cual él ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita la compra de la ropa para así salir adelante mejorando la situación del negocio y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan S., with great vigor and dedication, tends to his business of clothing sales. He conducts this business on a daily basis from his own stall in the market, La Terminal, in the city of León. The only reason he has come to Ceprodel is to benefit from a loan that will allow him to buy clothing in order to move forward and improve the situation of his business and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: {urchase clothing

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.en:
Tự Đinh (1318030464) is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyen. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To making a living, Tự owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Tự has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $170) a month from these activities.

In 2003, Tự joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tự has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Tự is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. The loan will be the 6th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. Tự plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Feed and supplies for livestock

loans.name: Om

texts.en: Mrs. Om G. is a 57-year-old widowed mother of five children - two of whom are married and live separately, whilst the other three are single. Two of G.'s single children are employed - one daughter works as a garment worker in Phnom Penh City, and one son is a firewood seller. Presently, G. sells carving wood that she and her son carved from the forest, and is earning around $6 per day to manage the family's daily expenses. The family intend to build a house but their personal savings are still not enough to pay for it. Therefore, G. has decided to seek a loan to put with her savings to begin building a house.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Remedias

texts.en:
Remedias B. is a fashion dealer. She sells facial powder, shampoos, cologne, perfumes and other cosmetics products to earn a living for her family. She has only one child. Her husband, Maximo B. is a driver. With her husband's income from driving, she thinks they will not be able to buy their other needs. 

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fashion products for sale. She also considers looking for some other possible income areas to help her husband.

By joining in the CEVI credit program, she has ready access for credit to support her business. In addition to that, she also receives training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To buy fashion products for sale

loans.name: Abdourahmane

texts.fr: abdourahmane S. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis mars 2003 ou il adeja renbourse cinq credits.le local dans lequel il gere son activite se situe a son lieu de domicile a yoff mbenguenne une rue qui est trs frequentee.il est tres connu dans la commercialisation de produits alimentaires qu'il exerce depuis plusieurs annees.ce credit de 300 000 lui permetra d'augmenter son fond de roulement en vue d'une divrsification plus importante de ses produits .ceci l'aidera a elargir son activite accroitre le niveau de sa marge beneficiaire et mieux afronter ses responsabilites familiales.
texts.en:
Abdourahmane S. has been a member of the Yoff credit union since March 2003 and he has already reimbursed 5 loans. The venue for his business is his home in Yoff Mbenguenne, in a much-used street. He is well-known for selling foodstuffs, a business he has been in for several years. This loan of 300,000 will allow him to add to his working capital so as to further diversify his inventory. It will permit him to expand his business, raise his profit margin, and better deal with his responsibilities for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMMERCE

loans.name: Flor De Verano Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  María Fidelina López, Candida Rosa López  y Juana Antonia Méndez.

El grupo solidario FLOR DE VERANO , está conformado por las siguientes personas: :  María Fidelina López, Candida Rosa López  y Juana Antonia Méndez.

Doña  María Fidelina López vende verduras y frutas en el mercado Oriental de Managua, su horario de trabajo es desde temprana horas de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde que regresa a su casa.Espera poder crecer en su negocio para alcanzar sus metas de mejorar su vivienda.

Doña Candida Rosa López vende frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de Masaya, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad que la aprendió de sus madre, ella desde tempranas horas compra sus productos a camiones que llegan con verduras de la zona norte del país y luego en el día revende estos productos. Tiene dos hijos en edad adolescentes y le ayudan en la venta. Su esposo trabaja por cuenta propia y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Su crédito lo ocupó para comprar más variedad de frutas y así incrementar sus ventas.

Doña Juana Antonia al igual que sus compañeras vende frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya ella es la coordinadora del grupo por ser muy responsable y además tiene el respeto de todos en su comunidad,  tiene hijos a su cargo pero son independientes, sueña con mejorar su casa y siempre depender de si misma.
Ella invirtió en la compra de más productos perecederos y así variar productos para vender mas, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, él se dedica al oficio de acarreo en el mercado.
Expresan que en Adim le han enseñado a controlar mejor su negocio con las capacitaciones que reciben y también a mejorar de manera personal.Se proponen trabajar con Adim en varios ciclos y están claras que para esto es solamente si son disciplinadas en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: María Fidelina López, Candida Rosa López, and Juana Antonia Méndez. The group "Flor de Verano" is formed by the following people: María Fidelina López, Candida Rosa López, and Juana Antonia Méndez. María sells fruits and vegetables in the market Oriental de Managua. Her work schedule is from very early in the morning until three in the afternoon when she goes home. She hopes to grow her business in order to achieve her goals of improving her home. Candida Rosa López sells fruits and vegetables in the municipal market of Mayasa. She has many years' experience in this business, which she learned from her mother. From the very early hours of the morning, she purchases her products from the trucks that arrive with vegetables from the northern zone of the country and later in the day, she resells these products. She has two adolescent children and they help her with her sales. Her husband works for himself and he helps with the expenses of the home. Her loan she will use to purchase a wider variety of fruits and thus increase her sales. Juana Antonia, just like her fellow group members, sells fruits and vegetable in the market in Masaya. She is the coordinator of the group, as she is very responsible and she has the respect of the whole community. She has children, but they are independent. She dreams of improving her home and always being able to support herself. She will invest in the purchase of more perishable products and this way vary the products she will sell. Her husband helps with the expenses of the home. He works in the transportation business for the market. The group members tell us that Adim has taught them to better control and improve their businesses with the training they have received, and that they have helped them in their personal lives as well. They propose to work with Adim for several cycles and are clear that this will be the case only if they can be disciplined in their repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 32 years old. She is divorced and is the mother of five children who are currently in school.

For the past three years now, Gladys has operated a clothing shop, selling jeans-clothes, blouses and skirts, women’s slippers, dress bags and underwear. However, she is constrained by not having sufficient funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress.

Gladys believes the loan will help her to be better resourced to purchase good quality clothes in large quantities to upgrade her inventory. She wants to use the loan to purchase jeans-clothes, ladies’ wear, etc.

loans.use: To purchase jeans-clothes, ladies' wear and slippers

loans.name: Chom

texts.en:
Chom C., age 54, is married and has 8 children. Seven of her children are students and another one is employed in the city. She lives with her husband in Kampong Cham Province. She is a subsistence farmer who produces just enough rice for her family to eat. Also, she manufactures dried salted fish for her repeat customers at the markets. This earns her an income of US $7 per day. Her husband is sick and stays at home. 

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, C. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, C. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $400 to purchase more fish to manufacture into dried salted fish to sell because this business is the primary source of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos  en su casa propia. Hace 12 años se dedica, junto con su esposo, a las tareas agrícolas, su producción principal es la papa y otros tubérculos oriundos de su zona, los cuales cada 6 meses cosecha. La comercialización la realiza en los mercados principales de la ciudad más cercana a su comunidad, de esta forma logra los ingresos necesarios para el sostén de su familia. Adicionalmente, cada 2 meses, Ana vende los animales que cría en su establo en la feria ganadera de su comunidad, con lo que obtiene el dinero que cubre las necesidades inmediatas de su familia. Su deseo a futuro es seguir dedicándose a la agricultura y tener más animales en su establo de raza mejorada. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella comenta que integrar el banco comunal al que pertenece le ha abierto nuevos horizontes de progreso, por lo que está muy agradecida y reafirma su compromiso de responsabilidad en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono y semilla.

loans.use: Compra de abono y semilla

loans.name: Asel's Group

texts.en: Asel is the mother of two children and is the leader of this group. At the age of thirty-five she has quite an active family: her daughter works in a big supermarket in the capital, whereas her son goes to college in another city. Her husband is a self-employed taxi-driver. Asel sells vegetables. Her present occupation greatly differs from her previous one, as she used to work as the head of a city firefighting department. There, a friend of hers advised her to get engaged in a trade, since the salaries were, roughly speaking, humble. This “career” change of hers has brought a lot of positive changes into her life. It is not only that she has an opportunity to deal with a lot more people, but also it has allowed her and her husband to save sufficient funds to buy a two-room flat. Asel needs a loan to purchase vegetables: tomatoes, cabbages, peppers, etc. With the return, she is going to buy an automatic washing machine. Her future business plans are to buy a van and to open a greengrocer’s shop. Asel has three partners: Elmira, Gulzana and Gerindi: Elmira, 37, is a widow and the mother of four children. She provides for her family by engaging in farming. She grows clover for cattle and sunflower seeds for producing sunflower oil. She needs a loan to buy a milk cow. Gulzana, 32, has a small family consisting of her, her husband, a six-year old daughter and a four-year old son. To make a living she sells milk and trades in sheep. She received this affection for animals from her parents-in-law. Besides that, she works part-time in a worsted factory. She needs a loan to purchase sheep for breeding and resale. Gerindi, 57, is divorced. She has raised two daughters who work and live separately. Gerindi works as the main specialist in a rayon emergencies department. She needs a loan to connect to the heating main. She plans to repair her house and make it more comfortable. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es una mujer muy alegre de 29 años, vive con sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la siembra de papas en sus propias chacras y en otras alquiladas, a ella le gusta trabajar en sus cultivos y también criar animales, pero lo que más le place es trabajar junto a su esposo. Betty se levantan muy temprano, para preparar los alimentos del día, mientras su esposo corta la avena y alimenta a las vacas. Alrededor de las 8 de la mañana, ordeña y entrega la leche a su vecina, quien produce quesos. Posteriormente, su esposo sujeta a las vacas en el campo, Betty carga el almuerzo y juntos se dirigen a sus chacras para remover la tierra y quitar las hierbas. Llegado la cosecha, contratan peones, para que cada miércoles por la mañana estén en el mercado de mayoristas de la ciudad comercializando sus productos y con las ganancias obtenidas compran víveres y felices regresan a casa.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y ha demostrando ser una cliente muy responsable en sus pagos, también muy alegre y se lleva bien con todos los miembros de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para la siembra de papas.
texts.en:
Betty is a very happy 29-year-old woman. She lives with her two children in her own house. She grows potatoes on her own small pieces of farmland and on other rented ones. She likes to work on her crops and raise animals, but what she likes most is to work alongside her husband. Betty gets up very early to prepare the food for the day, while her husband cuts the oats and feeds the cows. Around 8am, she tidies up and brings milk to the neighbor, who makes cheeses. After, her husband ties up the cows in the countryside. Betty is responsible for lunch and together, they manage their farmlands to turn over the land and take out the weeds. When the harvest arrives, they contract farm workers so that they can be at the wholesale market every Wednesday promoting their products and with their earnings, they buy supplies and return home happy.

This is her second loan with MFP and she has proven to be a very responsible client with her payments. She is also very happy and gets along well with all of the members of her community bank. She will invest the loan that she is requesting in the purchase of chemical fertilizers for her potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham B. is from the village of Poblacion 1 in Oroqueita City, Misamis Occidental. He is 35 years old. Abraham is separated from spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Abraham owns and operates a barber shop where he gives haircuts to local community members. Abraham has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Abraham joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Abraham is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP that he will use to buy supplies for his business. This will be Abraham's first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his barber shop

loans.name: Siv

texts.en:
Siv C. is a married with three children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling a few types of fish for her existing and new customers at a local market, earning an income of approximately US$5 per day as a primary source of income for her family. The family also is assisted by her husband, who is currently employed at a private security company. He is able to earn a reasonable income to make a living and to help cover their household expenses. 

The members of C.’s family are seeking to improve their standard of living and to expand their current business. Therefore, C. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase fish to stock her store. By doing so, C. hopes that her business will do well so that she is able to generate extra income for future household use. (C. is wearing a brown hat and sitting at her stand to sell her fish. Her stand is near a vegetable vendor's stand.)

loans.use: To buy more fish to stock the store

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Savoeun P., age 22 and his wife, Mrs. Sokna Aun, age 21, (shown in the photo ) live in a small village along the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2006 and just have a young son.

Savoeun and his wife are silk weavers. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village who then distributes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. In addition, Savoeun also grows rice.

Savoeun is requesting his third loan of $500 to purchase silk materials to continue his weaving business. He will also use part of the loan for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for his weaving business and to use for growing rice

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
In order to survive in the midst of crisis, Salvacion and her husband Franky are helping one another earn a living for their family.  They are living in the village of Zamora St. Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya.  They have three children and they are doing their best to send them to school and hoping for them to have a successful life in the future.  

Their common source of income is selling peanuts and school supplies and her husband also works as a laborer in their village.  Being industrious parents, they can earn an average income of not less than PHP5,000.00 a month, which they use to acquire their daily needs and finance the schooling of their children. They are planning to purchase additional items to sell but they lack capital.  With this, they decided to borrow a loan from  KIVA lenders for PHP5,000 that they are going to use to acquire more commodities.  Finally, they believe that this will be a great help for them to improve their way of living.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun T., 47, and his wife, Mrs. Neang Kim, 45, (both are shown in the photo) have been married since 1983. They have eight children: three sons and five daughters. Two of the children are married and live outside the family home, another two are garment factory workers, three attend school and the other one stays at home.

Bunthoeun has been driving a motor taxi for more than ten years, while his wife is a cleaner for a company. Unhappily, a thief stole his motorbike so that Bunthoeun is not able to continue his business. Facing this, he decides to request his first loan of $1,000 to buy a new motorbike in order to continue his business.

It is difficult for him to find a proper place to keep things in the open-air space on the ground beneath his house, and things there are exposed to the elements. Therefore, he will use a part of the loan to build a concrete and brick room under his wooden house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to continue his motor taxi business and to build a concrete room under his wooden house

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 35 years old, and she is married with 5 children. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. During the holidays, her children assist with sales. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She sells sarongs and lace in the market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She is requesting for a loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more sarongs and lace to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and lace to sell

loans.name: Ndèye Khéwé

texts.fr: Ndèye Khéwé M. est âgée de 60 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de tissus, chaussures, et divers alimentaires. Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndèye Khéwé M. is 60 years old, married and has four children. She is active in the trade of cloth, shoes and various foodstuffs. Her aim is to provide for the daily needs of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trade of cloth, shoes, sugar and  other foodstuffs

loans.name: Darlin Marcelino

texts.es: Darlin Marcelino tiene 30 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, el se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para comenzar su trabajo pues tiene que ordeñar la vaca y también tiene que recorrer ciertos lugares para venderla. Por lo que él se prepara en su caballo para movilizarse a vender su producto, el muy famoso por vender muy buena leche el tiene muy buenos clientes además disfruta de su trabajo. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria. Su deseo es seguir adelante con este pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Darlin Marcelino is 30 years old and makes a living in commerce. He has been dedicated to his business for more than five years and wakes up every morning to being his work milking cows and also has to travel by horse to certain places to sell it. He is very famous for selling very good milk and he has very good customers, so he enjoys his work. He is requesting the loan to purchase items of primary necessity. His dream is to keep making headway with his small business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Serreh Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are members of the Serreh Group. The leader of the group is Mariama J.. The 38 year old Mariama was born in neighboring Guinea. She is married to a motor-mechanic and they have 3 children attending secondary school. Mariama has sold “gara lappers” (locally dyed clothes) for more than 20 years now. She will use her share of the loan to further expand her business. She will buy materials for making gara lappers like ink, caustic soda, powder, white cottons, etc.  

Members of the Serreh Group are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni city. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs will be accessing from SMT/Kiva Lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit, and consequently improve their living standards by sending their children to school, feeding themselves and their children, buying clothing, etc.

loans.use: To buy materials for making gara lappers like ink, caustic soda, powder, white cottons, etc

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean G.'s loan will be used to start up an “auto-load” (prepaid loading of cellular phones) business. Since Mary Jean’s village is unreachable by a post paid telecommunication services, people are using prepaid mobile phones. Compared to post paid telecommunication networks, this fits the budget of poor people because loading can be controlled and used only when communication is necessary. Profit from this business is small; however, Mary Jean can patiently wait until it grows while maximizing her earnings for necessary expenses.

Mary Jean joined ASHI just recently, hoping that by having her own business for a source of income, everyday life will be easier despite their being poor. Her husband is a small-time laborer generating just a small amount of income.
