Financing to meet her family’s daily needs is very hard for Mary Jean; hence, she requests a loan from Kiva through ASHI, Kiva's field partner in the Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase prepaid cellular phone load for retail

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 56 years old and married, with one child. She lives in the province of Antique with her husband. To supply additional income for her family, Helen would like to take out a new loan of 25,000 PHP for her business of buying and selling native products and handicrafts.

A dedicated member of ASHI since 2003, Helen is grateful for access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Helen has achieved strong performance with regular attendance at group meetings and timely loan repayments. With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Helen hopes her venture will flourish, deliver steady income, and support the college education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase more native products and handicrafts for resale.

loans.name: Bakht's Group

texts.en:
Bakht M. A. A. is from the mid-size city,Vehari, in Pakistan.  She operates a tailoring business. She sews clothes and returns them on time. Bakht is passionate about her work. Her nature is one of the reasons that customers seek her out. Bakht does this work to share the financial burden with her husband.
Her husband, M. A. A., sells pesticides and fertilizer to  farmers. He has been in this business for over 10 years. They are seeking capital to buy more pesticides and fertilizer to sell.

loans.use: To buy pesticides & fetilizer to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy a "Caldo de Gallina" awning, a bench, and a large table

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is married with six children and only four of her children go to school. Ruth stays in Kanyanya, a suburb in Kampala district.  The family gets three meals a day. She owns a stall selling raw food like bananas, cassava, fruits and vegetables and uses public transport to and from work.  Ruth has been with MCDT for five years and has had many loans. She wants to use this loan of 500,000/= to buy more bunches of bananas, sweet potatoes mangoes, oranges etc. Ruth works seven days a week. She hopes that in the future when she gets her profits she will open up a grocery shop. She joined MCDT because she wanted to get timely loans. Ruth owns the house where the family stays and has access to electricity and piped water at home. Monthly expenses include utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, oranges, sweet bananas and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia C. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 61 years old and has two children. To make a living, Ofelia plants rice and sells her harvest. She has been involved in farming for more than three years. She also started raising pigs to have an extra source of income. 

She joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to buy feed for the pigs. This will be her 8th loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and also feed for the pigs

loans.name: Celeste Mae

texts.en: Celeste Mae R. is from the village of Vira. She is 31 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Celeste Mae owns and operates a specialized store, selling a variety of different personal products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,200 PHP a month. In 2009, Celeste Mae joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Celeste Mae is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna N. is a villager in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province and she was born in 1983. She is a mother of a child who is enrolled in the local public school. Her husband, Mr. Kumphas You, is a teacher at the local school. He is shown in the photo with her.

Mrs. Vanna N. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare (5-acre) plot of land she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is a pig breeder, too.

Since her pig-breeding is going well she wants to expand it. So, to improve her pig-breeding, Mrs. Vanna N. is applying for a loan to buy pig feed and pig vaccine.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and pig vaccine

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida S. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Lida runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. Lida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as  working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Lida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María V. A., tiene la edad de 64 años, está viuda, y tiene un hijo. El tiene 24 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra pollos para granja y compra de cerdos, la idea es criar los pollos y a los cerdos para luego venderlos, y así obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Rosa desea que este negocio le ayude a dar un aporte económico a su casa. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Rosa María V. A. is a 64 year-old widow and has one son. He is 24 years old. She would like this loan in order to buy chickens for her farm, as well as pigs. The idea is to raise the chickens and pigs and then sell them, and in this manner to get the best possible prices when she sells them. This is the first time that she is taking out a loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the service offered to her. Ms. Rosa hopes that this business will help her to provide economic support to her household. In the future, she hopes to offer her family a better quality of life and greater economic stability. She also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs

loans.name: Señor De Accha Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. ACCHA”; Los socios viven en el distrito D. Accha en la provincia D. Calca y  departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra Hilda; ella tiene 33 años D. edad y la socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista; La socia  tiene solo primaria completa, ella se dedico desD. muy jovencita a trabajar junto a su madre y a cubrir las necesidades del hogar, siendo ella la hermana mayor, ayudo a sus hermanos para que pudieran tener día a día alimento y ropa, La socia trabaja hoy en día en el pueblo artesanal D. Pisac vendiendo comida para los artesanos D. la zona y aprendiendo hacer bisutería (aretes, collares, pulseras, brazaletes, llaveros)para tener un ingreso extra. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales, para elaborar la bisutería.

Los otros socios se dedican a la artesanía, internet, venta D. salchipapas, venta D. anticuchos, venta D. tortas, venta D. verduras, atención en emporio.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “SEÑOR D. ACCHA” communal bank. They live in Accha district, Calca province, Cusco department. Hilda, 33, lives with her live-in companion and they have 3 children. She alternates household chores with retail sales. She only finished elementary school. From a very early age she started working alongsiD. her mother in order to cover household expenses. Since she was the oldest sister, she helped her siblings to have food and clothing every day. Today, she works in Pisac, a town noted for its arts and crafts, selling food to the area artisans and learning how to make costume jewelry (earrings, necklaces, armbands, bracelets, key rings) in order to have an extra source of income. She is asking for funds to buy materials and supplies to make the jewelry. The other group members are in crafts, Internet services, salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausage) sales, anticuchos (grilled, skewered beef heart) sales, torta sales, vegetable sales and store management. Hilda values and is grateful for the granted loan because it will allow her to grow and have a better quality of life. She pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies to make costume jewelry.

loans.name: Pablo Cesar

texts.es:
Pablo Cesar es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Las Pampas del distrito de Olmos, un distrito agrícola conformado por un pueblo central y varios caseríos, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado aproximadamente a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura: se dedica a la comercialización de ganado ovino y caprino, el adquiere ovejas y cabras a los ganaderos de zonas aledañas, las engorda y cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente tiene instalado un cultivo de maíz en una pequeña extensión de terreno. Con estas dos actividades el se encarga de solventar los gastos familiares por lo que se esfuerza al máximo para mantenerse en el negocio.

Pablo Cesar desea adquirir mas ovejas para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta, además desea realizar algunas mejoras en sus corrales, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para así poder obtener las ganancias que le permitan realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda. Pablo es una persona bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos le consideran alguien tranquilo y confiable.
texts.en:
Pablo Cesar is a 37 year old father who lives with his wife and children in the Las Pampas sector of the Olmos district, a farming district with a central town and various farmhouses. It belongs to the Lambayeque province and is located about two hours from the city of Chiclayo. He works at various farming related tasks. He sells sheep and goats. He acquires the sheep and goats in the neighboring areas, fattens them up and when they reach a good development level he puts them up for sale to the traders that come to the area where he lives. Also, he grows corn on a small plot of land. With these two activities he covers the expenses of his family, and that is why he works very hard to stay in business. Pablo Cesar wants to get more sheep to expand his business of raising and selling them, and also wants to make some improvements in his pens. In order to accomplish this he has come to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a loan of 1000 New Soles. His greatest desire is to continue growing as a businessman and in this way be able to obtain more income that will allow him to make improvements to the infrastructure of his home. Pablo is a hard working person and dedicated to his family. The neighbors in the area where he lives consider him as a quiet and dependable person.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep to expand the business of raising and selling.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a 39-year-old married lady.  She owns a retail shop where she sells sugar, wheat and maize flour, rice and soap.  She was previously operating a grocery shop.  It's been one year now since she started her retail shop.  She has been able to save her money since she joined Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to increase her business stock. She has requested 35,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, rice and soap.  In five years, she wants to build rental houses.

loans.use: To increase stock of sugar, maize flour, rice and soap

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica C. is a 52-year-old married woman who supports her family by selling fresh and dried fish. She lives in Sitio Pateno, Brgy. Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business activities, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Veronica is now borrowing PHP 27,000 to purchase more fresh and dried fish to sell. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Veronica aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Missie Group

texts.en:
Missie G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Missie Group. She is 47 years old, married, and has seven children whose ages range between 3 and 26 years old. She was not able to attend school due to financial difficulty. She cares for two siblings.
 
For 14 years she has been selling fish in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cartons of fish. 

She describes herself as a very hard-working woman whose dream is to improve her business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy cartons of fish

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
N. Hadijah is a native of Kayunga Town. She radiates humor, warmth and  kindliness. This good-natured mother of 7 has been running her clothes sales shop for the last 5 years in Kangulumira. It’s a business she has relied on to support her family--especially her kids, in terms of education and health care. 

Hadijah also has a rental business that she relies on to increase her income. She is quick to point out that it’s her husband who contributed most to the startup business capital account she had created. All that while she was selling pineapples. Monthly her profit returns are to the tune of 400,000 Kenyan Shillings. With this loan, she says she is going to rejuvenate her business by purchasing more new clothes for resale at her shop.

loans.use: purchasing new clothes for resale

loans.name: Oyunerdene

texts.en: Oyunerdene, a 53-year-old mother of 2 children, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live in a small wooden house. Her husband, Sambuudorj, 55, works in a “Housing Service LLC” as a machinist, and her daughter is a student at Humanities University.  She operates a grocery store in her yard and has been operating her business for over 3 years. Her store has an excellent location, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local residents. In the future, she is planning to purchase large amounts of products for her store to increase her sales. With this loan, she will purchase furniture for her son who currently lives separately.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her son who lives separately.

loans.name: Zelma

texts.en:
Zelma F. is from the village of Brgy.Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old. Zelma is separated from her spouse and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Zelma owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Zelma has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Zelma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zelma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Zelma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Lydia

texts.es: Lydia, de 42 años, convive con Mario, de 42 años. Ella tienen 5 hijos de otro compromiso, pero ahora solo vive con 3 de ellos: Jessica, de 19, Ingrid, de 16 y Hans, de 14 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Ñagazu (selva central peruana). Hace 4 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales sembríos son el café, rocoto y caigua, los que después de cada cosecha, los comercializa en la asociación de agricultores de su localidad; pero la producción de rocoto los comercializa en la capital del país, donde tiene mayor demanda y buena acogida. Pero según afirma Lydia, en épocas de invierno se puede sembrar caigua, por ello ahora invertirá en sus cultivos de café, los cuales son comerciables en todo el año. Por ello más adelante desea comprar más terrenos agrícolas, donde pueda sembrar mayor cantidad de café. Esté es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y se siente en familia, ya que los socios de su banco comunal, son personas responsable y muy trabajadoras. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará de abono orgánico y fertilizantes naturales, que esparcirá en sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Lydia is 42 years old and lives with Mario, age 42. She has five children from a previous relationship, but only three of them still live with her: Jessica (age 19), Ingrid (age 16), and Hans (age 14). She and her family live in their own home located in the indigenous community of Ñagazu (in the central Peruvian jungle). Lydia has been farming for four years, growing primarily coffee, rocoto peppers, and caigua (a type of gourd that is used for medicinal purposes). After each harvest, she sells her products except the rocoto peppers at the local farmers association. The rocoto peppers are sold in the national capital where they are popular and in high demand. According to Lydia, she is able to grow caigua during the winter season but now she must invest in her coffee crop that is sold every year. In order to progress further, she wants to acquire more farmland so that she can grow more coffee.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She feels the members of her Communal Bank are like family since they are responsible and hardworking people. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy organic compost and natural fertilizers to apply on her coffee crops.

loans.use: Purchase organic compost & fertilizers

loans.name: Rita Enrique

texts.es:
Rita, reside en Jocoaitique departamento de Morazán, tiene 38 años, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su esposo de 43 años de edad, él es un lisiado de guerra, tiene siete hijos de 19, 17, 13, 11, 8, 6 y 1 año de edad, todos son dependientes.
Después de los acuerdos de paz Rita y su esposo se dedicaron a la vida productiva, obtuvieron sus tierras para cultivar maíz, café y crianza de cerdos, este ha sido su oficio desde hace ya mucho tiempo,   Por el momento ella solicita un préstamo para comprar cerdos y para la recolección de tres manzanas de café, este préstamo le ayudara a aumentar el número de animales para el crecimiento y engorde.
Doña Rita tiene un sueño y es ver a sus hijos superarse profesionalmente para que puedan optar por un estilo de vida diferente.
texts.en:
Rita lives in Jocoaitique, in Morazán department.  She is 38 years old and her business is raising pigs.  She lives with her 43 year-old husband who is a disabled veteran.  They have seven children aged 19, 17, 13, 11, 8, 6 and 1 who are all still in her care. 

After the peace agreements, Rita and her husband committed themselves to a productive life.  They obtained their land for growing corn and coffee and raising pigs.  This has been Rita's business for a long time.  She is currently requesting a loan so that she can buy pigs and harvest three 'manzanas' of coffee (approximately five acres).  This loan will help her to increase the number of animals she has to raise and fatten.

Rita's dream is to see her children improve themselves professionally so that they can choose a different style of life.

loans.use: To buy pigs and harvest coffee

loans.name: Santos Melania

texts.es:
Santos es una madre de familia de 49 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a un hijo en el caserío Collique, una zona agrícola que está habitada por gente humilde y bastante trabajadora. Pertenece al distrito de Zaña y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a trabajar en labores agrícolas junto a su esposo. Ella cuenta con un pequeño de cultivo en donde suele sembrar maíz. Ambos trabajan unidos para mantener este cultivo y poder salir adelante. Sus cosechas las comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo y depende de los ingresos que obtiene para sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Santos desea adquirir materiales de abono para poder brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y de ese modo pueda asegurarse una buena cosecha. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Santos is a 49 year old mother who lives with her husband and one son in the village of Collique, an agricultural area that is inhabited by modest hardworking people. This community is part of the District of Zaña and located M. than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Santos and her husband have been farming together for ten years. She has a small plot of land where she grows corn. They both work together to maintain this crop so that they can move forward. Her harvest is sold at the wholesale market of the city of Chiclayo and she depends on her earnings so that she can stay ahead with her family’s finances.

Santos wants to acquire fertilizing supplies so that she can maintain her crop and secure a good harvest. For this reason she is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN from Edypme Alternativa so that she can achieve her goal.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizing supplies to maintain her crop of corn

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel, es un hombre soltero y trabajador de, 28 años, que se independizó de sus padres, y ahora vive en la ciudad de La Merced (selva central peruana). Sus padres, Teodoro y Mardonia, son los seres a los que ama y aprecia mucho, por ello constantemente, viaja a Pueblo Pardo, donde ellos viven para apoyarlos en la agricultura, y juntos; siembran desde hace 7 años una variedad de frutas como: naranja, carambola y mango. Los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en la ciudad de La Merced, donde también trabaja en el trasporte público cubriendo las rutas de las ciudades de La Merced - San Ramón, a diario saca una ganancia neta de 30 soles como mínimo. Para el futuro el desea mejorar sus plantaciones, y de esa manera obtener mejores ganancias. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Caramboleros”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se compromete a ser responsable y cumplido con las actividades que desarrolla en su asociación. Samuel se encuentra en la cosecha de mango y carambola, por ello con el dinero del préstamo está pensando comprar 5 bolsas de abono orgánico, para esparcirlos en sus otras plantaciones, y de esa manera obtener buenos frutos.
texts.en: Samuel, 28, is single.  He is independent of his parents and now lives in the city of La Merced (in central Peru).  He loves and honors his parents, Teodoro and Mardonia, very much and often sees them when he visits their home in Pueblo Pardo.  He helps his parents with their farming business.  They've operated the farm for 7 years, growing a variety of fruits: oranges, star fruit and mangoes.  They then sell the produce at the market in La Merced.  Samuel also works as a driver, ferrying passengers on the route between La Merced and San Ramon.  He makes at least 30 new soles every day.  In the future, he wants to improve his crop and, in turn, his income.  He belongs to the Los Caramboleros community bank and this is his first MFP loan.  He has promised to be responsible and to help advance the association's work.  Samuel is growng mango and star fruit.  He will use this loan to buy 5 bags of organic manure that he will spread on his crop to improve his yields.

loans.use: Buy bags of manure for farming business

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark K. is 22 years old. He is single and supports his parents. For the past three years, he has been a hawker, selling foodstuffs, such as snacks and juices, along with second-hand clothes in Narok town. 

Mark learned about KADET from other men in a group already registered with KADET in Narok town. This will be his first loan and he is planning to buy more inventory to sell. Mark hopes to use the profit from his loan to build a permanent home. He is an industrious man who is determined to achieve his objectives. Mark's dream is to build rental houses and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Waseem

texts.en:
Waseem is a young man from Jabalia refugee camp. He is an employee and lives with his parents. Waseem wants to improve the house situation. He painted the walls and took out a loan to purchase furniture such as couches and other items the family didn't have before.

Waseem, who is in the photo, is not married and takes care of his parents and the household expenses.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture

loans.name: Usufu

texts.en: K. is currently in a business of selling food stuffs like sugar, beans and maize. She is 45 years old, married, with 6 children and 3 of them go to school. K. borrowed a loan to stock more food stuffs to sell. In the future, she hopes to build a house for rent with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more food stuffs like sugar, beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Maria Nicolasa

texts.es: Doña Maria Nicolasa V., es una persona casada, tiene 43 años de edad, cuenta con 6 hijos 5 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía al tejido de cortes típicos, cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, inicio siendo trabajadora para otras personas, actualmente quiere capitalizar su propio negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para compra de hilo que le servirá como materia prima para su trabajo, espera que con el préstamo pueda mejorar y crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Maria Nicolasa V. is 43 years old and married.  She has 6 children, 5 of whom are studying.  Maria's business is producing handicrafts, weaving traditional skirts.  She has 4 years experience in this business, having started out working for other people.  She would currently like to capitalize her own business and is requesting a loan to buy thread that she will use as raw material in her work.  She hopes that the loan will enable her to improve and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy thread for her weaving

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena  Hernández Hernández, vive en la localidad de de san  Andrés carrizal  un lugar donde es  muy fresco, ella es casada  y tiene cuatro hijos que a un están a su responsabilidad y son: José Daniel, Samuel, Uriel y leída que es la más pequeña.
      Solicito el  préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, como son: azúcar, frijol, aceite, harina, entre otros, así poder apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos  de su hogar ya que él se encuentra trabajando en otro lugar y así juntos solventar sus gastos generados dentro de su familia.
      Ella decido dedicarse a esta actividad ya que vio que es un trabajo bueno donde se obtiene buenas  ganancias de las que se puede apoyar  y a la misma vez estar pendiente de su familia, que es la que le da ánimo de luchar por la vida.
      Comenta que lo que más deseo es que logre tener ahorros para  agrandar su negocio  y ponerle un nombre  del cual sea llamativo  y su clientela le compre  más mercancía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elena Hernández Hernández lives in San Andrés Carrizal, a place with a cool climate.  She’s married and has four children still in her care:  José Daniel, Samuel, Uriel and Leída who’s the youngest.

She asked for the loan to buy merchandise such as: sugar, beans, oil and flour, among others, to stock her grocery store to help her husband with household income because he’s working someplace else and together they can meet expenses generated within the family.

She decided to go into this activity because she saw it was a good business where good profits are to be had that can help support her while still being able to watch over the family which is what gives her the will to fight for life.

She comments that what she most wants is to save money to expand the business and to name it in such a way that it will be attractive and that her customers buy more merchandise from her.

loans.use: to pay for stock items for her store.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 31 years old and married with three children. 

Candelaria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. 

Candelaria has borrowed and repaid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling of palm toddy. 

Candelaria aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat G. is 38 years old. He is married and he has a daughter who is a student. Azat's family lives in Tsovagyugh village, an area of Sevan.
Since 1997 Azat has engaged in land cultivation and animal husbandry. He raises cows, sheep, horses, a pig and chickens. On his land he grows garlic and potatoes. Azat's wife helps him in farming and thus they solve their family's needs and pay for their daughter's education. 

Azat has received loans from Nor Horizon two times and now he is asking for a 400,000 AMD (Armenian Dram) to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Antoinette est née le 07 Mai 1966 à Natitingou dans le Nord du Bénin. Antoinette est mariée à un électricien nommé Gilbert et a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois encore à sa charge. Antoinette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Depuis treize ans, Antoinette a une boutique où elle vend divers produits (conserves de tomate, des mèches, des tissus, etc.). Cette activité lui génère des revenus l’aidant à répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Antoinette s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Antoinette sollicite à nouveau un crédit afin d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: Antoinette was born on May 7, 1966 in Natitingou in the north of Benin.  She is married to an electrician named Gilbert and has four children, all in school, three of whom are still under her care.  Antoinette lives with her children and husband, and the couple shares the household expenses.  For thirteen years, Antoinette has run a store where she sells various products (canned tomatoes, hair extensions, fabric, etc.).  This business generates income that helps her meet her family’s needs without too much difficulty.  Antoinette buys her products in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She is an old client of ALIDé, having already obtained three loans, which have all been repaid.  Facing a growing customer base, Antoinette is requesting another loan in order to increase her business activity and better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, cosmetic products, and fabrics.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 36 años, es una mujer muy amable y sencilla, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Liz el negocio de la venta de ropa ha sido una actividad que le a ayudado a obtener los ingresos necesaR. para sostenerse por si sola. Ella a sus 18 años decidió salir de la casa de sus padres y hoy es una de las vendedoras de ropa más solicitadas de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya tiene  6 años en esta actividad y considera que le gusta mucha esta actividad, sin embargo caminar todo el día en busca de clientes le resulta muy cansado, pero de ello depende para ganar más dinero. Espera que ustedes la puedan ayudar con un pequeño préstamo para pueda tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con más comodidad su mercadería. Este será su cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa, para así incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en stock.
texts.en: Liz is 36 years old she is a nice and humble woman. She lives in her own home with her 4 loving children to whom she wishes to give a better quality of life. For Liz, her clothing business has been a job that has helped her earn the income necessary to support herself. At 18 years old, Liz left her parents’ home and today she is one of the most sought after clothing saleswomen in the city of Pucallpa. What she enjoys most about her work is talking to her customers, she has worked in this field for 6 years and says she really likes it but walking all day looking for customers is very tiring but she depends on it to earn more money. Liz hopes that you will help her with a small loan so that she can have a larger store where she can sell her merchandize more comfortably. This is her fourth loan with MFP and knows that she has to pay on time and is willing to do so. In her communal bank she is a very happy and responsible member. With the twelve hundred nuevos soles, Liz will buy more clothing to increase the quantity of her merchandize in stock.

loans.use: buy more clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Gelderia

texts.en:
Gelderia is 42 years old and lives in Upper Disakan, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with six children. Gelderia works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to buy fish to sell.

Gelderia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Gelderia hopes to make her business grow to help her family.

loans.use: to buy different kind of fish for her fish-selling business.

location.town: Dipolog-Upper Disakan, Manukan, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, aged 42, is married to Hannah.  They are blessed with three children, six, nine and eleven years old.  George has run a retail shop for 11 years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES.54,000.

This is his sixth loan with KADET LTD., and he has a very good credit history.  He will use the funds to buy rice, sugar, flour, soap and other items for resale.

George intends to use the expected profits to build his own shop and hopes to have a supermarket in future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour, soap

loans.name: Segundo Galo

texts.en:
Segundo Galo, who goes by his middle name, is 54 years old. He lives near the city of Latacunga, Ecuador, with his wife and four children. His children are aged 31, 24, 26 and 25 years old. Galo also has several grandchildren. He is a cheerful person who gets along well with his neighbors and always works hard to provide the best he can for his children.
Galo makes and sells typical Ecuadorian food. His specialty is “cuero”, a popular food made with the fried skin sections of pork. In the photo, Galo is holding a bag full of cuero cut into squares and ready to bring to the market to cook and sell. He also sells popular accompaniments such as potatoes and beans. He sells his wares at fairs and parties across the province. Galo has been running his business with his wife for 12 years. He is seeking this loan to buy more products to make and sell. Thanks to past loans, Galo reports that he has been able to invest in his business and watch it grow incrementally. In the future, he wants to work hard and buy a cart so that he can sell more of his wares. Galo appears in this photo with his wife and some of his grandchildren.

loans.use: to invest in his food production business by purchasing more pork, beans and potatoes.

loans.name: Josepina

texts.en:
Josepina is married, with 9 children. Josefina is 59 years old and lives in Timan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.  Josepina sells food for snacks to earn a living. This is a new business.

She has requested a loan of PHP3000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending.  Josepina has been a member of PMPC just this year.  In the future, Josepina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: Doña Fabiola cuenta con 32 años de edad y es originaria de una localidad donde su principal actividad económica es la venta de borregos y el cultivo de aguacate. Ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos dos estudiantes de primaria y una pequeña de un año. Ella se dedica a vender borregos desde hace 5 años con su esposo los ofrece en su localidad, ella esta pidiendo un crédito por que quiere invertir en nuevo negocio que es en la venta de zapato por catalogo de diferentes marcas ella ira a la ciudad de México a los distribuidores autorizados a surtir los zapatos y los ira a vender a la gente de su comunidad y los venderá en dos pagos para que a la gente se le facilite comprárselos y para aclientarse con la gente de su localidad. La meta que tiene Fabiola es poner empeño en su nuevo negocio y mas adelante poner un local en su comunidad donde también venda accesorios para dama. Ella esta muy agradecida por este préstamo ya que esta muy emocionada por que tendrá otra entrada de dinero con lo cuál les dará una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Doña Fabiola is 32 years old and originally from a town where the main business activities are selling sheep and growing avocados. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in elementary school while the youngest is a year old. Fabiola and her husband have been selling sheep for five years and offer them for sale in her town. She is requesting a loan because she wants to invest in a new business selling shoes through catalogs of different brands. Fabiola will travel to Mexico City to visit authorized distributors so that she can receive a stock of shoes and sell them to people in her community. She will sell the shoes for two payment installments so that people can easily buy them. This will also help build up the customer base in her town.

Fabiola’s goal is to establish her new business and eventually open a store in her community where she can also sell women’s accessories. She is very grateful for this loan and is very excited about having another source of funds by which she can provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her new catalog sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy detergent and an iron

loans.name: Victoriana

texts.es:
La señora Victoriana y su esposo el señor Juan Martín tienen una hermosa familia. 
Están solicitando un préstamo ya que tiene los gastos escolares y no cuentan con el dinero necesario para pagar la inscripción y comprar lo útiles que son libros, cuadernos, carpetas, plumas y lápices. Desean que sus hijos tengan la mejor educación y los estudios necesario para que su futuro se mejor. 
Doña Victoriana se dedica a la atención y cuidados de sus hijos, el que se encargas de los gastos familiares el Don Juan Martín, con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como chofer de maquinaria pesada. Con una parte de este ingreso pagaran el préstamo.
texts.en:
Victoriana and her husband Juan Martín have a beautiful family.
They are requesting a loan as they have to pay for school expenses and do not have the money they need to pay for registration fees and to buy school supplies such as books, notebooks, folders, pens and pencils. They want their children to study and to get the necessary education to have a better future.
Victoriana dedicates herself to tending to and caring for her children; it’s Juan Martín, who works as a heavy machine operator, who is in charge of paying for family expenses with the wage he earns from his job. They will repay the loan with part of this income.

loans.use: To pay for registration fees and school supplies for the education of her children.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 25 years old, married to Esther Nelima.Together they have three children. His primary business is transportation. He has been in the business for the past three years. He gets a monthly income of KES 30,000.

This is his first loan with KADET. He plans to buy 15 bags of dried maize, to start a maize business. He plans to repay the loan with the anticipated profit from the business. His dreams and hopes are to expand his business and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy dried maize.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 7 children and all go to school. She has one additional family member. She lives in her house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Agnes sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 15 years. She has requested for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to sell wholesale only and also to build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a mother of five children, Merlita works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a carinderia (a local eatery). Merlita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Doris; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo como guía de turismo y también tiene su carro que hace servicio urbano, por medio de este trabajo y de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere terminar de construir su casa y quiere ampliar el negocio de transporte. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como yesos y arena y para el mantenimiento de su carro como llantas.
 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Doris belongs to the "Señor de los Temblores-Poroy" communal bank. It is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cisco province and department. She is 22, in a common-law relationship, and has a son. 

Along with her daily activities, she works as a tourist guide, and also uses her car as a taxi. By means of this work and her business, she is raising her son. 

She wants to finish building her house, and expand her taxi business. She is applying for the loan to buy construction materials, such as plaster and sand, and to maintain her car; including buying tires.  Doris is happy about the loan, and promises to make her instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as plaster and sand, and for the maintenance of her car, including buying tires.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a 34-year-old married man and has two children.

Adel has been the owner of a men's clothing shop since 2000, selling men's clothing and accessories. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to repair and fix his shop’s floor and ceiling and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to repair and fix his shop’s floor and ceiling and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.es: La Sra. Anacleta  la venta D. desayunos, te , café se dedica a esta actividad hace mas D. veinticinco años, cuenta con domicilio propio que se encuentra en la zona D. los Ladrilleros, necesita el crédito para la compra D. material D. construcción para  poder construir en su casa una cocina comedor, ya que esto le facilitara la elaboración D. comida rápida y así poder vender en su zona por las tardes y noches comida rápida, ya que vio por su zona la oportunidad D. poner un mini restaurante para que los trabajadores D. ladrillo tengan un buen ambiente donD. cenar o desayunar, la Sra. Anacleta es una persona muy amable y dinámica se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Anacleta sells breakfasts, tea, and coffee. She has been engaged in this business for more than twenty-five years years. She has her own home located in an area with brick makers.

She needs the loan in order to purchase construction material in order to build a kitchen in her house. This will help her in making fast food and, thus, enable her to sell fast food in her neighborhood in the afternoons and evenings. She sees an opportunity to put a small restaurant in her neighborhood since the brick-making workers would have a nice atmosphere in which to have dinner or breakfast. Sra. Anacleta is a very friendly and dynamic person. She is thankful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a kitchen.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 60 years old and lives in the town of Cho with her three children, all of whom are married. She earns a living running a shop where she sells videotapes, DVDs and CDs. She has been in this line of work for five years and earns about 5,500,000 Vietamdong (VND) a month. She joined SEDA in 2007 and has taken out five previous loans which she repaid fully and on time. She is applying for a new loan, for 9,632,000 VND, to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy videotapes and videodiscs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Manepeh Group

texts.en:
The “Manepeh” group consists of small scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan for  4,000,000 SSL from SMT in order to expand their respective businesses. 

The leader of this group is Kassah, who is 30 years old, married and has three children, two of whom attend school.  She was born in Manepeh village and currently resides in Magburaka town. Her husband is a businessman.  For 17 years, Kassah has been selling loaves of bread and fish. With this loan, she will buy bags of flour and baskets of fish in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour and baskets of fish.

loans.name: Diana Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora Diana es socia del banco comunal Pauteñitas (Cuenca), vive por el cantón Paute lugar que es privilegiado por su clima templado, la población de Paute es una de las más laboriosas y emprendedoras Cuentan con gastronomía típica y disposición de los más atractivos platos típicos, la producción de flores, hace de este cantón un verdadero jardín, se cultiva para exportación, rosas de la más alta calidad.

La Señora Diana tiene 23 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 4 años y 8 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como cocinero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife, esta actividad la desempeña hace 3 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. También se dedica a la cría de  cerdos.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y en su alimento.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Diana is a member of the Pauteñitas (Cuenca) communal bank. She lives in the Paute canton, an area with a wonderfully mild climate. The residents of Paute are very hard-working and enterprising. The region has a traditional and delicious cuisine. Flowers, including the highest quality roses, are cultivated in this canton for export; the whole canton is like a garden.

Diana is 23, married, and has one child who is four years and eight months old. Her husband works as a chef. They do not have their own home; they rent.

Diana has sold Herbalife products for three years. She works every day of the week without a fixed schedule. She also raises hogs.

This is her second loan in the communal bank, and she will invest it in the purchase of hogs and hog feed.

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy hogs and hog feed.

loans.name: Ma Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora María Guadalupe de 40 años es casada y madre de dos hijos una niña de trece años y un joven de diez y ocho años que aun dependen económicamente de ella y su esposos, ella vive en una casa de interés social desde hace 11 años cuando ellos se cambiaron a esta casa La señora Mary estaba ya cansada de las carencias económicas y de falta de atención que tenia para sus hijos ya que en ese entonces ellos tenias 2 y 7 años y ella decidió que tenia que hacer algo para apoyar los gastos del hogar sin tener que descuidar a sus hijos y esposo y fue de ahí que le surgió la idea de vender dulces, frituras, galletas, galletas refrescos y de esta manera obtener un ingreso para su familia y así poco a poco Mary fue teniendo una gran variedad de productos en su negocio y este ha sido la única fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia por ello es que La señora Mary solicita el apoyo para compra de mercancía y surtir negocio ella quiere estar preparada con los productos que mas se venden en esta temporada navideña y requiere el apoyo para compra de platos y vasos desechables, carbón, refrescos y frituras.
texts.en: 40-year-old María Guadalupe is married and has two children: a 13-year-old daughter and an 18-year-old son.  Both children are still financially dependent on her and her husband.  Mary has been living in government-subsidized housing for 11 years.  When they moved to this house, Mary was already tired of their lack of financial resources and the lack of attention that they were able to give their children who were then 2 and 7 years old.  She decided that she had to do something to contribute towards their household expenses without neglecting her children and her husband.  This is when she had the idea to start selling sweet treats, fried food, cookies and soft drinks, thereby making an income for her family.  Mary gradually acquired a wide range of products for her business which has been the only source of income for her and her family.  For this reason, Mary is requesting support so that she can buy more merchandise and stock her business.  She wants to be prepared by having available the products that she sells the most of during the Christmas season.  She needs support to buy disposable plates and cups, charcoal, soft drinks and fried food.

loans.use: to buy groceries, snacks, soft drinks and dairy products for her business

loans.name: Filipenses 4:13 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Filipenses 4:13 está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras la coordinadora del grupo se la señora Rosa Ramona quien vende ropa y tiene una fritanga desde hace 15 años. Ella es casada tiene seis hijos de los cuales el menor depende de ella. En el negocio le ayudan sus dos hijas y una nuera. 
Las otras integrantes son Rosa Argentina quien vende verduras  golosinas y Francisco quien tiene un taller.
texts.en:
The Filipenses 4:13 Group ("Philippians 4:13") is composed of three hard-working and enterprising people. The coordinator of the group is Señora Rosa Ramona who has been selling clothes and fried snacks for 15 years. She is married and is the mother of six children, of whom the youngest depends on her. She is helped in her business by two daughters and a daughter-in-law.

The other group members are Rosa Argentina who sells vegetables and candy, and Francisco who has a workshop.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, meat, cheese, chicken, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Karla

texts.es: Karla, de 39 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, es una mujer con mucha decisión y muchas ganas de luchar ya que es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 5 años a quien cría con la dedicación y esmero que solo una madre puede hacerlo. Juntas viven en su casa propia y lo que más desea es trabajar muy duro, para brindarle una buena educación. El local comercial de Karla está ubicado en su propia casa, en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, ella se dedica a la venta de calzados, como sandalias, zapatillas, zapatos nuevos y de segunda, productos que son traídos desde Lima. Su negocio es muy concurrido, ya que los modelos que trae son novedosos y baratos, trabaja sola y día a día aprende mas del negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es vender y es muy feliz cuando vende toda su mercadería, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad, le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene una muy buena cartera de clientes quienes van en busca de sus productos cómodos y de buena calidad. Espera mas adelante poder tener una tienda más grande de calzados donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este será el quinto préstamo con MFP, esta muy contenta por que le brindarán un respaldo financiero y así podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo, sabe que tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo muy puntual. Está contenta de pertenecer su banco comunal ya que son muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mas mercadería ya que desea armar su campaña escolar y así tener listo los calzados para sus clientes.
texts.en:
39-year-old Karla is a very unassuming and hard-working woman.  She is a very decisive woman who has a great desire to work hard as she is a single mother and has a 5-year-old daughter who she is raising with the commitment and care that only a mother can provide.  Karla and her daughter live together in their own home and what Karla most wants is to work very hard so that she can provide her daughter with a good education.  Karla's business premises are located in her own home, in a central area of the city.  Her business is selling footwear such as sandals, sports shoes, new shoes and second-hand shoes, which she brings in from Lima.  Her business is very popular as the styles that she brings are the very latest and also cheap.  She works alone and every day she learns more about her business.  What Karla enjoys about her work is selling and she is very happy when she sells all her merchandise.  She has been in this business for four years and it is going very well as she has a good group of customers who are looking for comfortable, good-quality products.  She hopes, in the future, to be able to have a larger shoe store where she can sell to her customers more comfortably.

This will be Karla's fifth loan from MFP.  She is very happy to be receiving this financial support as it will enable her to increase her working capital.  She knows that she will have to be very responsible and, above all, punctual.  She is happy to belong to her community bank as the members are all very supportive.  Karla will use her 2,000 soles to buy more merchandise as she would like to get ready for the back-to-school season and have available all the footwear that her customers want.

loans.use: to buy more school shoes

loans.name: Honronya  4 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants, les dix membres du groupe Honronya 4 vivent toutes dans le village de Kondia dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’avoir des intrants agricoles à leur disposition en début d’hivernage et faire recours à la main d’œuvre, elles ont rejoint Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Les membres du groupe vont cultiver l’arachide, le mil, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Kadia (femme en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux sacs d’engrais, faire le labour de son champ de mil et de gombo. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Ségou, Cinzana gare et en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes du village. Avec une superficie de 1 hectare, elle espère produire 2 sacs de mil, une vingtaine de baignoire de gombo,  2 sacs de niébé et des fanes. En plus des fanes de niébé, une partie de la production du mil, du gombo et de niébé sera vendue pour gérer les petites dépenses du foyer au quotidien tandis que le reste serait auto consommée en famille.

loans.use: Achat d’engrais et faire recours à la main d’oeuvre

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Shalom” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; feriantes, comerciantes, librería, bazar, venta de adornos navideños, venta de ropa, venta de juguetes, venta de longanizas, venta de empanadas, servicios entre otros, Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Coronel.
Edith, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha  a izquierda, viste un chaleco de color negro, usa cartera de color café claro, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, verduras y comestibles varios desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a domingo, algunas veces le ayuda sus hijos, habilito un espacio en su casa para su negocio y atender a su gran numero de clientela. Ofrece frutas y verduras frescas, además bebida, cecinas y helados.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en ferias libres donde encuentra verduras y frutas frescas  y los demás productos a proveedores de marcas importantes de cecinas y bebidas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará frutas y verduras.
Una de las metas de Edith es tener su negocio más grande y agregar maquinas para los productos congelados, así generar mayores ingresos para optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Edith vive junto a sus tres hijos de 20, 16 y 5 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral  agrandar su negocio y a nivel familiar darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Coronel es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Bíobío. Posee una economía basada en servicios, explotación forestal, agricultura. Cuenta también con una importante tradición minera en carbón, actividad que ya no se realiza, pero de la cual quedó la mina de carbón “Chiflón Puchoco”, convertida ahora en museo minero.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called Shalom and is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who make a living in various businesses, including market stalls, merchants, bookstore, hardware store, Christmas decoration sales, clothing sales, toy sales, sausage sales, empanada sales, and services, all in the city of Coronel.

Edith is a member of the communal bank group.  In the photograph she's seated in the first seat on the right in the first row.  She's wearing a black jacket and a light brown purse; she wears her dark-brown hair loose.

She has made a living for a year selling fruits, vegetables, and food.  She says she works from Monday through Sunday.  Sometimes her children help her.  She fixed up a space in her house for her business and she waits on a large number of customers.  She sells fresh fruits and vegetables as well as beverages, cured meat, and ice cream.

She buys the merchandise she needs in street markets where she finds fresh fruits and vegetables.  She buys the rest of the products from distributors of major brands of cured meat and beverages, at a low cost so it's economical.

With the loan she'll buy fruits and vegetables.

One of Edith's goals is to expand her business and add machines for frozen products to generate more income and aim for a better quality of life.

Edith lives with her three children, ages 20, 16, and 5.  Her dream for work is to expand her business and her dream for her family is to give her children the best.

She's very happy about and grateful for this opportunity from Fondo Esperanza because it will allow her to invest in her business.  With regard to her communal bank group, she says they have very good communication.  Also, the trainings have helped her learn new sales and accounting strategies.

Coronel is a community in the south of Chile, near the city of Concepción in the Bíobío region.  Its economy is based on services, lumber, and agriculture.  It also has an important coal mining tradition, which is no longer done but from which remains the Chiflón Puchoco mine, now a mining museum.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Yénoukoumè

texts.fr: Yénoukoumè âgée de 46 ans, est mariée à un maçon du nom de Claude. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Yénoukoumè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par le couple.  Pour ce faire, Yénoukoumè vend de la nourriture( riz, pâte accompagnés de diverses sauces). Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Yénoukoumè achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Yénoukoumè sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments, du maïs, du riz et de l'huile.

loans.name: Georgine

texts.fr:
Georgine a 58 ans. Elle est  mariée. Son mari s’occupe de l’agriculture. Le nombre d’enfants est de quatre  tous déjà mariés. 
Georgine crée l’activité d’élevage de vache laitière depuis 1990.  La production de lait de l’élevage dépend de la qualité et de la quantité de l’alimentation. L’élevage et l’agriculture sont les principales sources de revenus du couple, les revenus tirés de ces  activités lui ont permis de subvenir aux besoins de la famille . Elle prévoit de monter une ferme et diversifier les activités  par l’élevage de poules pondeuses dans l'avenir.

loans.use: acheter des provendes, maïs, sons, foins.

loans.name: Freddy Rogelio

texts.en:
Freddy is a very hard working and responsible man, but above all he is a highly enterprising. Some time ago he worked as a driver with a company, but they paid him very little and it was not enough to cover the family expenses, nor enough to cover the education of his three children. In his spare time he learned how to be a carpenter withthe help of a friend. Some time later he started his own shop, the very same one that is running now thanks to his dedication and perseverence.

Thanks to this business that Freddy started he has been able to provide his children and his wife with a better quality of life. In order to maintain his business, he requires a loan of $925 that he will use for the purchase of wood to increase his production and consequently his income. Become an important part of Freddy's increasing success, and help him.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Freddy es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, pero sobre todo es una persona altamente emprendedora. El hace tiempo se desempeñaba como chofer en una empresa, sin embargo le pagaban muy poco y esto no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos familiares, ni a cubrir la educación de sus tres hijos. Por ello en sus ratos libres aprendió el oficio de carpintero por medio de un amigo que le enseñó. Luego de un tiempo inauguró su propio taller, mismo que sigue en servició hasta ahora a base de dedicación y constancia.

Gracias a este proyecto que Freddy comenzó hace algún tiempo ha podido brindarles a sus hijos y su esposa una mejor calidad e vida. Para poder mantener y hacer crecer su negocio, el requiere de un préstamo de $925 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en la compra de madera y aumentar su producción y consecuentemente sus ingresos. Vuélvete parte importante del crecimiento de Freddy y ayúdalo.

loans.use: purcahse wood

loans.name: Alixis Esplenda

texts.en: I sell quality second-hand clothing, and I use my earnings to support my children. I have been doing this job for two years since I have been unable to find steady work and need to help my family. Selling used clothing is a good business since not everyone is economically able to pay for new clothes in stores.

loans.use: Purchase of quality second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
My name is Exaltación Hernández and I am a traveling salesperson for women's products, such as creams, deodorants, nail polishes, nail files and other such things. I sell my products on the street, as well as in different private and public offices. I've had my business for two years now and my goal is to increase my product stock so that I can make more sales and cover my home expenses.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Mi nombre es Exaltacion H. me dedico a la venta ambulante de productos para dama como ser cremas, desodorantes, esmaltes para uña, limas y otras cositas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, mi producto lo vendo en la calle y tambien visito diferentes oficinas privadas y estatales, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor venta y con las ganancias que obtenga poder cubrir con los gastos de mi casa.

loans.use: purchasing nail polishes, deodorants, nail files, creams, perfumes

loans.name: Shu Godlove

texts.en:
Shu Godlove is one of the few bamboo suppliers in his area.  Bamboo is used to construct fences, animal sties and to make furniture. Before starting this business, he was unable to pay school fees for his two children.  His children were being continuously sent away on fee drives.   This led him to look for capital to start selling bamboo.  He came in contact with GHAPE through other members. Since then he has obtained three loans with which he has made money to pay for his children's school fees.

Given a loan of $500, he plans to continue in the same line of business and use the profits to pay his children’s school fees and to improve his business.  He plans to repay the loan in 18 months.  The first repayment installment will be made four months from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo and pay for transportation

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat, 53-years old, married and mother of two children, runs a small clothing business in the village of Deir Qanoun, close to the city of Tyre, South Lebanon. In order to adapt to the financial situation of the people living in her neighborhood, she offers a large variety of clothes in different price ranges. She buys cheap clothes from Syria and sells them at affordable prices to low income households. She also buys good quality clothes from Dubai that she sells to financially better-off families. Hayat started to buy goods from Dubai after her elder son moved there.  

This is the second time Fatmeh requests a loan from Al Majmoua. She is requesting a loan of $600 so her son can purchase scarves and women's underwear in Dubai and ship the goods to Lebanon. 

Fatmeh is part of a group loan with other women from the same village. A group is usually constituted of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. The group lending is based on incremental increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community. It is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: To purchase of scarves and women's underwear and increase the inventory of her clothing shop

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María is 55 years old and lives in the district of La Esperanza, in the province of Trujillo and region of La Libertad. She was unable to finish her studies due to lack of parental support. She has 9 children -3 of them are dependent on her.

She has a business in the Bellavista market, which is located in the same area in La Esperanza. She is the owner of a grocery store that sells items like potatoes, carrots, vegetables, and spices. Previously, María traveled along the streets and within the markets to sell her products but later had the opportunity to buy a place to set up her current business.

María joined Banco Comunal "Bellavista" after receiving an invitation from another business merchant. Her first loan of $100 was used to buy entire condiments at wholesale prices, which she ground, packaged, and sold in smaller quantities. The recent loan from Manuela Ramos will be paid off in installments over 6 months. It will be used to fix her store's roof. María dreams of having another store to sell other items or renting it for ultimately more income.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María tiene 55 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. La Esperanza provincia D. Trujillo departamento D. La Libertad. No pudo estudiar por falta D. apoyo D. su padre, tiene 9 hijos D. los cuales 3 aún dependen D. ella.

Tiene su negocio en el mercado Bellavista ubicado en el sector del mismo nombre del distrito D. La Esperanza, ella es dueña D. un puesto en el cual venD. abarrotes, papas, zanahorias, verduras y especias Anteriormente la señora María vendía sus productos como ambulante por las calles y dentro del mercado pero tuvo la oportunidad D. comprar un puesto y es allí donD. ahora realiza su negocio.

La señora María ingresó al Banco Comunal “Bellavista” por invitación D. otra comerciante del mercado. Obtuvo su primer crédito D. S/.300.00 ($100) con los cuales compró condimentos enteros al por mayor para luego molerlos envasarlos y venderlos en cantidades pequeñas. El reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos para pagar en un plazo D. 6 meses, le sirvió para invertir en arreglar el techo D. su puesto. La señora María sueña con tener otro puesto para vender otras cosas o para alquilarlo y poder tener mayores ingresos.

loans.use: To buy condiments at wholesale

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. T. Sophoin, 33, and her husband have been married for 3 years and have one son. Her husband works in another province and does not come home so often. She lives with her parents and her brother who is a driver for a pure drinking water company. Sophoin and her family have been in the business of doing farming for many years. She is raising pigs, growing melons, and planting bananas.

Sophoin is requesting her fourth loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $500. She will use this loan to buy feed for raising pigs and some amount for her farming of melons and bananas.

loans.use: Buy feed for raising pigs and doing farming.

loans.name: Kireku A Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for six months.Florence is a tailor. Firida and Ruth both have restaurant businesses. Phoebe sells used clothes and wants to use the loan to purchase additional stock. Zaituni sells charcoal. With the extra business profits, Florence wants to start a tailoring school.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea Velis and her husband own their own home on the Huanta Street, in the Alto Chijini area, in the city of La Paz. Dorotea is 64 years of age and sells "cholita" footwear on Max Street. She has run this business from a very young age. Now she needs a loan for increasing her capital and to improve her income. Her husband is losing his sight, and she will have to run her household expenses on her own. Her credit history qualifies her as a good customer and with this she is able to get her new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Dorotea Velis y su esposo tienen vivienda propia en la calle Huanta, zona de Alto Chijini, ciudad de La Paz. La señora de 64 años de edad se dedica a vender calzados de cholita en la calle Max paredes. Ha mantenido este negocio desde muy joven. Ahora, solicita crédito para incrementar su capital y mejorar sus ingresos. Su esposo esta perdiendo la vista y ella mantendrá sola su hogar. Su antecedente histórico lo califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To increase her capital (INCREMENTO DE CAPITAL)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To produce music  CDs and tapes.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra sells women’s clothing in her hometown, the Casabe community of Santo Domingo. The entrepreneur is twenty-seven years old and the mother of four daughters ranging from six to twelve years old, all of whom attend school.
Alejandra has been selling her goods for three years. Recently, she took from FSMA a loan which she invested in the purchase of a collection of fashionable clothing.  She managed to repay successfully the loan, and this could increase significantly her income. Now, the entrepreneur is requesting a second loan to buy more goods since her products are in high demand at the moment.  Alejandra wants to have money enough to keep supporting her daughters’ educations.

loans.use: To purchase women's clothing to resell in her community.

loans.name: Sergio José

texts.es:
Mr. Sergio is an accountant and works full time in a company and additionally does other jobs in his free time. Don Sergio is married, has a son of school age for whom he wishes to be able to provide all the education necessary to become a professional. Don Sergio’s wife is a merchant and helps with the maintenance of the home. He is requesting a loan to make improvements to his house. He is going to build a wall in the back part of his house as a security measure for him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit. Kiva volunteer.

Don Sergio es Contador, y trabaja en una empresa de forma permanente aunque también hace otros trabajos adicionales en su tiempo libre.
