Don Sergio es casado y tiene un hijo que se encuentra en edad escolar, y al que Don Sergio desea poder darle todos los estudios necesarios para que llegue a se un prefesional. La esposa de Don Sergio es comerciante y le ayuda en el mantenimiento del hogar. Solicita el préstamo para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, va a levantar un muro enla parte trasera de su casa, como medida de protección para él y su familia.

loans.use: Build a wall in the back part of his house.

loans.name: Mahmudova

texts.ru:
M. Mahmudova is in business of selling women's shoes. Before obtaining her first loan, she had one sales location, but by the time she finished paying it back she decided to rent two more sales locations. Her sons will work as vendors. For this purpose she needs to purchase more summer shoes. She would like to continue borrowing through MicroInvest and is very thankful to Kiva for the support.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Махмудова Муаззам женщина имеющая бизнес реализации обуви ,в начале первого кредита имела одну точку продажи. но на конец зйма успешно заканчивая займ она решила арендовать ещё два лорька, где продавцом у нее будут два сына .Для чего ей необходимо ещо финансов для пополнения ассортимента летней обуви.Для чего она хочет продолжть кредитоваться в Микроинвесте, она от всей души благодарна КIVA за понимение и подержку.

loans.use: sale of women's shoes

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a married mom with one daughter. She runs a small business selling leather goods in the local market of Nikolaev called "Sigma-sport". Her business doesn't face much competition as there are very few other businessmen with similar products. Tatyana started this venture about a year ago. However, she has already making about $400 in profit each month.

Tatyana is seeking a loan of 5000 Grivnas for 8 months. She is hoping to see her business grow further and expand even more. On the personal level she would like to invest a part of profits generated in remodeling of her apartment which has been her dream for awhile. Tatyana is known as an entrepreneur of integrity and determination. We believe her commitment to her venture and personal characteristics will help her repay the current loan without any problems.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
Manuela is a 38 year old married woman who lives in barrio 380. She has two children, ages 8 and 13. Her husband works in security services and provides for the expenses of the home. Maunuela sells tortillas and boiled beans - a business that she started with her own money 4 years ago to help out with family expenses. With the money that she is requesting from this loan, she will invest in infrastructure - purchasing construction material to add on to a bedroom in order to improve conditions. She plans on eventually opening a small store, finishing work on her home, and allowing her children to get an education.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Manuela tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380, es casada, y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 13 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Doña Manuela vende tortillas y frijoles cosidos, tiene cuatro años de experiencias y comenzó con dinero propio para aportar a los gastos de la familia. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para infraestructura, para comprar materiales de construcción para realizar una extensión de una habitación, para estar en mejores condiciones. Sus planes son poder llegar a tener una pulpería, terminar de construir su casa y brindar estudios a sus hijos.

loans.use: Addition to a bedroom

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La Señora Julia, socia del Banco Comunal “Judith Tuanama”, vive en la región  y  provincia de El Dorado, distrito de San José de Sisa. Se dedica a la venta de granos como maíz, café y cacao. Cuenta con bastante tiempo en este negocio y le va bien. El negocio está ubicado en su propio domicilio en el Jr. Bolognesi  Nº 239, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar los clientes que son los mayoristas de la localidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2000, el cual será cancelado en 6  cuotas, comprará  cacao, maíz, café en grandes cantidades a los productores para poner a le venta a los mayoristas y los recolectores de estos granos que llegan de Tarapoto. Quiere tener bien surtido el negocio y aprovechar las cosechas que hay por su localidad.

Julia tiene 35 años de edad,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos, su esposo es quien la apoya en el negocio. Su  meta  es continuar con el negocio y llegar a ser mayorista y tener un almacén.
texts.en:
Julia, a member of the communal banl "Judith Tuanama", lives in the region and province of El Dorada, in the San José de Sisa district. She works selling grains and beans such as corn, coffee and cacao. She has been workiing in this business for some time now, and the business is going well for her. Her business is located in her home at 230 Jr. Bolognesi. The local wholesalers who are her clients come daily to that location to buy from her.

With this loan for 2000 Peruvian soles, which she will repay in 6 monthly payments, she will buy cacao, corn and coffee in large quantities from the producers, in order to later sell it to the wholesalers and other bulk buyers of these products who come to her town from Tarapoto to buy. She wants to have the business well stocked and to take advantage of the good harvest in her local area.

Julia is 35 years old and lives with her husband and children. Her husband helps her in the business. Her goal is to continue with the business and to one day be a wholesaler with her own warehouse.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large quantities of coffee, cacao and corn

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi E. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il réside à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est revendeur des insecticides et herbicides, une activité prospère étant donné que c’est une zone rurale et la principale source d’activité est l’agriculture. Il espère, avec ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV, faire plus de stocks en marchandises pour satisfaire aux besoins de la clientèle sans cesse croissante. L’augmentation des ventes va engendrer un accroissement des profits, ce qui lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi E. is 35 years old, married, with two children. He lives in Danyi, a village located about 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He sells insecticides and herbicides – a prosperous business given that this is a rural area with agriculture as its main source of income. With this second loan from Kiva Field Partner FECECAV, Koffi E. wants to increase his stock in order to better meet the needs of his ever-increasing clientele. The growth in sales will generate more profit, thus allowing him to better provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To puchase herbicides and insecticides to resell

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola  vive en la calle “ 4 “  de la zona Puerto Mejillones en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Ella es soltera vive junto a sus padres
Se dedica al comercio de artículos escolares en  una librería que instalo en su domicilio, con lo cual se ayuda económicamente para proseguir sus estudios.

El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de mayor  mercadería (cuadernos, lápices, gomas, etc.). 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Fabiola lives on Fourth Street in Puerto Mejillones in the city of El Alto.

She is single and lives with her parents. She sells school supplies from a bookstore setup in her home which economically supports her own studies.

She intends to use this loan for the acquisition of more merchandise (notebooks, pencils, erasers, etc.).

This is the first loan with Impro. The evaluation deemed her qualified to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase articles for her bookstore such as pencils, erasers, notebooks, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira forma parte del Banco Comunal “Señor Del Cautivo II” del distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Comenta que su mayor dificultad es encontrarse sola en esta ciudad porque es de la ciudad de Lima y toda su familia se encuentra en dicho lugar, también comenta que a pesar de todo, su negocio le ha traído muchas sonrisas, porque ha podido colaborar con su esposo para construir su casa y ampliar su negocio. En la actualidad no le va muy bien en el negocio porque tiene mucha competencia. Vende ropa de manera ambulatoria en el pasaje del Banco de la Nación en la ciudad de Huaraz. Ha pensado abandonar el negocio porque poco a poco está bajando la venta por la presencia de muchos vendedores de sus mismos productos, aunque menciona que actualmente está pensando diversificar sus productos y tiene la esperanza de mejorar sus ventas en esta campaña navideña, para lo cual contará con la ayuda de su esposo.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,300, el cual será cancelada en 8 cuotas, invertirá en la compra de juguetes, paraguas y casacas a pedido.
 
Elvira afirma que su trabajo es muy valioso para su crecimiento personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Elvira is a member of the “Señor Del Cautivo II” community bank in the district and province of Huaraz, in the department of Ancash. She is a 55 year old married woman with 3 children. She says that the hardest thing for her is to not know anyone in the city, since she is from Lima, where all of her family is still located. On the other hand, she says that her business has brought her much happiness, because she has been able to work with her husband to build her home and increase her business. Currently, her business has not been doing well due to competition. She sells clothing door to door near Banco de la Nacion in the city of Juarez. She has considered giving up her business due to low sales and the prevalence of other vendors selling the same products. At the same time, she says that she has considered diversifying her product line, homing to improve her sales leading up to Christmas time, when she will receive help from her husband. With this loan of 2,300 soles, which she will repay in 8 payments, she will invest in the purchase of toys, umbrellas, and jackets which she offers on order. Elvira affirms the fact that her job is very important to her personal and family growth.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toys, umbrellas, and jackets.

loans.name: Miriam Francisca

texts.es:
Miriam, como muchas mujeres bolivianas, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 18, 9 y 6 años de edad; el esposo la abandonó hace cinco años y ella se convirtió  en padre y madre de sus hijos. Miriam trabaja como comerciante de víveres y también tiene una tienda donde confecciona polleras y mantas para cholitas. Vive en la casa de su padre ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio – Rio Seco, de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (telas) para confeccionar mayor cantidad de polleras y mantas, pues esta actividad es la que le genera mayores ingresos.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite la aprobación del préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Miriam, like many Bolivian women, is a single mother of three children, ages 6, 9 and 18; her husband abandoned her five years ago and she became both mother and father to her children. Miriam sells food and also has a shop where she makes traditional gathered skirts and shawls for mestizo women. Miriam lives with her father in a house located in the Villa Ingenio–Rio Seco area of El Alto. The loan is for the purchase of fabric for making high quality skirts and shawls, as this is the business that generates most of her income. This is her first loan with Impro. After an assessment she was approved for the loan she had requested.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora D. is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children; five girls and two boys. She says some of her children have completed school while others are still in junior high school. She lives with her family in Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Dora works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables. Dora sells foodstuffs. She sells plantains, cassava, yams, etc on a table top by the roadside. Dora buys her goods from Kintampo in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana and sometimes from the farmers in the surrounding villages. She has been in business for four years. She also distributes cassava and plantains to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators. She wants a loan to buy the foodstuffs in bulk so that she can cut down on costs, as in frequent trips to procure the goods, and also to maximize profit.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa es socia del Banco Comunal “03 D. Mayo”, del centro poblado Santa Bárbara, distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 53 años D. edad, es madre soltera con 03 hijos a su cargo y posee estudios D. primaria completa. 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 04 años, se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa; su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, con lo cual pudo adquirir mas mercadería (ropa) para venderlo en las ferias locales D. Ilave. 
Con este préstamo D. S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales; podrá adquirir mas mercadería (ropa al por mayor) para continuar ampliando su negocio y llevar a las ferias D. Puno y Juliaca; su anhelo es tener una tienda D. abarrotes donD. pueda estar mas tranquila, sus ganancias las ha ido invirtiendo en la educación y alimentación D. sus hijos. 
Ella agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado y se siente comprometida con su grupo.
texts.en:
Josefa is a member of the "03 D. Mayo" Communal Bank in the town of Santa Bárbara, in the district of Llave, in the province of El Collao, in the Puno area. She is 53 years old and a single mother in charge of 3 children and she completed her elementary school studies. She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years. She buys and sells clothes. Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she used to acquire more merchandise (clothing) to sell at important local fairs. With this loan of 1000 nuevos soles, she agrees to commit to paying in 5 monthly payments. She will be able to acquire more merchandise (mostly clothes) in order to continue growing her business and take her goods to the fairs in Puno and Juliaca. Her wish is to have a grocery store where she work at a less hectic pace. She has invested her earnings in education and food for her children. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the support given and she feels committed to her group.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise (mostly clothes) in order to continue growing her business and take her goods to the Puno and Juliaca fairs; her wish is to have a grocery store where she can take it easier; she has invested her earnings in education and food for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Chanthoeun I is a villager in Sro Nge village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Meas Nouy, is a pig breeder. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Chanthoeun I decided to ask for a loan to buy more pigs to resell to earn more income. She is a 44-year-old mother of three children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to resell.

loans.name: Kari Marina

texts.es:
La señora Kari S. es una dama que desde cuatro años inició su negocio de pulpería con pocos ingresos pero que a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo logró mejorar las condiciones del negocio.

Ella es madre de dos pequeños hijos los cuales requieren de su apoyo y por ser madre soltera debe de brindarles todo lo que ellos requieren.
El motivo por el cual espera en Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos porque le urge adquirirlos a lo inmediato para ofertarlos.
texts.en:
Ms. Kari S. started her grocery store four years ago with limited resources. She has been able to improve its condition as the years pass.

Ms. S. has two small children who depend on her. She is a single mother and all their responsibility falls on her.

She is hoping to obtain a loan from Ceprodel to buy supplies for her store as soon as possible to sell them.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Primer prestamo:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82717
Felicita  es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino.
Felicita es conviviente  tiene 47 años, cinco hijos  de 28, 26, 22, trabajan y están casados los menores de  14 y 11 años  están estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Felicita aprendió de su mamá el negocio de venta de calzado, su mama ya no trabaja y le dejo el negocio desde hace quince años, ella es ambulante.
Felicita necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de saldos de zapatos  en gamarra.
Desde que esta en Finca, puede invertir, las capacitaciones de negocio que recibe son de ayuda para crecer en su negocio.   
El sueño de Felicita es viajar a otro país para trabajar.
texts.en:
First loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82717 Felicita is a member of the Niño Divino microfinance institute. She lives with a partner, is 47 years old, and has five children, three of whom aged 28, 26, and 22 work and are married. The younger children aged 14 and 11 study in public school. Felicita learned the business of shoes sales from her mother, who no longer works and left the business fifteen years ago and now travels. Felicita needs a loan of 1,200 soles to purchase shoes on clearance at Gamarra. Since she has been in Finca, she has been able to invest and the business training she receives has been helpful in growing her business. Felicita's dream is to travel to another country to work.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Felicita needs a loan of 1,200 soles to purchase shoes on clearance at Gamarra.

loans.name: Kotognontala (Let's Speak The Same Language) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kotognontala est un regroupement de femmes du quartier de Hamdallaye Koutiala (région de Sikasso) qui se connaissent bien. Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris et  leurs enfants. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans, sont mariées et sont  mères d’au moins 4 enfants. 
Elles mènent  une seule activité à savoir la teinture et vente d’habillements.
Pour augmenter la taille de leur activité, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Le montant du prêt est passé de 50.000 FCFA au premier prêt à 75.000 FCFA pour le troisième prêt. Tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des bazins, de la   teinture, de la soude caustique et d’autres ingrédients.
Elles se procurent  de leurs marchandises à Bamako (la capitale de la république du Mali). Elles vendent les bazins, tissus et pagnes finis (c’est-à-dire teints de colories et de motifs différents)  au grand marché Koutiala et dans les marchés environnants.
Les membres du groupe Kotognontala comptent réaliser un bénéfice de 90 000 FCFA chacune au  cours de ce cycle. En plus du remboursement des intérêts du prêt, elles utiliseront une partie du revenu pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Kotognontala is a group of women of the Hamdallaye Koutiala district (region of Sikasso) who know one another well. They live in large traditional families with their husbands and children. They average 30 years of age, are married, and are mothers with at least four children.

The group members have a sole business, namely dyeing cloth and selling clothing. To expand their business, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. The loan amounts have gone from 50,000 francs CFA for the first loan up to 75,000 francs for the third loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

The current loan will be used to buy damask fabrics, dyes, caustic soda, and other ingredients. Supplies are gotten in Bamako (capital of Mali). The damask, cloth, and finished pagnes (that is, dyed lengths of cloth of different colors and motifs) are sold at the grand market of Koutiala and in surrounding marketplaces.

The group members plan on realizing a profit of 90,000 francs CFA each in the course of this cycle. In addition to making loan interest payments, they will use a portion of the revenues to address common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy damask fabrics and ingredients for dyeing cloth

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie runs a hog raising business out of her home. She is 51 years old and is married to Ricardo, who is a carpenter. The couple works hard and helps each to meet their daily financial needs. Her hog raising business is doing well however she lacks capital to sustain their daily feed supply. This is the reason why Rosemarie is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000. 

Rosemarie believes that through her business she can support her children until they can complete their studies in college. She has four children; Raymond is 23 years old and is a college graduate, Reynald is 22 years old and still a college student, Richard and Ronnie who are 20 and 18 respectively are also still in college. Rosemarie works hard to provide for their needs in school and is hoping that someday all her children become successful.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: Zulem

texts.es:
Zulem es socia del Banco Comunal Capulí.
Zulem es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 1 hijo, Zulem tiene un puesto en el mercado Vivanco en donde vende pollos que compra de las avícolas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Zulem necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido para la compra de muebles para su casa.
Los sueños de Zulem es mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Zulem is a member of the Capulí Communal Bank.
Zulem is 31 years old, has one child and lives with her partner. Zulem buys chickens from poultry farmers and sells them from her Vivanco market stall every day.
Zulem needs a 2000 PEN loan to purchase furniture for her home.
Zulem dreams of improving her business and giving her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her home

loans.name: Los Centeno Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Claudia del Carmen Vásquez Martínez, Lucrecia del Carmen C. G. y Heyling de los Angeles Sequeiro.

El grupo solidario Los C. está compuesto por tres mujeres trabajadoras, originaria de la ciudad de Masaya, en la comarca La Reforma, empezaron a obtener crédito con Adim a través de referencias con clientas de la institución que les dijeron que se prestaba con fianza solidaria por no tener garantías. 

Doña Claudia del Carmen es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya, el crédito lo usó para comprar perecederos variados y así ofrecer más productos a su clientela. Ella es madre de dos hijos pequeños, su esposo trabaja por cuenta propia y le ayuda con los gastos. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda para tener más seguridad y proteger más a su familia.

Doña Lucrecia del Carmen C. es una  mujer vende frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya en un puesto fijo, ella tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, la aprendió de su madre. Tiene dos hijos jóvenes que ya trabajan por cuenta propia y también su esposo le ayuda con los gastos. Sueña con mejorar su lugar de venta para estar más cómoda en su puesto de trabajo.
Doña Heyling se dedica a la elaboración de ropa en su casa, ella entrega su producción en el mercado de Masaya a personas dueñas de tramos que luego ponen en exhibición sus prendas de vestir como cotonas bordadas y blusas de mujer, ella vive con dos hijos, sueña con tener su propia vivienda para cuando ellos crezcan.. Con el crédito ella ha logrado capitalizarse en su negocio, crecer en variedad de inventario.

El grupo está comprometido con quedar bien a Adim para seguir obteniendo créditos y seguir trabajando mejor.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Claudia del Carmen Vásquez Martínez, Lucrecia del Carmen C. G. y Heyling de los Angeles Sequeiro. The Los C. group is comprised of three hard-working women, who are natives of the city of Masaya in La Reforma. They began to obtain loans from Adim through references from the institution's customers who told them that they made loans without collateral. Claudia del Carmen is the coordinator of the group. She has a business selling fruit and vegetables in the Masaya market. She used the loan to purchase various perishable items and offer more products to her customers. She is mother to two small children. Her husband works on his own and helps with the bills. Her dream is to improve their home in order to have more security and protect their family more. Lucrecia del Carmen C. is a woman who sells fruit and vegetables in the Masaya market from a stall. She has been dedicated to this activity for many years. She learned it from her mother. She has two young children who already work on their own, and also her husband helps with the bills. She dreams of improving her stall so she can be more comfortable when she works. Heyling is dedicated to making clothes in her home. She delivers her products to owners of sections in the Masaya market who then put her clothing -- such as embroidered cotton, women's blouses -- on exhibition. She lives with two children. She dreams of having her own home for when they're grown. With the loan, she has been able to capitalize on her business and grow the variety of inventory. The group has promised to stay in good standing with Adim so they can continue to obtain loans and continue to work better.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 59 años, es madre soltera, vive con su hija mayor, quien también es madre soltera, con su hijo que trabaja para apoyarla y una hija pequeña. Ella es propietaria de un motocarro que compró hace 2 años, el cual es manejado por su hijo quien se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros desde hace 6 años. Él vela por el mantenimiento del motocarro y todas las ganancias del día se las entrega a su madre para que ella las administre. Antonia se dedica a las labores domésticas y al cuidado de su hija menor quien tiene síndrome de dawn agresivo y necesita de permanente atención. Ella considera que lo bueno de su negocio es que su hijo es muy responsable y las ganancias son buenas. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes trabajan bien y son comprometidos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará llantas, repuestos y otras herramientas necesarias para mandar a reparar su motocarro.
texts.en:
Antonia, 59, is a single mother. She lives with her oldest daughter, also a single mother, and her son. He works to support her and a small daughter. Antonia has a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized cart) that she bought two years ago. Her son drives it. He has been offering passenger transportation services for six years. He takes care of the maintenance of the motocarro. He gives her all of his daily earnings for her to manage. Antonia does all of the domestic chores. She also takes care of her youngest daughter who has severe Down’s Syndrome and needs constant attention. The good thing about her business is that her son is very responsible and the earnings are good. This is her third loan with MFP. What she likes about her community bank is that all of the members work well and are committed. She will use the money she is asking for to buy tires, replacement parts, and the necessary tools to repair her motocarro.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized cart)

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Miss. C. Kou, age 24, is single. She lives with her parents along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

C. has been a garment factory worker for ten years. She wants to buy cows to raise, but she doesn’t have any money. Thus, she is applying for a loan of $1,000 to make the purchase.

It will be better for her to have more income from selling cows when they grow big enough.

loans.use: To purchase cows to raise

loans.name: Sandra Mireira

texts.es: Sandra Mireira R. reside en Ciudad Arce ubicado en departamento de La Libertad. Con tan solo 25 anos Sandra ha tomado la decisión de crear su propio negocio y es así como lleva ya dos años atendiendo su tienda, Sandra vive solamente con su esposo quien es empleado y obtiene un sueldo de $150.00 US  mensuales, a pesar que llevan muchos años juntos aun no han dado el paso de tener hijos ya que desean estabilizar su economía para poder traer un hijo al mundo  por el momento Sandra está enfocada en hacer crecer su tienda, y por eso que solicita este crédito para poder surtir su negocio el cual le generara mayores ingresos
texts.en:
Sandra Mireira R. lives in the Acre City in the department of La Libertad, El Salvador. At only 25 years of age, Sandra decided to start her own business and now has two years experience tending to her store. She lives with her husband who works and earns a salary of 150 U.S. dollars a month. Although they have been together for many years, they have not taken the step to have children since they want to stabilize their finances before bringing a child into the world. At the moment, Sandra is focusing on her store, which is why she is requesting the loan so she can stock her business and thus generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe N. owns and manages a small piggery. Currently she has a sow, which she feeds and bathes every day. She lets her sow produces piglets, and the young pigs produced by the sow are sold for 2,000 PHP each. This has been her business since 1998. She has two children, the eldest being 10 years old, who are her inspiration to perform better in her business. 

She needs a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will use the loan to construct a durable barn and buy additional feed for her pigs. The loan is truly worthwhile because she doesn’t have funds to use to support her business. 

She chose CEVI because they offer a very low interest loan, plus insurance coverage awaits CEVI borrowers.

loans.use: Piglets and feed

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife D. is a rice farmer. She has four children who are all studying. Her eldest child dreamed of becoming a teacher someday. That is why, she works so hard to be able to grow her business and support the ducation of her kids.

She would like to apply a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the farming necessities to grow her harvest. 

She said she started in CEVI last April of 2009. Now, its her second loan and she started to like the program already.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María Del Carmen M. F. reside en Mejicanos municipio de San Salvador. María es madre soltera, vive solamente con su hijo Erick de 2 años de edad. María siempre ha sido una persona muy responsable y trabajadora lo que ha dado como resultado catorce años de éxito en su negocio, un comedor que lleva por nombre MARY. El destino del crédito que solicita María, es para comprar vitrinas, mesas y pintar local; con el objetivo de mantener  un espacio agradable para sus clientes.

loans.use: Mejoras a su negocio

loans.name: Poy

texts.en: Mr. Poy L. lives in O Kralang Duol village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. He is also a pig breeder. He is 40 years old and the father of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two are enrolled in the local school. The youngest child is too young to work or study. His wife, Mrs. Seang Phall, is a fish seller in the local market. Mr. L. decided to ask for a loan to buy four more piglets, pig food, and fertilizers. He would use the rest of loan to buy more fresh fish to resell.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy four more piglets, pig food, fertilizers, and he would use the rest of loan to buy more fresh fishes to resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Peuk

texts.en:
Peuk S. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Siem Reap province. She is a good housewife who stays at home and looks after the children and cooks for the family members. Her husband is a construction worker building houses. He typically makes about US$ 10 a day.

Peuk S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 for her husband who needs to purchase construction tools.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia O. is from the village of West Kibawe Bukidnon. She is 55 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Sonia owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. Sonia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Sonia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Sonia is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Sonia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread.

loans.name: Ginafe

texts.en:
Ginafe D. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Ginafe is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Ginafe makes and sells specialty food products in the local community. Ginafe is just starting this business.

In 2009, Ginafe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ginafe is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ginafe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for making food items

loans.name: George Otieno

texts.en: George runs the Apolo general shop where he sells household goods and foodstuff to frequent customers. He also provides cab (taxi) services using a motorcycle. His shop is located in a busy market centre serving the urban poor. He serves mainly the lower income earners and the general public. He has one employee and has been in this business for three years. His business challenge is during the long rainy season that keeps customers away.  He is using the proceeds to buy a motorcycle to boost his income. His goal in life is to own a taxi so that he can be able to expand the transportation business. George is married and has two children. He describes himself as a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for taxi services

loans.name: Coumba Radio

texts.fr: Coumba  Radio N. est une femme de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de divers produits tels que chaussures. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt augmenter son capital afin de subvenir à l’amélioration des conditions de vie, de scolarité et de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Coumba Radio N., age 54, is married and the mother of three children. She sells various items such as shoes. She would like to use this loan to bolster her working capital, in order to provide for her family's healthcare and school expenses, and to improve the living standard of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell shoes and other items

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos tiene  33 años de edad, es casado y actualmente tiene 2 hijos a su cargo.  El señor brinda el servicio de triciclo, este negocio lo inicia hace 6 años, cuando decidió iniciar con los financiamientos que le han sido de mucha ayuda ya que fue así cuando inicio su negocio. Cabe señalar, que con los ingresos que le ha dejado su negocio ha logrado mejorar los ingresos a su familia Juan es un hombre que todos los días lleva una botella de agua para poder aguantar todo el día los diferentes recorridos que realiza. El crédito será invertido para proporcionar mejoras a su triciclo. El sueño con respecto al negocio es que este crezca y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos is 33 years old, married and has two children under his responsibility at this time. He provides rickshaw services; he started this business 6 years ago when he decided to obtain loans which have been very helpful; this is how he started his business. It is appropriate to note that with the income received from his business he has been able to improve the income for his family. Juan is a man that carries a bottle of water every day so he can endure the various trips he makes throughout the entire day. The loan will be invested in providing improvements to his rickshaw. He dreams with growing his business to improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oqtay

texts.en: Oqtay S. is 53 years old and works as a merchant selling building materials in his home village of Agsu city. He is married and has three children. Oqtay started his business eight years ago and owing to his easygoing character and friendly attitude toward customers, he gained respect and a wide clientele. Oqtay would like to expand his business and for this purpose he applied for a loan amounting to 1600 AZN. You can be an important part of this hard-working man's business.

loans.use: purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
S. is 49 years old and a mother to four children: one is married and lives separately and the others are single and under her care.

In the beginning of 2000, S. built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells a few types of cooking ingredients to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. To help feed the family, her husband earns a living as a security guard for a company.

S. is a hardworking woman who tries to earn money in order to send all her kids to the university. She needs a Kiva loan to increase the inventory of her store.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her store

loans.name: Jose Aurelio

texts.es:
El señor Jose es trabajor de la empresa ENACAL desempeñándose como operador de la maquina en la pila séptica.
Jose va usar el crédito para la compra de cerdo para destace ya que el trabaja de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana se dedica al comercio de carne de cerdo.
El espera que con la compra de cerdo para destace pueda obtener otros ingreso. Jose es acompañado y tiene un hijo .Este es el primer crédito con Ceprodel.
texts.en:
Jose is a worker for a business calles ENACAL. He is a machine operator for the septic system. Jose is going to use the loan to purchase a pig to butcher. He works Monday through Friday and on weekends works in the pork business. He hopes that with the purchase of the pig to butcher he will be able to get more income. Jose has a partner and he has a son. This is the first loan that he has had with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a pig to butcher

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo M. labora en una universidad de Managua con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su amada familia compuesta por su esposa y sus hijos.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, para la remodelación  de la vivienda en la que habita ya que necesita la pronta inversión para reconstruirla y lo estará llevando a cabo con el objetivo de brindarle a su familia mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor LEONARDO M. O. works as a security guard in the Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua (Autonomous National University of Nicaragua). He is married and the father of 4 children who are in high school. He and his wife have been able to make the the family progress. The loan applied for is to invest in the purchase of construction materials for remodeling their home, with the goal of offering his children greater security and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving and enlarging his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more hair extensions, cosmetics and hair cream to sell

loans.name: Shirley's Group

texts.en:
Shirley A. is from the village of Danipa. She is 35 years old. Shirley is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Shirley A..

Shirley is single. To make a living, Shirley owns & operates a business selling a variety of different products in her general store. Shirley has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 40000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Shirley joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Shirley has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Shirley from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Vic

texts.en: Vic A. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 28 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Vic owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP every harvest. In 2009, Vic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be his fourth from ASKI. Vic plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen lives with her family in Borewala, a city of shrines in Pakistan. She has two children who are getting their education. Her husband has a timber selling business. He purchases timbers from the market and then sells them at a good profit. 

A caring lady, Parveen stays at home taking care of her children and carrying out her responsibilities as a housewife. She has applied for a loan for the fifth time from Asasah to improve the business of her husband. With the loan amount, he will buy timbers in bulk which will minimize his cost of purchase.
 
Parveen hopes that by making an investment in her husband’s business, it will improve with the passage of time and one day her family will be able to overcome its financial problems.

loans.use: Purchase timbers for resale

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda A. is from the village of San Isidro, Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Erminda is separated from her spouse and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erminda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bananas, and also coconut for coco charcoal, in the local community. Erminda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Erminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to purchase and  sell. Erminda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Erminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital.

loans.name: Dorally Andrea

texts.es: Dorally Andrea tiene 50 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de taxi, ella dio inicio por su esposo ya fue por medio del el que la obtuvo, ella busca la mejor manera de administrar su negocio, por lo que desde muy joven ha tenido que aprender a trabajar para mantener a sus hijos y prepararlos y que sean personas de bien. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de materia prima como es reparar la unidad de taxi y realizar la compra de llantas, focos y otros repuestos. Sueña con obtener otro automóvil para trabajar.
texts.en:
Dorally Andrea is 50 years old. She runs a taxi service that she was given by her husband. She is seeking the best way to manage her business. She has desired since she was very young to learn to work to support her children and prepare them to be good people. She is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to repair the taxi and to buy tires lights and other parts. She hopes to obtain another car for the service.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: G.s. Los Cocos Group

texts.es: Maria Isidora, Eulalia Ines, Cristina de la Concepción, Rosario y Ángela conforman el grupo solidario Los Cocos. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realizan juntas.  Eulalia se dedica a la venta de frijoles,  ella tiene 44 años, inicio hace 4 años con la venta de tortillas pero con las mismas ganancias que obtenía fue que se decide establecer la venta de frijoles, Rosario se dedica a la venta de leche y leña, Ángela a un taller de costura Maria Isidora que también se dedica a la venta de leche y Cristina se dedica a un taller de costura. Ellas son personas muy independientes, ya que siempre han demostrado ser muy responsables. El financiamiento que solicitan es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para sus negocios.
texts.en:
Maria Isidora, Eulalia Ines, Cristina de la Concepción, Rosario y Ángela are members of the communal bank "Los Cocos" (The Coconuts). This is not their first loan application. Eulalia sells beans. She is 44 years old. She began to sell tortillas four years ago, but, when she discovered she could earn the same income selling beans, she switched to beans. Rosario sells milk and wood. Angela and Cristina have sewing workshops, and Maria Isadora also sells milk. They are very independent and have already proven to be very responsible. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase essential business materials.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase essential business materials

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka P. is from the village of Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old, single and has 3 adult-aged children. Milka owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Milka has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Milka joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milka has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Milka is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Milka from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh A. is 31 years old. He is married and has one child. He is a small-business entrepreneur who sells different kinds of detergents like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, shaving cream and washing powder as well as foodstuffs in his store. His monthly income is 250-400 AZN. Taleh is not alone in this business. His wife actively helps him with sales. 

Today, Taleh is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Taleh’s main goal is to increase his profit enough to open one more store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more food products

loans.name: Sobia's Group

texts.en:
Sobia is a resident of Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is 32 years old and works in a medical dispensary on a monthly wage. Her husband operates a scrap shop in the market. Sobia has given birth to two sons and two daughters. Two of them are getting their education. 

Sobia and her family live in a small two-room house in the area called Mughalpura. Sobia and her husband work hard to meet the financial and educational expenses of their kids and they wish to enroll their other kids in school as well. Her husband has five years of experience in the scrap business. He deals with wood & iron. He buys items at cheap rates and sells them to factories at a good profit. 
 
Sobia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy scrap and increase his sales. Sobia is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her second loan. In the previous loan year, she proved herself a responsible person who paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Sobia.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Batbuyan

texts.en:
Batbuyan O. is 47 years old and lives with his wife and seven children in Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in a rented yard. 

Batbuyan's oldest son, age 24, attends university.  His eldest daughter, age 21, recently graduated from college and is seeking employment as a teacher.   Two other children, ages 19 and 17, are both college students while his youngest three children, ages 13, 11 and 7, attend school. 

Batbuyan and his wife operate a retail business out of two  rented stalls at a local market. They began their business in 1998 and have built a stable and successful operation. The couple has managed to rent two stalls at a second local market by selling a variety of consumer goods such as socks, shoe polish, adhesive tape, stationery, soap and washing powder, etc. In the future, Batbuyan would like to increase his product line. 

Additionally, he produces a variety of steel and iron items such as fire tongs and steam bowls to supplement his earnings. His earnings have enabled him to pay his two children's tuition fees. In the future, Batbuyan plans to have his own fence. He is a open-minded and hard-working businessman who says, “My wish is to educate my two younger daughters in order to make them better people.”  Batbuyan is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase small household items for his retail business.

loans.use: To purchase small household items to sell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann W. M. is 28 years old and married with two children who are 12 and 14. Her husband is a driver. Ann has a business making and selling table clothes, covers, bedspreads, and curtains. She also repairs garments for her local customers. Ann’s business is located at Mukuru Kwa Njenga and she is served by the Kitengela branch. Ann has been in this business for ten years and her business is profitable. 

Ann’s major challenges are financial constraints and competition. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well and describes herself as hardworking, God-fearing, and business-minded. Ann will use her loan of 20,000 KES to buy more materials and thread to expand her business and meet customer demand. Ann hopes to be able to export her products in the future. She also sees herself owning a plot of land on which her family can build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more materials and thread

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima H. lives in the Kasenke 2 neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of four grandchildren.    

H. has a charcoal business.  She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works six days out of every week. She sells her products from home at retail prices.    

She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal. She also generates additional income through her rentals and piped water. The main business challenges for H. include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to get her own delivery van and start wholesale selling only.  

H. lives in a home that she owns and where she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees for her grandchildren and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for the expansion of her clothing sales business. She plans to use the loan to buy a variety of clothes in bulk from the Ichra and Shahalmi wholesale markets in Lahore and sell them to her local area clients. This bulk purchasing will minimize her costs of purchasing and traveling.

Zainab, 56 years old, is married to M. S. and has no children. Her husband has a power loom (a hand-operated machine for weaving thread or yarn into cloth) business. Zainab has been operating her clothing sales business for over 30 years and has vast knowledge about the latest clothing trends and fashions. She hopes that an investment will bring many positive changes to her business, enabling her to live better and to save money for the rainy days.

Zainab lives in Kasur, located in the Punjab region of Pakistan, famous for its tanneries. Her home is in located in the small residential area of Dungipura where she has been living since her marriage. Zainab is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself to be a responsible client, never missing a single meeting and paying her installments on time.

Note: In the photo, Zainab is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Magno

texts.es: Magno, de 46 años, convive con Rafaela, de 46 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos, en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Centro Culebrayoc. La siembra de papa, habas, alverja, y verduras, es su principal actividad, ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Los días miércoles, viernes y domingos, que son los días donde vende en mayores cantidades en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta a Magno, es poder cuidar de sus cultivos, por ello pasa la mayor parte del día en sus terrenos agrícolas. Ahora quiere mejorar sus cultivos, para comenzar a comercializarlos en la capital, y está seguro que con la calidad de sus cosechas logrará grandes éxitos y buenas ganancias. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y está contento con todo el apoyo que recibió de su banco comunal, que son personas solidA. y muy comprometidas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono orgánico y fertilizantes naturales, para esparcirlos en su producción de papa, que ya muy pronto cosechará en estos meses.
texts.en:
Magno who is 46 lives with Rafaela, also 46. Together they have 6 children but only 3 live with them in their home in Centro Culebrayoc. For the past 20 years he has made a living farming potatoes, beans, peas and vegetables. Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays are the days he sells the most in the Tarma city wholesale market. 

What Magno enjoys most about his work is caring for his crops and that is why he spends most of his day in the field. Now he wants to improve his crops in order to sell them in the capital. He is sure that with the quality of his crops he will be successful and profitable. 

This is his tenth loan with MFP and he his pleased with all the support that he has received from his community bank. The members are supportive and committed. With the loan he is requesting he will buy organic and natural fertilizers, for his potato crop that he will be harvesting in the coming months.

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Johana Margarita

texts.es:
Johana de 24 años, es estilista ambulante hace 3 años atrás. Viviendo en una zona periurbana llamada Perimetral a trabajado haciendo pedicura, manicura y cortes de cabello. 

Ella ha trabajado como estilista ambulante para poder mantener a su hijo de 7 años que estudia en una escuela fiscal. Su trabajo lo realiza llegando a la casa del cliente y llevando sus instrumentos de trabajo realiza lo que le piden. Una de las complicaciones que tiene al salir a trabajar es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde vive. 

Ella quiere seguir prosperando y con esfuerzo darle una buena vida a su hijo por eso quiere tener un comedor y comenzar con el préstamo comprando víveres de primera necesidad para vender los platos de comida. En el futuro quiere tener un local para ubicar su comedor y tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
24 year-old Johana has been an itinerant stylist for 3 years.  She lives in a peri-urban area called Perimetral and she works providing pedicures, manicures and hair cuts.

Johanna works as an itinerant stylist to support her 7 year-old son who is studying in a state school.  She travels to her customers' houses with her work tools and carries out whatever service they request.  One of the complications that she has in going out to work is the crime that exists in her area.

Johana would like to continue prospering and, through her hard work, provide a good life for her son.  For this reason, she would like to open an eatery and use this loan to start buying some essential foodstuffs so that she can make and sell meals.  In the future, she would like to have premises for her eatery and also own her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Dinara's Group

texts.en:
Dinara K., 31, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Bokonbaevo, a nice village in Isykul region. Unfortunately, Dinara is a widow. She has two sons and a daughter. The sons are at school and the daughter is not yet. Dinara works as a nurse; her monthly salary is 3000 soms. Four years ago with the initial investment of 30000 soms, she started to breed livestock animals. In order to make additional money to cover family expenses, she resells livestock after fattening at the higher price. In this way, she earns additional 5000 soms. With money received from the loan, Dinara wants to purchase a cow for breeding. In the future, she wants to provide her children good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.es:
Hermenegilda pertenece al banco comunal “Kukuli” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene cuatro años de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva. 
Hermenegilda, tiene 39 años y tiene dos hijos, ella nació en el departamento de Cusco provincia de la Anta en la comunidad de Mollepata. Actualmente, la socia Hermenegilda vive en el distrito de Wanchaq de la ciudad del Cusco.  

Hermenegilda y su pareja tienen un pequeño negocio de venta de comestibles. Desde el año 2004 la socia se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. María Luisa con el microcrédito desea comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, azúcar y muchas cosas más.
texts.en:
Hermenegilda belongs to the “Kukuli” Communal Bank of the UMF Arariwa Association of the city of Cusco, Perú. The Communal Bank has been in operation for four years and is well managed by its governing board.

Hermenegilda is 39 years old and has two children. She was born in the department of Cusco, province of Anta in the Mollepata community. At present, Hermenegilda lives in the district of Wanchaq in the city of Cusco.

Hermenegilda and her partner have a small business selling foodstuff. Since 2004 the member has worked in her business and she has done very well thanks to all of her hard work. With the loan she will buy more merchandize like rice, spaghetti, sugar and other items.

loans.use: To buy more merchandize like rice, spaghetti, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a member of Maridadi group registered under Faulu Kenya.  He does plumbing so as to earn his daily bread.  He has been in the business for seven years.  He was previously farming before he went into this business.  Kennedy is married and a father of three.  He works hard to provide for his family including educating his children.  He hopes to own a real estate in the future.  He needs 40,000 Kes to buy pipes and fittings.

loans.use: To buy pipes and fittings

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is married to Akram and they have one daughter and two sons; the oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 2 years old.

Fatima's husband is a taxi driver who drives passengers between cities in the Gaza Strip and in Dier el  Balah. Tafima took a loan from FATEN as her husband needs to perform car maintenance to keep his taxi in good shape.

Fatima's husband Akram appears in the picture here as she is a religious woman.

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua O. is married to a driver, and they have four children. She has received a junior high education. Ekua sells packaged sugar cane and plantain chips at Takoradi near Effiakuma Estate.   She has been doing this for 7 years.  Ekua uses her income to pay part of the school fees for her children.

Ekua will use the loan to purchase more sugar cane and plantain for resale in order to grow her business. 

In this picture, Ekua is standing close to her sugar cane and the nicely packaged fried plantain chips (which are located on top of the sugar cane).

loans.use: To purchase more sugar cane and plantain for resale

loans.name: Kusi Killa Group

texts.es:
Blanca es Presidenta del Banco Comunal Kusi Killa, tiene 35 años, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos D. 18, 16, 14, 9 y 5 años D. edad. Blanca y su esposo tienen un taller D. artesanías (telares) en el famoso Barrio D. Santa Ana, cuna D. artesanos en Ayacucho, su esposo aprendió D. éste oficio D. sus abuelos, antes se dedicaban a la elaboración D. retablos, pero lo cambiaron por los telares que tienen mas demanda y ahora atienden pedidos.
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. materiales como: Lana D. ovino, tintes, leña.
Blanca, con éste, es el segundo ciclo que está en Finca Perú, ingreso por la invitación D. una amiga, le gusta porque pueD. ahorrar ya que en casa no se pueD., aprenD. mucho en la capacitaciones que recibe y pasa momentos gratos con las compañeras D. su banco.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder exportar sus trabajos y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Blanca is the president of the Communal Bank “Kusi Killa”. She is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and has five children (ages 18, 16, 14, 9, and 5). Blanca and her husband have a workshop where they produce woven crafts in the famous neighborhood of Santa Ana, the home of artisans from Ayacucho. Her husband learned this traD. from his grandparents. Blanca and her husband previously maD. altarpieces, but they started weaving because there was more demand for these products. Now they focus on completing their orders.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of materials such as sheep’s wool, dyes, and firewood. Blanca is participating in her second loan cycle with FINCA Peru. She was invited to join by a friend and enjoys being able to save. Blanca has learned much from the training classes she has taken and likes spending time with the other members of her Communal Bank.

Her dreams incluD. growing her business, exporting her products, and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase sheep's wool, dyes, and firewood.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La señora Josefina es habitantante de un lugar llamado Tierra Blanca el cual significa novia del del sol, la cual es una region ganadera. Doña josefina tiene la edad de 64 años solo estudio hasta el trecer año de primaria y esta casada con el señor angel con el cual tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya estan casdos actualmete solo vive con su esposo.

ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de un año juvilaron a su esposo y lo que le dan no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar asi que ella penso en ayudarle y invirtio en la compra de refrescos para vender con sus amigos y vecionos, ella inicio poniendo un cartel en laparte de enfrente el cual anunciaba su nuevo negocio con el tiempo la gente ya sabia que ella vendia y ahora aunque ya no tiene el cartel sus clientes siguen comprandole sus refrescos.

ella nos dice "yo pienso que he mantenido a mi clientela porque uno siempre busca buen trato que te despachen rapido y de buen modo  "

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de refrescos para resurtir su negocio.	

Doña josefina espera que sus ganancias sean buenas ya que desea comprar un refrigerador mas grande para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Josefina is a resident of a place called Tierra Blanca, which is also known as “The Bride of the Sun”. In addition to being a livestock region, it is one of the warmest places in the State of Veracruz. Doña Josefina is 64 years old and only has a third grade education. She is married to Sr. Angel and they have two children who are already married. At the moment, she and her husband live by themselves.

Josefina says that it has been more than a year since her husband retired. There was not enough money from his pension to cover the household expenses, so she invested in the purchase of soft drinks to sell to her friends and neighbors. Josefina started by putting a sign in the front to announce her new business. Over time, people learned that she was selling her products. Her customers continue to buy soft drinks even though she no longer has a sign.

Josefina says, “I believe in maintaining my customer base by always providing good, fast service.” She needs this loan to invest in the purchase of soft drinks to restock her business.

Doña Josefina hopes to generate good earnings because she wants to buy a larger refrigerator so that she can provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 61 years old, married and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store such as shampoo, groceries, etc.
Mercedita has borrowed and paid back 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 31 years and also earns an income from rice retailing and rice farming. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store.

loans.name: Regine

texts.en:
Regine is 32 years old and is married. She has six children, aged between 12 months and 10 years old. Regine sells second hand such as: women`s clothes, men`s clothes and childrens' clothes. Her business is well-organized. She has 6 years experience in her business and she starts her work from 7am until 6pm every day. Regine is currently employs one person to help her.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lender via vision finance company in order to expand her clothes business by purchasing different clothes to sell like: women`s clothes, men`s clothes and childrens' clothes for improving her business. With this profit, Regine will reinvest in her business, to pay school fees for her children and to save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand such as: women's clothes, men's clothes and children's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est composé de trois personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Oumè Pauline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Oumè Pauline est née en 1970. Oumè Pauline est mariée à un infirmier du nom de Joseph. Le couple a cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent avec eux. Oumè Pauline vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les charges de la maison, grâce au revenu issu de son activité. Oumè Pauline n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Oumè Pauline  vend des produits divers (savons, conserves, huile végétale, épices, etc.) à son domicile. Oumè Pauline achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Oumè Pauline sollicite un crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en: The group God Is Great is composed of three individuals who live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that the group is seeking the financial assistance of Alidé, in order to increase their commercial activity. Oumè Pauline, the representative of the group, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. Oumè Pauline was born in 1970 and is married to a nurse named Joseph. The couple has five children who have all gone to school and live with them. Oumè Pauline helps her husband with household expenses, thanks to the revenues from her work. Oumè Pauline has never gone to school. For twenty years, she has been selling a variety of products (soap, canned food, vegetable oil, spices, etc.) from her home. Oumè Pauline buys these products at Dantokpa, the international market in Bénin. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her income, she is seeking a loan along with the other members of her group.

loans.use: Buy canned food, vegetable oil, spices, etc.

loans.name: Doris Janette

texts.es: Doris Janette tiene 21 años, tiene a cargo sus 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Ella es una persona muy responsable, Doris tiene que dejar en su vivienda todo preparado para salir y empezar a atender su negocio, todos  los días lo atiende desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche pues siempre está pendiente de lo que sus clientes le solicitan. El financiamiento es para la compra de zapatillas, zapatos deportivos, sandalias, zapatos para niños y otros.
texts.en: Doris Janette is 21 years old. She is raising two minor children. She is a very responsible person and has to leave everything ready in her house to go out and attend to her business. She works every day from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m., and is always aware of what her customers are asking of her. The loan is to buy slippers, athletic shoes, sandals, children's shoes and more.

loans.use: to buy slipppers, athletic shoes, sandals, children's shoes and more.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is 56 years old. She has three children and lives with her family in H. Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been making a living by farming and raising pigs for 11 years. They have requested a loan to invest in their business and buy additional pigs. She hopes that their business will run smoothly and help her to improve her income and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy and raise pigs.

loans.name: Lemomo

texts.en:
Lemomo is 36 years old, married with three children and resides in Narok Kenya. He had been a maize farmer for the past eight years. 

He learned about KADET LTD through a registered client with KADET. He has been a good client and this is his third loan which he has plans to use to prepare land for farming and to buy farm inputs.


He hopes to make profit and use to re-invest in other business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to prepare land for farming and to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Ramona De La Concepcion

texts.es: Ramona De La Concepción tiene 2 hijos de 22 y 27 años, su negocio es la venta de mercadería en general, inicio su negocio desde hace 23 años lo aprendió de su Mama ya que Ramona la acompañaba a vender en el mercado fue así como ella logro relacionarse con los clientes y obtener fama.  Con el financiamiento quiere comprar productos como sabanas, toallas, ropa en general, calzado, cosméticos y bolsos. Agradece a la financiera por el gran apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
