texts.en: Ramona De La Concepción has 2 children aged 22 and 27. She runs a general store, an activity she started 23 years ago. Ramona learnt from her mother, while going with her at the market. This is how she succeeded in mixing with customers and in gaining a reputation. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as bed sheets, towels, clothes, shoes, cosmetics and bags. She is thankful to the financial institution for the great support offered to the development of her activity.

loans.use: To buy products such as bed sheets, towels, clothes, shoes, cosmetics and bags.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, 38, lives in the Philippines and is married with four children. She has a shop that sells snacks, biscuits and beverages, a business she has had for four years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana:D. 44 años y tiene dos hijas,ella se dedica a la venta D. verduras por mayor como por ejemplo tomate y otros,ella no cuenta que esta muy contenta porque gracias a Dios su negocio a prosperado,ahora esta solicitnaod este credito para la compra D. mas verduras ya que esta convencida D. que le falta capital para trabajar y aumentar sus ganancias el sueño D. ella es tener un local mas granD. y surtir su negocio.para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijas.

loans.use: Compra de Verduras para la venta.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, 41, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Rolando, her business partner, and mother to their five children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Arlene operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She also retails rice grains per kilo. Arlene earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and rice to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Arlene hopes her business will grow into a mini-grocery and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Vita

texts.en:
Vita is 34 years old and married. 

She has never been employed in any organization with monthly payrolls because she wasn't able to finished her studies. When she got married, Vita stayed at home to nurse her two children. 

She was not contented being a plain housewife and Vita wanted to generate income too. With minimal capital, she established a small variety store in front of her house. Daily profits of  PHP 200 from the business were enough to cover her family's daily meals and snacks for her children. 

Vita wants to attract more customers to her store so she needs to stock groceries in it. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, breads and canned goods to sell in her variety store. This will help increase her sales and generate more income.

Being a business-oriented woman, Vita would like to strengthen her variety store and someday establish a hog raising business for an additional income too.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, breads and canned goods to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is a farmer in Litein aged 33 and married with 3 children aged between 12 and  3 years. He has been farming in his hometown of Litein for over 20 years producing and selling tea, bananas and milk for the local market. He also runs a motorcycle transport business for additional income.

Philemon has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow to boost his dairy business. He says the additional dairy cow will improve his income and family family well being.

Philemon mentions lack of funds as the major challenge in his farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Kimberdaid Group

texts.en: Jadson lives in a town called Gweru. He is 28 years old, married and the father of two children, one of whom is only two weeks old. He makes a living by selling a range of products in the local market, including trousers, radios and items that run on solar energy. The main challenges he faces are lack of money to expand his business and high transportation costs. He will use his portion of this group loan to buy more items to sell to his customers and to pay the balance of the money he owes on his wife's dowry. His goal for the future is to open a chain of stores.

loans.use: to buy clothing, radios and solar-powered items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Ma.luz

texts.en: Ma. Luz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Luz requested a 24,000-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy an additional fishing boat and other equipment for fishing. Ma. Luz has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Ma.  Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing boat and other equipment for fishing

loans.name: Donato

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Donato; el tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de fabricación y venta de sanitarios, el socio tiene un taller donde fabrica todo tipo de modelos de sanitarios, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de fabricación y venta de sanitarios.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer los sanitarios como arena granito, pinturas y pegamentos al por mayor.

 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES-POROY” communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is in Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Señor Donato; he is 47 years old.  He is in a live-in relationship and has two children.  The member divides his time between his daily activities and his business making and selling toilets.  He has a workshop where he makes all different kinds of toilets, and he works from 7 a.m. till 6 p.m.

The member has been able to move his children ahead in life by means of this business, and wants to expand and improve his business making and selling toilets.

The member is requesting the loan to purchase materials at wholesale for making toilets such as granite sand, paints and glues.

The member is happy about the loan and commits to making his repayments.

loans.use: to purchase materials at wholesale for making toilets, such as granite sand, paints and glues.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has six children.

Sabah is an owner of a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there's a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $3000 in order to purchase a generator and to add more foodstuffs to his inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits so to be able to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a generator and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a 31-year-old housewife and performs her household duties. She is a great mother and raises her children very well. Both of her children are studying in a local school.
She also provides full support to her husband in his animal business. She takes care of the animals and keeps their living space clean.
Her husband wants a loan for the expansion of his business. With the loan he will buy goats and sheep and sell them after they become healthy and grown.
He has operated his business for the past many years. Razia is very hopeful that the loan will help her husband’s business to become more successful.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for his animal business.

loans.name: Savronbi

texts.ru: Савронби проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 43 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Савронби занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее смешанный ассортимент товара. В этой области она восемь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения канцелярских товаров.
texts.en: Savronbi lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 43 years old, married and has four children.  Savronbi is involved in sales at a market.  She has a mixed assortment of goods.  Savronbi has been in this field for eight years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of office supplies.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies

loans.name: Ma Julia

texts.es: Doña Julia tiene 55 años de edad estudio hasta el cuarto año de primaria y no pudo continuar con sus estudios por que sus padres no pudieron seguir apoyándola por que eran 13 hermanos y no podían darles estudios a todos. Ella es viuda y tiene cinco hijos pero nada mas 4 viven con ella por que el mayor le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, doña Julia se dedica a cultivar y vender aguacate en diferentes poblaciones aledañas a su localidad desde hace 8 años y dice que comenzó con este negocio para apoyar a sus hijos con las escuelas ya que ella es la cabeza de la familia y tiene que sacar a sus hijos adelante, dice que cuando no es temporada de aguacate se dedica a la compra de venta de fruta de temporada la cual la vende en diferentes tianguis. Platica que esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para invertirlo en sus árboles para comprarles abonos, fertilizantes e insecticidas para que den fruto de mejor calidad, la meta que tiene Julia es que sus hijos terminen la escuela y puedan estudiar una carrera corta y sembrar otros frutos en su huerto para tener de diferentes variedades de fruto. Ella esta agradecida por el crédito porque así puede hacer su negocio.
texts.en: Mrs. Julia, 55, was unable to continue her education past fourth grade because her parents weren't able to keep supporting her; she had 13 siblings, and their parents could not afford to educate all of them. Julia is a widow and has five children; only four of them live with her, and the oldest helps her with the household costs. Julia grows and sells avocado in various towns near to her own. She has done this for eight years and says that she started her business so that she could support her children with their studies. She is the head of the family and needs to get her children ahead. She is requesting a loan from this institution so that she can invest in her avocado plants. She will buy manure, fertilizers and insecticides so that her trees will produce a better quality of fruit. Julia's goal is for her children to finish school and get degrees. Another goal of hers is to sow other types of fruit so that she will have a variety. She is grateful to have this loan because she will be able to put it toward her business.

loans.use: to grow and sell fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is a widowed mother of seven children, all of whom are adults.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer's demands in the future.
 
With the Kshs 10,000 loan she wants to buy water pipes to install for her water selling business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy water pipes to install for water selling business.

loans.name: Karen Gale

texts.en:
Karen Gale is a 25-year-old, married woman with two children. For three years, she has been working as a farmer and earns 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every cropping season. She says that this is not enough as a cure for her difficulties, but she is not hopeless; instead, she has got the courage to continue her business.

Karen Gale is now applying for a 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor costs. With the profits she expects to generate as a result of this loan, she plans to save for the education of her children and for the improvement of their living conditions as well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Clara Maribel

texts.es:
Clara, se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, aceite, condimentos, y productos comestibles para la elaboración de su venta, la necesidad de ella es tener el dinero para hacer compras periódicas y mantener estable el negocio.
Clara considera que estos préstamos le han ayudado a mejorar, y aumentar los clientes así como también los beneficios económicos para su familia.
texts.en:
Clara has decided to request a new loan to buy maize, firewood, oil, dressings and groceries to prepare her meals. She needs the money to make periodic purchases and to keep her activity steady.
Clara thinks that these loans have helped her improving her activity, increasing both the number of her customers and the economic benefits for her family.

loans.use: To buy maize, firewood, oil, dressings and groceries

loans.name: Sa Moun

texts.en:
Sa Moun is 36 years old and married.  She resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area which is well known for its historical tourism sites (such as the ancient temples of Angkor Wat, Bayon, and Banteay Srey). 

Sa Moun has been involved in growing rice for over six years and is successful in her career.  Additionally, she is a basket weaver.  Her husband is an APSARA authority who is responsible for looking after Angkorian sites.  One of her children is employed at a restaurant.  

Due to her daughter's difficult commute to work, Sa Moun is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike for her daughter.  With a motorbike, her daughter will be able to get to work on time easily and save some money on her transportation expenses in order to support her family better.  In the future, Sa Moun would like to build a new house and support her children to study until they get married.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to commute to work.

loans.name: Cikwanine Group

texts.fr: Kulondwa est une cliente entrepreneur, vice présidente du groupe de credit Cikwanine. Agée de 36 ans, mère de 9 enfants dont 7 étudient est mariée à un charpentier. Bien avant qu'elle n’intègre son groupe de crédit, elle vendait pour les autres. En 1997, elle tira profit de 10$ de cette activité et entreprit son commerce de vente des souliers usagers dans lequel elle s'est spécialisée. Ce nouveau crédit va lui procurer 30 paires des souliers usagers(hommes-femmes). Elle craint toute fois la concurrence et pourtant aimerait être un jour fournisseur des souliers usagers aux détaillants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son appui.
texts.en: Kulondwa is a client entrepreneur, and vice president of the credit group Cikwanine. She is 36 years old and mother to 9 children of whom 7 study and is married to a carpenter. Well before she joined her credit group, she sold for others. In 1997, she made a profit of $10 from this business and undertook her business selling used shoes in which she specialized. This new loan is going to get her 30 pairs of used shoes (men-women). She fears competition all the time yet would like to be a supplier of used shoes to retailers one day. She thanks Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to buy 30 pairs of used shoes (men-women).

loans.name: Puspalata

texts.en:
Puspalata is a 24-year-old divorced lady living with her parents and brother. She manages a tailoring shop where she stitches dresses like salwar suits (traditional Indian dress), frocks etc. for her customers who give orders for stitching. After the divorce from her husband, she came to her paternal home. She did not want to be a burden on her parents so she started a tailoring shop. She earns only 3,500 INR per month from this business. She planned to purchase two new sewing machines so that she can enlarge her business and take orders from her customers in bulk. 

Puspalata has requested a loan of 36,000 INR to purchase two sewing machines and fabrics. She also wants to hire some work force to help her. She wants to give a good living standard to her family and save some money for their future.

loans.use: to purchase new sewing machines for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Nyabirongo Thukolehaghama Group

texts.en: Jane is 41 years old, married with a child. She is dealing in tailoring business. She is doing very well, because of her character of timely services and quality work. However she also faces a challenge of debtors.Jane would love to buy more clothes for sowing and selling to her customers. Being a Christmas season, business is at its peak. She is requesting for money to buy more clothes for sewing and selling. Jane is a member of Nyabirongo Thukolehaghama  Group where there is member group guarantorship for one to access a group loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sewing and selling.

loans.name: Lala

texts.en:
Lala lives in Salyan region Khaladj village. 
This 55-year-old woman is married, has 4 children.
She has been engaged in this business for 10 years.
In the beginning her business she borrowed a loan of $400 and bought a milch-cow and 4 sheeps.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy 2 milch-cows.

loans.use: To buy 2 milch-cows

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: I have been selling sweets and candies for 2 years. I need to replenish my inventory so that I can keep selling this month. With this business I help my family and children with their studies.

loans.use: To sell sweets, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs Maria has a store where she sells all sorts of every day necessities and also sells folders, stationary, perfumes, and cosmetics. Her business is located on a road with heavy traffic and because of which her sales increase every day.

Mrs. Maria began her business three years ago with the money she gained from being a traveling saleswoman, in various sections of the central city, but this job was too tiring and so she decided to begin a business out of her own home.

She wants to use part of the credit to buy a glass display case to display her products and to push her merchandise better. The other part she will use to purchase merchandise to meet her customers' demands.

Her current goal is to see her business grow and is confident that this will happen with the loan. Mrs. Maria is 26 years old, her house is made of reed and she has a good location for her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La Sra. Maria tiene una tienda donde vende todo lo relacionado a productos de primera necesidad y también se ayuda con la venta de cuadernos, papelería, perfumes y cosméticos. Su negocio esta ubicado en una calle muy transitada por lo cual sus ventas mejoran cada día. La señora Maria inicio su negocio hace tres años con un dinero que obtuvo producto de la venta de mercadería ambulante en varios sectores céntricos de la ciudad, pero este trabajo era demasiado agotador por lo cual decidió iniciar con su negocio en su propia casa. Ella quiere usar parte de su crédito en la compra de una vitrina para exhibir sus productos y de esta manera se pueda apreciar mejor su mercadería, la otra parte va a comprar mercadería para poder suplir las necesidades de sus clientes. En la actualidad su meta es crecer su negocio y confia en el credito para poder lograrlo. La señora Maria tiene 26 años y dos hijos, su casa es de caña y tiene una buena ubicación para sus ventas.

loans.use: To purchase a glass show case to display products.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Born in 1950, Monica is married with three children and a grandmother. At her age, she has suffered from the death of her son and grandson and the inability to provide food for her family and buy medications for herself. She also has many grandchildren born out of wedlock looking up to her for food.
With these difficulties, she became a member of GHAPE and was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline.

She now requests a loan of $100 with which she plans to buy and sell food items so she can raise money to provide for her family.

She plans to repay the loan in 15 months.

loans.use: Purchase palm oil, cocoyam, maggi, spices

loans.name: María Rita

texts.es:
Maria is a stoic mother who despite the problems she had when she lost her shop, has not lost hope of moving forward. She lives alone with her husband who continues to work with the only tool he has, despite his health problems, in order to secure the wellbeing of his caring partner. Maria is the mother of three children who have formed their own families and have decided to build their homes away from the parents’ house. Thanks to the upbringing and good values she instilled in them at a very young age they live their lives responsibly and respectfully, to the pride of their parents. She has a lot of ideas in mind and to make them concrete step by step she first needs to invest in her small shop. This will allow her to grow economically. She requests 300 dollars for the purpose of acquiring a greater quantity and variety of goods to offer them to customers in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Holmes, Kiva volunteer.

Maria es una abnegada madre que a pesar de los problemas que tuvo al perder su pequeña bodega, no pierde las esperanzas de surgir, vive sólo con su esposo que a pesar del mal que sufre no deja de trabajar con la única herramienta que tiene para procurarle bienestar a su amorosa compañera, Es madre de tres hijos que han conformado sus propias familias y han decidido construir su hogar fuera de la casa paterna; gracias a la educación y buenos valores que les inculcó desde muy pequeños se conducen con mucha responsabilidad y respeto para orgullo de sus padres. Tiene muchos propósitos en mente y para concretarlos poco a poco primero necesita invertir en su pequeña bodega, esta le permitirá crecer económica y familiarmente.Hace una petición de 300 dólares con el objetivo de adquirir más cantidad y mayor variedad de artículos de primera necesidad para ofertarlos a los clientes de su comunidad.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for general store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Well past the city limits of Ayacucho, Perú, in the beautiful green countrysiD. fed by a small river, one can find Rosa A. D. R. caring for her small vegetable field. This 69 year-old mother of nine children, harvests a large variety of crops according to the season such as spinach, carrots, onions, and even alfalfa, which she then sells in the busy city markets two times each week. When the large hacienda properties were redistributed among the people who labored them Rosa’s family received a large amount of land. Over the years, as her family has been living off the crops they grow, the property has been divided among the children and grandchildren, and now Rosa and her husband have just a small piece of land to themselves alongsiD. their children.

Rosa says she is very grateful to have been a part of her village bank for the past several years because it has taught her how to save her money and accumulate interest in the bank. Unfortunately, in recent years both Rosa and her husband have fallen ill. Thanks to her savings, however, Rosa has been able to proviD. for the medicines and medical attention required, something which would have been unthinkable without her village bank. With the $300 loan Rosa is requesting, she and her husband will buy fertilizer and other materials for their small field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other materials for their small field.

loans.name: Giyas

texts.en: Goyasis 34 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Jabrail region situated in the east part of Azerbaijan- Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict zone. Right now he lives with his wife and two children in an unfinished clinic building in the Binagadi settlement in suburbs of Baku. He started his trading foodstuffs in 2000. He rents a shop. At the beginning of the business he applied to Normicro Baku branch for his first loan and now he is looking for a second loan to increase his purchasing power and income. He has applied for a loan of 1300 AZN. 1000 AZN will be funded by Kiva and the remaining 300 AZN by Normicro.

loans.use: To invest in business and increase sales

loans.name: Salma's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Salma, age 35, is married with 2 children (ages 14 and 17). She owns a cafe where she sells tea and snacks, which she started in 2005. She now works from 6am to 8pm daily and can make a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Salma took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more food items to expand her business. She now hopes for a new loan and will share this with her subgroup. Sisemi and Salma, her subgroup members, have shop and fish businesses.

loans.use: To buy food items for cafe

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Ever since Trinidad got married, she has always tried to excel in order to create a household in which love, unity, and family well-being prevail. Now, her small but well-stocked general store is giving her the opportunity to improve her living conditions. This hard-working mother starts tending her little shop at 5:30 in the morning and stays there until 9:00 at night, when her husband comes home from his strenuous job as a bricklayer. Trinidad and Valentín have two young children who are the motors that thrust the couple to move forward and work hard in their daily tasks. Thanks to their hard work, they have managed to build their own house, where they feel more at ease and safe. With this loan, she plans to increase her variety of products, thus continuing to boost customer satisfaction, and consequently, her family’s tranquility. For this reason, she seeks your help by requesting a loan. We can help make Trinidad’s plans concrete.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde que trinidad contrajo matrimonio trató siempre de sobresalir para formar un hogar en el que reine el amor, unión y bienestar familiar; ahora su pequeña pero surtida bodeguita de abarrotes y frutas le está dando la oportunidad de mejorar su situación de vida. Esta laboriosa madre empieza con la atención diaria de su surtida tiendita a partir de los 5.30 de la mañana y permanece en este lugar hasta las 9.00 de la noche, hora en que llega su esposo Valentín de su esforzado trabajo como albañil.Trinidad y Valentín, son padres de dos pequeños niños, quienes son el motor que los impulsa a seguir adelante y a esforzarse en sus actividades cotidianas, gracias a esto ambos lograron construir su propia casita, lugar donde se sienten más tranquilos y seguros.Ella al gozar de solicitudes y pedidos desea aumentar mucho más la variedad de sus productos, para así seguir incrementando la satisfacción de sus clientes y por ende la tranquilidad de su familia, por ese motivo recurre a vuestra ayuda y hace la petición de un préstamo.Nosotros podemos ayudar a concretar los proyectos de Trinidad.

loans.use: Purchase of greater quantity and better quality of products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa F. D. sells beauty products in the tropical city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. She has had the business for 4 years and has slowly increased the number of her clients and products. Rosa keeps trusted clients happy and loyal by offering a credit program. She now sells soaps, deodorants, creams, shampoos; her best selling items are perfumes. Rosa is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. She is happy and proud of the independence she has gained through her business. Now she has her own money and doesn’t need to ask her husband if she wants to buy something for herself or the children.

A member of the community bank Juntos Hasta el Final, Rosa is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy more high quality creams and perfumes, which are not offered in the markets of Pucallpa.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for a cosmetics business

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mr. Mai M. and his wife, Mrs. Sarin Mak, were married in 1991 and have four children, one son and three daughters. All of their children are in school. The family lives about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Mai has been in the business of selling fish for four years and also works as a mason. His wife has sold fish for 17 years. She buys them wholesale, and resells them at nearby Ta Khmao market. Together, they earn between 30,000- 40,000 riel per day.

Mr. Mai has applied for a loan of $500 to repair his house.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Pamata

texts.en:
Pamata V., 44, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in the taro business. She sells to the villagers and the general public 2 days per week. Pamata will use the loan to buy weed killer, barbed wire, nails, a sack of fertilizer, and bush knives for farming and transportation fares for selling. Her husband is a musician who earns the only other income of the family. He will help in the operation of the plantation when he is available.

Pamata has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (about $US62). SPBD loans are Pamata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase farming supplies and transportation fares

loans.name: Sita

texts.en: Mrs. Sita S. lives with her husband, Mr. Chandra S., and three children. Her husband works in the Nepalese Army.  Her two daughters are in grades 3 and 4 and her son is in grade 8.  Mrs. S. opened a small food shop a year ago to improve the economic conditions for her family. She sells a variety of foods items in her shop, including Nepali food such as dalbhat (rice). She also sells tea and coffee. The demand for food in her town is increasing. Therefore, Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy ingredients to produce more food.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food for her shop

loans.name: Bismarck

texts.en: Bismarck is 33 years old, married, and has one child. He has been a dealer in used refrigerators and parts for the past 10 years. He also repairs refrigerators for his customers. Bismark buys supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells them to his customers at retail prices. Used refrigerators are in high demand for those who cannot afford to buy a new one. Bismark requests a loan of $975 so he can purchase additional refrigerators and parts. He belongs to the community group called Evergreen Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee the repayment of their loans through pledge.

loans.use: To procure additional refrigerators and parts

loans.name: Rosa Micaela

texts.es:
Rosa Micaela is 36 years old. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood with her husband, who works at the University of Managua. They have two children - a 14 year old daughter and a 7 year old son. Rosa has worked as an executive secretary in a health center for 4 years. She plans on finding a better job, based on the experience that she hasacquired . She would like to be able to offer her children a better lifestyle, and for this reason she is investing in improving her home. With the money that she is requesting she will install a drop ceilins in three bedrooms.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Micaela tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada, su esposo trabaja en una Universidad de Managua, tiene 2 hijos una mujer de 14 años y un varón de 7 años. Rosa se desempeña como secretaria ejecutiva de un centro de salud, tiene 4 años de laborar en este centro. Sus planes son llegar a tener un mejor puesto producto de la experiencia que ha adquirido. Desea poder asegurarles a sus hijos un mejor patrimonio es por eso que invertirá en el mejoramiento de su vivienda. Con el dinero solicitado instalará cielo falso en tres habitaciones.

loans.use: Installation of drop ceilings in three bedrooms.

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
La Sra. Maricruz vive con su mama a ellas les esta haciendo falta un cuarto mas ya que la casa está muy reducida ella quieres construir una recamara en la planta alta de la casa para así ampliar mas la sala y cocina. 
Maricruz trabaja como vendedora de productos de belleza esté es su ingreso familiar ella tiene una hija de edad escolar.
La Sra. Maricruz está solicitando un préstamo de $925.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto para ella y su hija.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maricruz lives with her mother, and they’d like to build and additional room for their small house. They’ll build it on the upper floor of the house to expand the living room and the kitchen as well. Maricruz works selling beauty products and this is the family’s main source of income. She has a school-age daughter. Mrs. Maricruz is asking for a loan of $925 dlls to build the room for herself and her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Melita

texts.es: Su ardua labor en la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, la realiza por sus cuatro hijos, a los mismos que quiere apoyarlos en sus estudios, actualmente están cursando la primaria y la secundaria. Melita, es una mujer que lucha duro por salir adelante, empezó con este negocio hace mucho tiempos atrás, gracias a su buena atención y sobre todo buena administración ha ido de mejora en mejora. Junto a su esposo Pedro, quien trabaja como maderero, se propusieron seguir adelante por su familia, por eso Melita decidió implementar su negocio, ella necesita de un capital para lograr su objetivo, cantidad que solicita en calidad de préstamo. Con tu ayuda esta madre saldrá adelante en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Melita works hard in the sale of groceries and other basic products for the benefit of her four children, who she wants to support in their studies where they are currently in primary and secondary school. Melita is a women that fights hard to get ahead. She began her business many years ago and thanks to careful attention and good administration has improved things little by little. Together with her husband Pedro, who works in the lumber business, she is working to improve her family's well being. With this in mind, Melita decided to implement her business and she needs a little more capital to achieve this objective in the form of a loan. With your help, this mother will get ahead in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise in her store

loans.name: Ancelma

texts.en:
Ancelma Huamni Y. is a member of community bank Las Gaviotas, which means “seagulls” in Spanish. She is a single mother of 3, the eldest of whom is currently studying at the university.

Ancelma uses her uncle’s oven to make desserts to sell while walking around in the city and also when someone orders a pastry. With her loan of 400 soles, she will invest in her business and purchase oil and flour, butter and eggs. She is saving so her children can get an education. She would also like to buy her own land, open her own pastry store and purchase an oven.

loans.use: purchase oil and flour, butter and eggs

loans.name: Angela Julia

texts.es: La señora Angela es una persona muy responsable, en todo el tiempo que trabaja con nosotros, no ha tenido dias de atraso , pagando sus cuotas siempre de manera puntual, Es una mujer divorciada del esposo, por lo que ella matiene a sus tres hijos, aportando con lo todo lo que puede a su hogar, ya que actualmente el esposo, no tiene trabajo, por lo que no puede agar la pensión de sus hijos. Angela se dedica a la venta de edredones que costura con mucha habilidad en la Feria 16 de Julio, una de las ferias más grandes del país. Trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para darles mejores condiciones de vida a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Angela is a responsible person. In all the time she was worked with us, she has not been late on a single payment. She is divorced and raises her three children. She brings in all that she can, since her ex-husband is unemployed and cannot provide support for the children. Angela sells quilts, which she skillfully sews herself, in the 16 de Julio market, one of the biggest markets in the country. She works hard and with a lot of dedication to improve her children’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia V. G. forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” de la provincia de Carhuaz.

Lidia tiene la edad de 30 años, es madre soltera de 01 hijo, aunque tiene una profesión, ella observa que su mayor logro ha sido tener y mantener su negocio, Lidia comenta que con su trabajo asume todas las responsabilidades para su hijo porque el padre de éste no se hace cargo, situación que Lidia reconoce como la más difícil que tiene que enfrentar porque su hijo aún cuando es muy pequeño siempre desea ver a su padre. Lidia dedica su tiempo a la venta de abarrotes que compra desde Huaraz o de los distribuidores y otros productos en una bodega en su casa frente al óvalo de Tinco en la calle principal, con ayuda de su madre y su familia, ahora ella comenta que le va bien se encuentra más tranquila y su deseo es crecer e invertir para poder cubrir las necesidades familiares en especial de su hijo.
 
Con este préstamo de s/.1300.00, que pagará en seis cuotas invertirá en la compra de abarrotes y productos de navidad como son más panetones y otros insumos.
 
Lidia afirma que le gustaría recibir capacitaciones para mejorar su negocio y con mayor énfasis su vida personal.
texts.en:
Lidia V. G. is part of the communal bank “Manuela Ramos de Tinco” in the Carhuaz province. Lidia is 30 years old and the single mother of a son. Although she was trained in a profession, she states that her greatest achievement has been owning her own business. Lidia comments that she assumes all of the responsibilities of her work for her son. His father does not take responsibility for him, creating a situation that Lidia recognizes as the most difficult she faces. Her son is still very small and for that reason always longs to see his father. Liliana sells groceries that she buys in Huaraz or from the distributors, along with other products, in a store in her home. She says that with the help of her mother and family, all is going well for her and she finds herself calm. Her wish is to grow and invest in order to be able to cover the necessities of her family, especially those of her son. With this loan for 1,300 Peruvian soles which she will repay in 6 installments, Lidia will invest in the purchase of groceries and Christmas products such as Christmas breads and other holiday foods. Lidia adds that she would like to receive training to improve her business, so that she can improve her personal life, as well, when she is able to put more emphasis on it.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and other products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. Four of her children are girls and one is a boy. One of Mary’s children has completed junior high school. The rest are still in the basic school. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates palm nuts. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in their community. They live at Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Mary sells fashion accessories such as ladies’ footwear, headgear, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells them in the local market. She also hawks from house-to-house and at times treks to nearby towns to market her goods. She has been in business for six years. Mary wants a loan to increase her working capital to be able to procure more goods and if possible include new ones.

loans.use: To buy fashion accessories for re-sale

loans.name: Umc Primary School, Makeni Group

texts.en:
Pictured is the faculty of the United Methodist Church (UMC) Primary School, Makeni. It was founded in 1969 by the United Methodist Church to educate the children of the community and to support the church. It is one the oldest schools in town. UMC currently has an enrollment of 917 pupils and a staff of twenty-five dedicated teachers.

Because of the dedication of its teachers, UMC Primary students achieve outstanding results in the National Primary School Examination (NPSE). Almost always, 99% of UMC Primary pupils pass the examination to enter secondary school. The children also participate in extracurricular activities, such as football (soccer), other athletic games, and  social events organized for all primary schools in Makeni.

Teaching is a rewarding profession, but it is not well paid. Government salaries for teachers are usually small, so teachers often have to supplement their incomes. But with this loan, they will be able to invest in something meaningful and gradually repay the loan within a ten-month period from their monthly salaries.Some of the teachers will use their portion of the loan to pay school fees for themselves or their children. Other will invest their portion in businesses or farming. And others will use their portion to buy furniture or improve their homes. This is the first loan UMC Primary school is seeking from SMT. They were inspired by UMC Secondary school to apply for a loan from SMT.

Sallamatu B. (3rd from Left) is the head teacher of this school. Sallamatu was born in Yoni Banna, a small town in the Tonkolili district. She is thirty-six years old. She is married to the principal of UMC Secondary School, Makeni, and the couple has two children. She has been teaching for the past fourteen years. She has always found it necessary to take on extra work, such as selling foodstuffs, to supplement her monthly salary. She would use her portion of this loan to buy palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) in bulk for resale. She would use the profits to pay school fees for her eldest son, who is in class four.

loans.use: Buy palm oil for resale

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: A. akoua est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle habite avec sa famille dans le quartier d’avédji un quartier de la ville de lomé , elle  a pour activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale qu’elle fait depuis 2006. Actuellement la demande de sa clientèle est très élevée. Elle demande alors à wages son premier prêt pour rehausser son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
A. Akoua is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her family in the Avédji neighborhood, in the city of Lomé. Since 2006, her business has been consisting in selling staples. At this time, customer demand is very high. She's therefore seeking her first loan from Kiva's parter WAGES in order to bolster her stock.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell staples

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo Rodolfo de 37 años y sus hijas Kimberly de 10 y Niurka de 4 años de edad, viven en su casa propia. Su profesión es la enfermería, pero desde hace 10 años, adicionalmente, se dedica a la venta de ropa, compra las prendas al por mayor y se las manda a su madre, la cual vive en provincia para que las pueda vender a un mayor precio, resultando un negocio muy rentable para las dos. A Luz le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le permite pasar más tiempo con su hijas, las cuales son su adoración, ella quiere brindarles un buen futuro y que sean profesionales de éxito, para eso necesita trabajar mucho, es por eso que ha pensado en expandir su negocio y poner un bazar donde ofrezca más variedad de prendas, regalos, etc. Luz tiene un espacio en su casa para que pueda funcionar su tienda, pero necesita darle el acabado final e implementarlo con más mercadería. Luz lleva varios años trabajando con Microfinanzas Prisma, es la tesorera de su banco comunal, pero ahora solicita un préstamo individual, el cual espera pagar tan puntualmente como siempre. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más cantidad de prendas de vestir para mandarlas a provincia y así lograr mejores ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en:
37-year old Luz lives with her 37-year old husband Rodolfo and their daughters Kimberly (10) and Niurka (4) in their own home. She works in an infirmary, but for the last ten years she has also sold clothing. She buys the items wholesale, then sends them to her mother who lives out in the countryside where she can sell them for a good profit. The result is a money-making business for them both. Luz likes the work as it enables her to spend more time with her daughters whom she loves dearly. She wants to provide them with a good future so they can have successful careers, but that requires much work. For this reason she is considering expanding her business and opening a store where she can offer a greater variety of clothes, gift items etc. In her home Luz has a space that could work as a store, but it needs some finishing touches and more stock bought. Luz has worked for Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma for several years and is the treasurer of the community bank. But now she herself needs a loan which she expects to pay back punctually as she always does. With the loan she will buy more clothing to send to her mother in the countryside and thus earn more money for the household.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice Y. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has five kids who attend primary school. Alice lives with her husband and children in a community called Oda, in eastern Ghana. Many people here are engaged in farming. However, some of the women, including Alice, are involved in the production of palm oil. She has been in this business for two years. Her husband is a farmer.

She buys the palm nuts from local farmers in her community; processes it in her house to produce the oil, and sells at wholesale prices to her customers. Palm oil is a local vegetable oil produced from palm fruit that is cooked, pounded, sieved, and boiled for hours. The reddish oil is skimmed off and reboiled to expel water content. Alice would use the loan to buy the palm fruits in bulk so as to supply more customers. 

She believes the loan would enable her to scale up production to serve a larger market and eventually improve her family finances. She is a member of the “Mawuli” Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee each other's loans and support each other in handling their repayment.

loans.use: To buy palm fruits in bulk

loans.name: Linette

texts.en:
Linette A. O. is a 30-year-old mother of two children ages 9 and 7. She is married to a “casual-worker," which, in the U.S., is similar to a day laborer. She lives in Nyamasaria slum where she sells beans, rice, dengu, and green grubs. She uses the profits to help her children go to school and plans on sending them to college through university. She says she sees the value in education. Linette says that her husband does not work very hard, a common theme amongst borrowers here in Kisumu, and she enjoys running her own business because it gives her the opportunity to raise her children on her own. She is asking for 10,000 KSH (or about $150 US) to increase the amount of goods in her kiosk.

Linette recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: School fees; food goods for her kiosk

loans.name: Musalama

texts.ru: Муслама Хамдамова уже более 10 лет занимается торговлей национальных материалов. Проживает она в районе Вахдат. Возраст 50 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж находится в России, на заработках. Мусламе по бизнесу помогают обе дочки. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы пополнить свой ассортимент и увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Musalama H. has been selling national Tajik fabrics for the last ten years. She is 50 years old now and lives in the Vakhdat region. Musalama is married and has three children, but her husband in currently working in Russia. However, her two daughters help Musalama in her business. Mrs. H. would like to take out this loan in order to expand her inventory and increase her sales.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increaseing sales

loans.name: Olga Sofia

texts.es: Olga P. tiene una pequeña pulperia, tiene mucho tiempo de tenerla ella vende: arroz, azucar, maiz, refrescos y otras cosas. ella tiene la ayuda de su hijo ya que por las mañanas se levanta a las 4:00 am para salir a vender a una melonera que queda cerca de su casa ahi vende refrescos. en esa melonera trebaja el esposo de olga, ella y su esposo han salido adelante con sus esfuerzos, ella  espera seguir adelante y en el futuro tener una pulperia mas surtida.
texts.en:
Olga P. has had a small grocery shop for long time. She sells rice, sugar, corn, soft drinks and some other products. Her son helps in the business since she has to get up at 4 in the morning to go to sell soft drinks at a place near to her house, where her husband works too. Olga and her husband have gone ahead with their efforts, she hopes to keep the business going and eventually to offer more products and have a well stocked grocery shop.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, juice, sugar, rice, beans, meat, corn ,cookies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 54 años y junto a su esposo tratan de brindarle las mejores condiciones de vida a su único hijo, por ello construyeron su casa propia donde viven cómodamente. Cuando terminó la construcción de ésta pensó en instalar un negocio, comenzó vendiendo bebidas durante el verano, pero con el tiempo las personas demandaban muchas cosas más, lo cual fue el inicio de su bodega. Esta actividad la viene realizando hace 5 años trabajando desde las 6 de la mañana aseando su local, arreglando sus productos y preparándose para atender a sus clientes con una gran sonrisa, pues más importante que vender en demasía es brindar una atención adecuada a sus clientes ya que esa actitud garantizará el desarrollo y rentabilidad de su negocio, nos dice. Para un futuro cercano, Lucia quiere ampliar su tienda acondicionando un espacio adicional en su casa. Ella considera que el trabajo que realiza en su banco comunal es primordial, puesto que lo realiza en comunión con todas las integrantes de su grupo, utilizando estos créditos como una alternativa de desarrollo. Para Lucia este es su 13vo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA. Los 3000 soles que solicita los usará para la ampliación del local de su tienda.
texts.en:
Lucia is 54 years old and, together with her husband, is trying to provide better living conditions for their only son. That is why they built their own house, where they are now living comfortably. When they finished constructing their home Lucia thought about setting up a business. She began by selling beverages during the summer, but soon her customers were asking for many more items. This led to Lucia establishing her grocery store. She has been involved in this activity for 5 years. She begins work at 6 in the morning by tidying up the store, arranging her products, and getting ready to attend to her customers with a big smile. Lucia tells us that one of the secrets to selling a lot of products is to provide suitable attention to her customers, and having that attitude will guarantee her business’s development and profitability. In the near future Lucia wants to expand her store, setting up an additional space in her home. She thinks that the work she does in her communal bank is very important, since she works together with all of the members of her group, using the loans as a good development alternative. This is Lucia’s 13th loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas PRISMA. She will use the 3000 soles she is requesting to expand the premises of her store.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her store

loans.name: Orlando Jesus

texts.es: El señor Orlando Jesús Galán F. , tiene la edad de 36 años , habita en el barrio La Francia , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto as u esposa la cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo tres hijos , actualmente estudiantes de secundaria , en su tiempos libres le apoyan en la agricultura , desde hace 13 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes hacia su cultivo es poder tener una producción . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos el cual aplicara al cultivo para ver buenos resultados con la producción.
texts.en:
Orlando Jesús Galán F. is 36 years old and lives in the La Francia neighborhood, located in the municipality of Ticuantepe, along with his wife that works and helps with the household expenses. They have three children, which are currently studying in secondary school. In their free time the work in agriculture and have been doing this for 13 years. The biggest difficultly that they face is the lack of financing. He started out with the support of his parents and his plans are to start having a harvest for production. With the loan they will buy fertilizers and other materials which they will apply to the crops to improve their harvest's yield.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and other materials for their crops to improve the harvest

loans.name: Nasma

texts.en:
Nasma is a member of the Faraja borrower group in Msamvu, Mororgoro. She is a 26-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of one child. Her child is aged 5 years.

One year ago Nasma started her own business selling produce. She works twelve hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 60,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Nasma’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more produce. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, she hopes to pay school fees, save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Marta Ofelia

texts.es: Marta Ofelia T. D. V. resiD. en Ciudad Delgado ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Marta tiene 52 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos nietos menores D. edad y estudiantes. Marta posee una tienda llamada ‘‘Bendición D. Dios’’, con diecinueve años  D. experiencia en  su negocio Marta sabe lo importante que es  la atención a su clientes es por eso que ahora Marta es D. las tiendas con mayor afluencia D. clientes diarios, Marta esta solicitando este crédito para surtir su negocio lo que le permitirá a seguir triunfando en su ventas como hasta el día D. hoy.
texts.en:
Marta Ofelia T. D. V. lives in the city of Delgado, which is located in the District of San Salvador. She is 52 years old and lives with her husband and 2 grandchildren, who are students. Marta owns a store called “Blessing of God”, which has been in business for 19 years. She knows the importance of taking care of her customers. For this reason, Marta’s store is one of the shops most frequently visited on a daily basis.

She is requesting a loan to restock her business so that she can continue to experience successful sales each and every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora S. is from the village of Mamanga Gamay. She is 44 years old. Flora is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Flora raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Flora is just starting this business.

In 2008, Flora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers like manure. Flora is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Flora from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn Z. is from the village of Camp Phillips, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Evelyn owns and operates a business making curtains and buying and selling bed sheets to local community members. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica P. owns a jeepney. She earns regular income by transporting people going to and fro Talibon.  She has nine children. Her eldest child is 18 years old and is very excited to go to college. She wants to earn more money to support all the needs in their home. That is why she requested for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to be able repair her damage jeepney. After the jeepney will be repaired, she will again have an income for her family.

loans.use: To repair jeepney

loans.name: Lyncille

texts.en: Lyncille P. is from the village of Inobulan, Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 20 years old, is single, and has one infant child. Lyncille owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lyncille joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Relita

texts.en:
She is a resident of Marcos, Roxas, Isabela and a loving mother of four children: Apolonio Jr, Juliet, Gilbert, and Judith. Judith is on her third year in college and the others are already college 
graduates while others stopped from their studies due to lack of financial resources.  

Relita is married to Apolonio Sr, a farmer. Farming is their main source of income however, their income from their farm is not enough so she decided to engaged in hog raising business.  In this way, she can assist her husband in providing the basic needs of their family especially that their income from their farm is seasonal.  Sometimes, she and her husband are working as laborers in others farm to earn additional income.

She is now asking for a business capital of PHP5,000 from the KIVA lenders that she needed to purchase feeds supply for the growth of their hogs.

loans.use: To buy feeds for their hogs

loans.name: Enkhdalai

texts.en:
J. Enkhdalai is 37 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Mongolia's Khovd province. Their home is a ger, or traditional nomadic tent. All of his children (two sons and two daughters) attend a local secondary school, and his wife is currently serving as governor of their local bagh (or district). Enkhdalai operates a grocery in his town. He previously worked for six years trading animal skins for grocery products in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, before opening his own store in 2006. Enkhdalai has built his shop into a stable operation over the last three years and has many plans for the future. He is working diligently to improve his business and says, "One must work hard to survive in these poor economic times." He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~$1,400 USD) loan to buy grocery products to sell in his store.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials in bulk

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Africa. She is married with 4 children and she is 49 years old. She sells groceries in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She hopes for a loan to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
la señora Gladys F. C. tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera y se dedica a la compra y venta de refrescos en varios tamaños, agua en bolsa y botes. 
los fines de semana elabora golosinas como ser: tacos, enchiladas, tajaditas, tortilla con quesillo que son un platillo tipico de esa zona. 
 
Gladys tiene 04 hijos,  dos de ellos estan viviendo en los estados unidos y 02 en honduras.
sus hijos le ayudan economicamente con algunos gastos del hogar.
 
desea el credito para invertir en su negocio, comprar mas refrescos y agua ya que los carros repartidores de estos productos solo pasan una vez por semana y a veces se queda sin vender por no tener refrescos.
texts.en:
Gladys F. C. is 48 years old and a single mother. She buys and sells soft drinks in various sizes, as well as water in bottles and containers. On the weekends, she prepares snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, plantain chips, and tortillas with cheese, which are traditional dishes of the area.

Gladys has four children. Two of them live in the United States and the other two are in Honduras. They help her financially with some of the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Gladys plans to buy soft drinks and water. The distribution trucks pass through her area once a week and sometimes she runs out of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas & water

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina T. is from the village of Migpange Bonifacio. She is 44 years old. Marina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marina owns and operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, candies, some food for snacks, sugar, salt, noodles, coffee, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Marina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Marina is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and engage to other business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions and pay her children's tuition.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married. She sells women's clothing at Yulana market in Pavlograd town and her income is about 5,000 UAH per month.

Natalya started her own business thirteen years ago. A small salary that was not paid on time forced her to think of having her own business. She began to sell women's clothing and her business began to grow. Recently she opened a second location. She is glad she can increase her turnover as well as give a job to someone who needs it.

Natalya would like to borrow 12,000 UAH to purchase seasonal inventory. She hopes to receive additional income and take better care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth G. is a cheerful mother of four children whose ages range from one to 12 years old. She joined ASHI just recently because she wants to fulfill her dream of supporting the education of her children until they graduate from college. The loan she is requesting from Kiva through its partner organization in the Philippines, ASHI, will be used to purchase dried fish to sell. 

Dried fish is the most common way to preserve fish, especially during harvest season where the supply is huge and the demand is low. Therefore, it is sold at a cheaper cost. When fish is out of season, the price gets high and people tend to buy dried fish instead. This is actually common for the whole Antique province and products are even sold in huge malls in different cities in different regions. 

For Elizabeth, the proceeds of her business will be used to finance the basic needs of her children. She hopes that her business someday will grow and become a source for the education of her children when they are in college.

loans.use: To puchase dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nyakaina Central Development Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
M. Enos at the top left of the group photo also appears in the small photo and he is a 79-year-old married man, residing in Nyakana village, Rukungiri. He is a married man with three children, all going to school.

Enos is a cattle farmer involved in the sale of milk and cites the inflated prices of drugs and other veterinary essentials as one of his drawbacks. He has been operating his business for a period of over twenty-five years and he reckons that he makes profits amounting to 35,000/= per week.

Enos is a devoted and hardworking gentleman whose friendly line of conduct has endeared him to many customers. He anticipates his livelihood will be improved once he obtains this loan to buy more drugs and pay his workers.

loans.use: To buy more drugs and pay his workers

loans.name: Maria Rufina

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente está ubicado en la comarca el jicarito su dirección es de la bomba de agua 100 vrs al sur.
Ella los primeros 3 créditos fueron para la crianza de cerdos y los otros posteriores fueron para ganado, los mismos le han se3rvido para la compra e terreno y mejoramiento del ganado.
texts.en:
This client is located in the Jicarito region. Her address is 100 varas (a vara is approximately .8 meter) south of the water pump. She used the first three loans for raising pigs. The later loans were for livestock. She also bought a piece of land and improved her livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retention of three dairy cows

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina S. lives in the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. She makes a living by running a general store where she sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, shampoo, candies, cotton, coffee and more.  She has been in this business for more than five years, and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2007, Angelina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid four previous loans from GDMPC, and has applied for a new one to invest in expanding her small store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mabéa

texts.fr:
Cette femme est mariée et a 4 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè gbonvé qui est  un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de boissons locales alcoolisées appelées « tchoucoutchou » faite à base de sorgho ou de mil. Ce commerce lui réussit bien car cette boisson est très appréciée des togolais. Elle voudrait gonfler son stock pour accroître  son chiffre d’affaire. Ayant déjà obtenu du crédit de WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite de un second crédit pour s’approvisionner en sorgho et en bois de chauffage pour la préparation du tchoucoutchou.
Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman is married with four children, and lives with her family in the Agoè Gbonvé borough, on the outskirts of Lomé. Her revenue-genertating activity is the sale of a local alcoholic beverage called “tchoucoutchou”, made from a base of sorghum or millet. This activity is rather successful as this beverage is quite appreciated by Togolese. She wishes to boost her stock supply to increase her turnover. She has already received one previous loan from WAGES which she repaid in full. She is now requesting a second loan to buy sorghum and firewood to prepare the tchoucoutchou.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sorghum and firewood

loans.name: Lumiere Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Lumière sont des  6 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 6 enfants et vivant  dans des  familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.Tous  les prêts précédents ont  été correctement remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles  divers tels que la préparation et vente de l’encens par Mariam Dembélé, l’achat vente du bois de chauffe, des gingembre etc.
Mariam compte acheter avec son  prêt  20kg de guenni + 10kg de magnon kisenin. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso auprès des grossistes.
Les encens prêts à l’utilisation sont vendus au  marché d’HAMDALLAYE et en famille à une clientèle composée de femmes, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six members of the Lumière group are all married women. Their average age is 33 and they have, on average, 6 children. They live in polygamous families in Hamdallaye, a neighbourhood in Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).
In order to meet the needs of their customers, they are on their fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They have repaid all of their previous loans.
These women work in various trades, buying and selling firewood, ginger etc. Mariam Dembélé makes and sells incense. Mariam plans to buy 20kg of guenni and 10kg of magnon kisenin with her loan. She buys her stock from wholesalers at the big market in Sikasso.
She sells the ready-to-use incense at the Hamdallaye market and within her family, mostly to women. Her customers pay with cash and often with credit.
She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 18.500 FCFA, part of which will go towards family expenses and the rest will be invested in her business.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make incense

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana B. is from the village of Tugas. She is 65 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Marciana owns & operates a business venture in the food sector of fishing. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of ocean-caught fish in the market. Marciana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2005, Marciana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Marciana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Marciana from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani has applied for loan from Asasah to repair her son’s rickshaw. She lives with her family in Borewala, a city of shrines in Pakistan, where her son is a rickshaw driver. He has been in this work for the last six years. He learnt this driving skill from his father. He got his education till 8th standard and couldn’t study further because his father had no financial resources besides his meager income.  

Rani started making artificial flowers a few years ago to support her family financially. She sells her flowers to gift shops and in the community as well and generates income for the family. She is very good at her art and gets regular orders. Rani will use the loan amount for repairing her son’s rickshaw. 

A newly maintained rickshaw will run more smoothly and help her son to work for longer hours thus making him more money.

loans.use: Repair her son's rickshaw

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
