This will allow her to increase her sales, and thus increase her income so that she will be able to pay for her daughter's education. Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La señora Vilma pertenece al banco comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, vive en Jr. la Merced 6ta cuadra, distrito de Juanjui, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 46 años y es madre de 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad. Es viuda. Vilma con el primer prestamo de S/ 300.00 decide invertir en zapatos. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

 En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, compra zapatos de Trujillo y los vende a sus amigos, compañeros de trabajo, vecinos y personas que la conocen, esto le permite un ingreso mensual para el pago puntual de sus  cuotas.

Con este prestamo de S/ 1.500 que será pagado en 6 meses, comprara zapatos de diferentes tallas y modelos  para mujeres, caballeros y niños.

Vilma manifiesta estar agradecida con el banco por permitirle crecer como mujer y empresaria.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to el Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo.” She lives on Jr. La Merced Block 6, in the district of Juanjui, in the state of San Martín. She is 46 years old and is the mother of 3 children, all adults. She is a widow. With her first loan of 300 soles, Vilma decided to invest in shoes. She has been working with the bank for 2 years. Currently she continues with the same business, in which she buys shoes from Trujillo and sells them to her friends, coworkers, neighbors, and other people she knows. This allows her to have a monthly income so that she may punctually make the payments on her loan. With this loan of 1,500 soles, that will be paid in 6 months, she will buy shoes of different sizes and models for women, men, and children. Vilma expresses her gratitude with the bank because it helps her grow as a woman and an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes of different sizes and models for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Jose  Ebe

texts.en:
Jose Ebe C. owns a small farm in their village. He is 37 years old and has 3 children. He has worked in the farm for almost 2 years already. His wife, Glenda C. helps him manage their farm. Aside from rice, they also grow other crops in their backyard. The harvest is what they use to buy their other needs. Because of their farm, it's now easier to feed and clothe their family.

Jose Ebe is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides and seeds for his farm. The loan will truly help him improve his yield. He is also interested in venturing into another line of business. Some of his loan will also be used to start a new livelihood.

CEVI provides their clients like Jose Ebe not just credit assistance. They also give training and insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase urea, Insecticide, and seeds

loans.name: Kolap

texts.en:
Kolap P. is a villager in Chus village, in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Sam Seng, is an employee.

Kolap is applying for a loan to add to her savings to purchase timber to build a house for her family.

She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the left of the picture.

loans.use: Buy timber to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Castellón se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos el cual posee en su propio establecimiento en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y ha mantenido su negocio en buen estado por lo que ha adquirido materiales de trabajo como vitrinas y mejora del local.

Actualmente la señora Blanca requiere de un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos y de esta manera continuar adelante en su negocio llevando el sustento a su hogar que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca Castellón dedicates herself diligently to the business of food preparation and sales, which she conducts in her own shop in Managua’s Mercado de Mayoreo. She has forged ahead with a lot of effort, and has managed to maintain her business in good condition, purchasing display cases and improving her shop. Currently, Mrs. Blanca needs a loan to purchase raw materials to for food preparation, thus forging ahead in her business and providing her household with the livelihood and support it needs from her.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A. is forty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: two daughters and four sons. All of her children are in junior high or primary school. Janet lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming and commercial town called Takorase, which is near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Janet works to support her husband financially in providing for the family, especially the children’s education. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops. Janet trades in fried fish. She procures fresh fish in cartons from nearby cold store operators and fries them herself. She distributes to food vendors and sells some herself by hawking. Janet has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to procure fish in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful that she will be expand her business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: Maria Luisa M. D. C. vive en Santa Tecla departamento La Libertad, Maria vive junto a su esposo y 3 hijos adoptivos. Maria cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que ya esta jubilado y recibe una pensión mensualmente, Maria y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración D. pan dulce y pan frances, pero esta pareja no se cansa del trabajo y ahora están montando una pequeña tienda dentro D. su misma casa, es por ello que solicitan un crédito ya que su negocio va empezando y desean surtirlo con variedad D. productos D. primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa M. D. C. lives in Santa Tecla in the department of La Libertad. Maria lives with her husband and three adopted children and is able to count on support from her husband, since he is retired and receives a monthly pension. Maria and her husband make Sweet and French breads for a living. However, since this couple never gets tired of working, they are now starting a small store in their home. This is why they are asking for a loan. Their business is already moving along and they would like to stock it with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: para surtir su tienda

loans.name: Ismary Cecilia

texts.es: la Sra. Ismary M. tiene 35 años de edad, es madre de tres preciosas niñas, tiene de dedicarse a este negocio hace un año, en su pulperia vende productos como ser jabones, refrescos, pollos, espaguetis, salsas, palomitas de maiz, margarina y otros, el negocio se encuentra en un lugar estrategico donde transita mucha gente. la sra compra a la semana $474 y vende $586 obteniendo una ganancia de $112 a la semana, ella necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor, ya que asi se consiguen a mejor precio de lo normal, ella vive con su esposo y sus tres hijas, el sueño de ella es tener un mercadito bien instalado con todas las necesidades para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ismary M. is 35 years old and is the mother of three precious girls. She has been working at her present business for the past year. She has a small grocery store where she sells products like soaps, soft drinks, chicken, pasta, sauces, popcorn, margarine, and many other things. Her store has a great location with a lot of traffic. Ismary buys $474 worth of goods during the week and she sells $586. Her profit is $112 a week. She needs a loan to buy merchandise in bulk, since she can get the merchandise at better prices than the normal prices. She lives with her husband and her three children. Her dream is to have a little market that is all set up with all of the necessary items so that she can serve her customers well.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, churros, pasta, flour, spaghetti, lard, oil, sausages, and milk products.

loans.name: Maritza Zenaida

texts.es:
Maritza es socia del Banco Comunal Poder.
Maritza es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Maritza junto a su esposo tienen carros que alquilan para realizar taxi, además su esposo realiza taxi en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Maritza también vende ropa a pedido que vende al crédito.
Maritza necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos y batería para su carro.
Los sueños de Maritza son tener una negocio estable y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the Power Community Bank. Martiza is married, is 28 years old, and has two children. Maritza and her husband have cars that they rent as taxis. Also, her husband operates a taxi in the city of Ayacucho. Maritza also sells specially-ordered clothes on credit. Maritza needs a loan of 750 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of spare tires and batteries for her car. Maritza’s dreams are to have a stable business and to offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare tires and batteries for her car

loans.name: Nancy Alexandra

texts.es:
Sra. Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer, que consiste de 13 socias que viven en la comunidad de Zhidmad, aproximadamente 30 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca. Las principales actividades en la zona son la agricultura y la ganadería. 

Nancy tiene 22 años, es casada, y tiene dos hijos de 3 y 1 años. Ella vive en la casa de su mama, donde se dedica a cuidar a su familia y también a la crianza de pollos. Se metió en este negocio hace poco tiempo. Nos cuenta que criar pollos es un trabajo un poco complicado, porque a veces los animales mueren de frío, por eso hay que cuidarles bien y también vacunarles siempre. Ella cría los pollos desde pequeños, y después los vende a tiendas y carnicerías. Ella misma los mata, los pela, y los vende a 80 centavos la libra. 

Nancy está pidiendo un préstamo para poder comprar más pollos pequeños para criar. Compra los pollos para $3.50 el par. También comprará sacos de maíz y harina para poder alimentar a sus pollitos.
texts.en:
Sra. Nancy is a member of the communal bank group “Nuevo Amanecer”, which consists of 13 members who live in the Zhidmad community, located about 30 minutes outside the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. The main business activities in the area are agriculture and livestock.

Nancy is 22 years old, married, and has 2 children (ages 3 and 1). She lives in her mother's house, where she cares for her family and raises chickens at the same time. This is a new business venture that she recently started. She says raising chickens is somewhat complicated because the animals can die from the cold weather. For this reason, she must take good care of them and also have them vaccinated. She has raised chickens since she was a young girl, and later was responsible for selling them to grocery stores and butchers. She kills and plucks the birds, and then sells them for $0.80/pound.

Nancy is asking for a loan to buy more small chickens to raise. She can purchase chickens for $3.50/pair. She will also buy bags of corn and grain to feed to her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy small chickens, animal feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Mr. Man L., 34, and his wife, Mrs. Sithon Lun, 36, have been married since 2000 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One is in school while the other two are yet too young to attend. The famiL. lives in a small village on National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mr. L. has been selling cows for four years, while his wife has been a teacher since 1990. He hopes to expand his business to better support his famiL., so he is requesting his first loan of $1,200 in order to purchase additional cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional cows for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Graciela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Marcelo II”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 54 años y todos sus hijos ya independientes.

Rosa Graciela, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas y chichas (bebida hecha a base de harina de maíz). Es ella misma quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 y empezó comprando 03 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto y asi poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas.

En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes de su barrio y de otros lugares.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará más bebidas como gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas, parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de insumos como: harina de maíz, azúcar y clavo de olor, para dar un rico sabor a sus bebidas.
 
Rosa Graciela, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente motivada por hacer realidad  lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Graciela is a member of the Communal Bank “San Marcello II”, which is located the District of Morales, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 54 years old and single. All of her children live on their own.

Rosa Graciela is woman who enjoys working, so she decided to start her own business selling soft drinks and chicha (a drink made from cornmeal). When it comes to managing her business, she doesn’t follow a set schedule and she is her own boss. She tells us that she started with 300 soles to buy 3 packs of sodas. She did very well, so she gradually invested more into her business.

Her business continues to operate and she is well-known by her customers in the neighborhood and from elsewhere. With her loan of 1000 soles, Rosa Graciela will buy more beverages such as sodas of different flavors, sizes, and brands, as well as mineral water (both carbonated and non-carbonated). She will also use some of the money to buy ingredients such as cornmeal, sugar, and cloves to give a rich flavor to her beverages.

Rosa Graciela has many goals ahead of her and she is motivated to meet every one of them. She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing help when she needed it. She has been responsible with her payments and plans to continue in the same manner.

Click HERE to view Rosa Graciela’s previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & ingredients for making "chicha"

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda C. helps her husband till a 3 hectare farm that was given to them by her parents. She's helped her husband with the farm since the start of their marriage. She has five children (the oldest is 19) that gives her the strength to fight and succeed in business.

She would like a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy seeds and pay for labour for her farm. She says she likes the services of CEVI because, aside from the fact that it is very manageable to repay, you learn a lot of things from the cluster meetings and there is biblical reflection in CEVI.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a loving and hard-working mother to her five children. She manages to support all of them through her vegetable vending business. One of her children is already a college graduate. Yolanda and her youngest son are residing in Barangay Namnama, Cabatuan, Isabela. Their house is along the provincial highway where Yolanda sells different kinds of vegetables and fruit in her small stall.

She is earning a weekly gross income of PHP 7,000 from selling vegetables. She would like to take out a loan of PHP 10,000 from KIVA lenders that will serve as additional capital for her business for it to grow and become productive. She hopes that through her business, they can uplift their life out of poverty. Yolanda shared with us that managing such a business requires a lot of patience, thus always be hard-working in everything and remain patient.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina S. D. M. resiD. en San Martin municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Marina cuenta con 49 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y su hijo Carlos D. 19 años D. edad. El esposo D. Marina trabaja fuera D. casa como panificador, mientras  Marina instalo hace unos años una tienda en su casa, al ver que no se encontraba con competencia a los alrededores, ahora Marina maneja su negocio por el cual solicita este crédito para surtirlo D. variedad D. productos.
texts.en:
Marina S. D. M. lives in the San Martin municipality in the San Salvador department. Marina, 49, lives with her husband and her 19 year old son, Carlos. Marina’s husband works outsiD. of the home as a baker. A few years ago Marina set up a store in her house. She saw that there was no competition around. Now Marina runs the business. She is asking for a loan to stock her store with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
“A man with patience and sacrifices will land on success”, this is a word of encouragement shared by Adela, a resident of Poblacion, Diadi,Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Alfredo and they have been gifted with seven children, three boys and four girls.  They want them to finish their college education and have a bright future.  They endure hardships and difficulties to earn a living for the sake of their children.

Her husband is one of the village councilors and also works as a laborer while she works as a vendor of fruit shake and homemade bath soap in their village.  She started her business with a small capital investment and she now earns a net income of PHP 650.00 week. Since her business greatly helps with the family expenses, she wants to continue and improve it. Lack of capital has motivated her to ask for a financial loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00.  She will invest the loan to purchase more merchandise so that her business will grow.

loans.use: Additional capital for the improvement of her food production business

loans.name: Abdul Hameid

texts.en: Abdul Hameid is the son of S. M.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40, and is married with 4 children. He runs a business selling construction supplies, and needs an individual loan of 30,000 AFN to purchase more materials in order to advance and bring some changes to his business. He would like to say that the Kiva process is really effective for people in Afghanistan because they are really in need of support.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона Шарифова проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 21 год. Свободна. Фарзона более 3 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном торгует национальными материалами, тканями. Кредит просит для закупа нового ассортимента, т.е. увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Farzona S. lives in the Hamadoni district. She is 21 years and single. Farzona has been involved in retail sales at a market. She mainly sells traditional materials and fabrics. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase new variety of merchandise, i.e. increasing goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Joel's Group

texts.en:
Joel V. is from the village of Centro 2, San Guillermo, Isabela. He is 46 years old. Joel is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Joel is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Joel runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Joel has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Joel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Joel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet sells local gin in the market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. Local gin is also known as Ogogoro in Nigeria. The demands for her local gin are high, and she hopes to meet the demands of her numerous customers. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She is married with 12 children. She is 48 years old. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more local gin to sell. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Sandra Lucia

texts.es: Sandra tiene 34 años, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que actualmente no tenía un trabajo para mantener a su familia. Ella se dedica  a la venta de cosméticos, cuando inicio no tenia el capital suficiente y además no tenia la mercadería suficiente para  ofrecer solamente tenia pinturas de uñas, base, pinturas de labios, por que tenia muy pocos clientes. Pero con el paso del tiempo ha mejorado para interactuar con sus clientes ya que antes no tenía esas habilidades por su poca experiencia pero ella ha logrado mejorar lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de perfumes, cremas, colonias, pinturas de labios y base. Su deseo es obtener  ingresos para  mejorar las condiciones de vida de su ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is 34 years old and has been involved with her business of selling cosmetics for more than five years because did not have a job to support her family at the time. When she began, she did not have the sufficient funds and, in addition, she did not have sufficient merchandise to sell. She only had nail polish, foundation, lipstick to begin, because she had very few customers. However, with time, she has improved her interaction with her customers. She did not previously have those skills because of lack of experience, but she has been able to improve them as necessary. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of perfume, cream, cologne, lipstick, and foundation. Her wish is to obtain income to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La  Señora Maritza Gutiérrez Martínez, Labora como Aseador en la Unidad de Intendencia en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.
 
 Ella  tiene  un hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casada, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos  años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en materiales de construcción como, piedra y cemento para embaldosar el frente de su casa de habitación, ya que esta es de tierra y el polvo dentro de la casa y esto perjudica la salud de sus hijos.

Maritza dijo que gracias a los financiamientos ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
. Maritza Gutiérrez Martínez works as a cleaning lady in the maintenance department of the Nicaragua National Autonomous University. She is married and has a school-age child under her care. She has had three loans with CEPODEL during two years. Thanks to these loans from CEPRODEL, she invested the three loans in home improvements The loan requested now will be used to buy building materials like stone and cement to tile the front of the house, which is currently dirt and the dust inside the house is a health hazard for her children. Maritza said that she has been able to improve her house thanks to the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge and make improvements to her home.

loans.name: United Friend Progressive Organization Group

texts.en:
For 26 years, Martin G. has had a used shoes business on Randall Street in Monrovia. He is 52 years old, married, and has six children who range in age from 4 to 21. In addition to his children, Martin also supports his sibling. 

Martin’s business is in a convenient location which keeps his customers returning. He started his business with 100 Liberian dollars (LRD) and is now operating with 25,000 LRD. Martin plans to use his 12,000 LRD portion of this 66,000 LRD group loan to leave the sidewalk and move into a store. His goal is to be productive in life and to grow his business. 

Martin is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "United Friend Progressive Organization". In the photo that accompanies this profile, Martin is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To move his business from the sidewalk into a store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her business

loans.name: Floria's Group

texts.en:
Floria B. is from the village of Manano. She is 58 years old. Floria is the group leader of a 10-member group. While each member of the group receives an individual loan through ASKI, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is the Floria B. Group.

Floria is married and has two adult children. To earn a living, Floria owns and operates a general store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Floria has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Floria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Floria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Floria is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This  will be the eleventh loan taken out by Floria through ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue it generates to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva and edited by a human editor. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new products to expand selection

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente es originario del poblado de mina el limón,
Es Pensionado, actualmente trabaja como fiscal en la procesadora de arroz de san Isidro al productor, Noel Pastora, su esposa es maestra actualmente pensionada, y siempre ha mantenido una continuidad de préstamos con la empresa y de esa manera a mejorado su nivel de vida
texts.en:
This client is from the town of Mina el Limón. He receives a pension, and he currently works as an attorney for the San Isidro rice processor. The producer is Noel Pastora. His wife, a teacher, currently receives a pension. They have always maintained a continuity of loans with the business, and that way they have improved their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy door, window, and plaster

loans.name: Armida

texts.es: Esta cliente es originaria del casco urbano de cinco pinos, solicita el crédito para compra de materiales tales como: cuarterones, bolsa de cemento, arena, quintales de hierro, laminas de zinc, para asi de esta manera tener una casa digna donde pueda vivir con su familia, esta agradecida ya que atraves de este crédito va a tener su propia casita.
texts.en:
Esta cliente es originaria del casco urbano de cinco pinos, solicita el crédito para compra de materiales tales como: cuarterones, bolsa de cemento, arena, quintales de hierro, laminas de zinc, para asi de esta manera tener una casa digna donde pueda vivir con su familia, esta agradecida ya que atraves de este crédito va a tener su propia casita.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para compra de materialez de contruccion

loans.name: Today Sunshine Group

texts.en:
Deddeh W. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called 'Today Sunshine'. She is 38 years old, married with 5 children who range from 2 to 21 years old. She also cares for her husband. Deddeh could not continue her education through elementary school because she started having children.

For 6 years she has been selling provisions at the Wroto Town community in Sinkor Monrovia, Liberia. She started business with 1,000 Liberian dollars as working capital but now has more than 20,000 Liberian Dollars as working capital. Deddeh keeps her goods very clean in order to keep customers returning.

Her goal and dream is to purchase a plot of land to construct a house. She plan to use her 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 36,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to purchase more provisions for sale.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Deddeh is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a 24-year-old business lady. She is married to a doctor and they have two children who are in school.

Millicent sells charcoal in Machakos and describes her business as busy. She also rears livestock to earn extra income.

Millicent has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 to add to her stock of charcoal to sell. She hopes to be the main charcoal supplier in her town and describes herself as hardworking.

In the future, Millicent desires to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To add to her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Mrs. Pon T., 50, is a local rice farmer in the village. In addition, she has connected to the watering system, which she pumps to sell by retail to people who live near her home. By doing this work, she is able to generate formal proceeds. Pon T. is a widow and the mother of three children who are now married and live with her in the family home. Pon T. always needs to pay a taxi for the propose of travelling to anywhere, as she has no vehicle of her own. She now wants to cut down this fee by asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle, which will provide transportation for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn Q. is from Bernad Subdivision, Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years of age. Jocelyn is married and has 2 children both of whom are now school-aged. To make a living, Jocelyn is engage in operating a sari-sari (variety) store and retailing Hypochlorine, a disinfectant and anti-stain chemical. Her main source of income comes from her sari-sari store and hypo-retailing business. Jocelyn has been engaged in  this kind of business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

 In August 2008, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Jocelyn is now requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used as added capital for her sari-sari store and hypo-retailing businesses. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store and Hypo-retailing businesses

loans.name: Ramza

texts.en:
Ramza is a 34-year-old married woman from Lebanon who has owned a clothing boutique since 2007, selling and renting wedding dresses.

Ramza has requested a loan of $2,500 to improve and empower her business, as well as to expand her shop so that she is able to increase her income and enlarge her business. This is her fourth loan and she has always repaid her loans on time.

Ramza’s previous loans allowed her to continually improve her work. What distinguishes her shop is the good quality of her merchandise.

loans.use: To improve and empower her business

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 28 years old. Michelle is married and has a 1-year-old child. To make a living, Michelle owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over 4 years. She recently started a sari-sari store where she sells salt, soy sauce and many others. She hopes for her store to grow.

Michelle joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michelle has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Michelle is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Michelle from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Elizabel

texts.es:
ELIZABEL P. R.

Actualmente Elizabel tiene 45 años, casada y con una hija. Desde hace dos años  viene trabajando con EDAPROSPO - Prosperidad, ocupa el cargo de presidenta en ALCOM “UNIDAS AL PROGRESO”, llamado así por el apoyo que tienen entre sí, las doce integrantes se dedican al comercio y otros servicios.

Elizabel nos cuenta que su esposo Marcos Gregorio Quispe Lozano, administra una empresa contratista “CARMENCITA”, en alquiler de transporte público, así también hace tres años cuentan con un carrito propio que es alquilada para ofrecer servicios al público, siendo sus rutas Chosica-Buenos Aires-Villa María, con las que  aporta S/. 40.00 diarios como un ingreso más a su hogar, a ese esfuerzo realizado se logró adquirir una camioneta de modelo 4 x 4, para su uso personal,  por lo que agradecen  a EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD quienes colaboraron con ella otorgándoles préstamos con el fin de mejorar la calidad de servicio en mantenimiento de su vehículo y la compra de accesorios como llantas nuevas.
Elisabel como toda madre se dedica a su hogar y su hija, apoya considerablemente a Marcos su esposo. Sueña comprar un carrito nuevo y afianzar sus gastos, asimismo agarrar otra contrata.
El reciente préstamo que se le otorgó lo invertirá en la compra de aceite y llantas nuevas para su movilidad.
texts.en:
ELIZABEL P. R. Elizabeth is 45 years old and married with one daughter. She has been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for the last two years, filling the role of president in the group ALCOM "UNIDAS AL PROGRESO" ("United to Progress"), which is so named because of the support that the members offer each other. The 12 members of the group are engaged in commerce and other services. Elizabeth tells us that her husband, Marcos, runs a contracting business called "Carmencita" that rents vehicles for public transportation. For three years he has had his own car that serves the public on the Chosica-Buenos Aires-Villa María route, which brings in 40 Soles a day as extra income to their home. Thanks to these efforts, they were able to buy a 4WD truck for their own personal use, and they are thankful to EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad who worked with Elizabel and gave her loans with the goal of improving the vehicles service and maintenance and buying accessories such as new tires. Elizabel, like any mother, is devoted to her home and her daughter, and she gives great support to her husband, Marcos. She dreams of buying a new car, securing their finances, and getting a new contract. She will use the new loan to buy oil and new tires for their vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil and new tires for her vehicle

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 50 years old, married, and has been blessed with four children who are all adults. A farmer from Kahuro division, Murang'a town in Central Kenya, Teresia has been practising mixed farming for over 20 years and employs two casual labourers. Her farm produces vegetables, milk and coffee, all of which she sells to the local market. She also earns income from her small shop in the same area.

Teresia is requesting this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase dairy goats. She is determined to achieve enough income to improve her family's living conditions and reduce her dependency on her children. She hopes to eventually breed pure dairy goats only. Teresia says that Juhudi is doing a commendable job of helping small scale farmers develop sustainable agricultural businesses.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano, de 49 años de edad, está casado y tiene siete hijos. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva tropical cuzqueña, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. A pesar de tener primaria incompleta, eso no fue un pretexto para que pueda seguir con su sueño de tener su propio negocio, es así que logró cultivar y producir café, ahora cuenta con compradores fieles que siempre acuden a él para conseguir la mejor calidad de este producto. Por otro lado, ambiciona tener un taller de planchado de pintura, solo así logrará obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir su canasta familiar. Es por ello que necesita trabajar para generarse el capital necesario para poner en práctica el taller que desea abrir. Normalmente tiene la ayuda de su familia, quienes le facilitan la extracción y selección de su producto agrícola, siendo estos vendidos en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está satisfecho con su banco comunal, debido a las buenas ventajas que lo ofrece. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de abono, con la finalidad de que lo pueda brindar un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Felciano is 49 and married with seven children. Together they live in the town of Quimbiri, located in the beautiful tropical jungle of Cusco, where they have their own house made of wood. In spite of having incomplete primary education, this was not an excuse to not continue with his dream to have his own business, and so he succeeded in cultivating and producing coffee. Now he has faithful buyers who always go to him for the high quality of this product. On the other hand, his ambition is to have an auto body shop, so he can obtain the necessary income to cover the basic needs of his family. It is because of this that he needs to work to generate the necessary capital to put into practice the workshop that he wants to open. Normally, he has the help of his family, who assist with the extraction and selection of his agricultural product, which is sold in the collection centers of their town. This is his sixth loan with MFP, for which he promises to continue following his payment schedule. He is satisfied with his communal bank, because of the good advantages it offers him. With the credit that he is asking for, he plans to buy fertilizer for the purpose of offering suitable protection for his coffee crop.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to protect his coffee cultivations

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Teresita is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 54 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hermias de 60 años y sus 2 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Con mucho esfuerzo Julia ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papas, arvejas y maíz, las cuales luego lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 38 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en anteriores préstamos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil trescientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Julia, 54, is a cheerful and hard working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband Hermias, aged 60, and their 2 young sons, who are the reason behind their efforts. Julia has painstakingly managed to make her land very productive. She cultivates potatoes, peas and corn, which she then sells at the wholesale market in the town of Tarma. Her crops have provided the necessary income to support her family. That's the reason why she wants to do everything she can to help the business succeed. 

What she likes the most about her job is caring for her crops. She has been doing it for 38 years and she thinks that the most difficult thing is transporting her products to Tarma, because the sacks are very heavy and make her very tired. In the future she would like to buy more lands to increase her production.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual in the repayment of previous loans and this time she expects to do the same. She is a very active member of her loan group, always aware of the agreements reached by her group. With the 1300 soles requested she will buy more fertiliser for her lands.

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertiliser.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is farming. 

She has operated her business of selling coconuts and brooms for over twelve years. She sells to restaurant operators, neighbours and food vendors. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to start a poultry business in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase palm leaf trees and timber to renovate her house. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to uplift her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase palm leaf trees and timber for renovating her house.

loans.name: Phinary

texts.en:
Mrs. Phinary H. (who is in the photo) is 40 years old and her husband, Mr. Bunlong Chuk is 46 years old, have been married since 1991 and have four children. The family live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phinary is a weaver. Her husband sells silk and cotton products. He buys from other weavers in the village and from his wife’s weaving and transports them for sale in other provinces far away from his house. 

Phinary is requesting her first loan of US $600 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport silk and cotton products for sale.

loans.name: Cory

texts.en:
In eleven years of membership in ASHI, Teresa Dalisay has developed relationships with the other members of ASHI in their barangay. The institution helps her to improve not only her living conditions, but also the social aspects of her life, which is very useful to her and to her funeral homes/services.

Even at 59, her perseverance never fades. When her husband died, she is the one who managed the business and most of her time is spent on her business and with her children. Moreover, she is doing her best to improve her business in order to sustain their basic needs. Through her hardship, courage and industry, her three children have already finished their studies and presently they all have stable jobs. Though her children have their own jobs, she never stops dreaming for their future. She also wants her business to improve in order to help other people in the community by providing employment. She also plans to help her relatives, so that they will become successful someday.

For her next loan, Teresa is applying for PHP 35,000 which she will use as additional capital for her funeral services business. She would like to have a bigger capital base because there are times when she has costumers who can’t afford to buy a coffin in cash, and since she is very considerate she let's her costumers pay for the items in installments. Therefore, a rolling capital will make this more feasible. 

Teresa is now more dignified and happy because there are institutions, like ASHI and its field partner KIVA, which trust and believe in her.

loans.use: For more working capital.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha K. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Ngoun, have been married since 1979 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. One is married and lives in a separate home, two attend school whilst the others are garment-factory workers. The family lives along National Road Number 5 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chantha is a rice farmer. She just started a tailoring business for when she is not at the farm. Her husband is a fisherman and also assists his wife on the farm. Chantha asked for a Kiva loan one time already; she now is asking for another loan of $700 to purchase a water-pumping machine to spray her rice farm and to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To purchase a water-pumping machine to spray her farm

loans.name: Joiel

texts.es: Joel, de 22 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador; que vive junto a su mamá Elizabeth de 43 años, su papá Clemente de 45 años, y su hermano Paúl de 12 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican. Esté responsable joven, hace 5 años que se dedica a la agricultura ayudando a salir adelante a su madre. Sus principales cultivos constan de papa, arveja y hortalizas, los cuales siembra a gran escala, ya que sus padres heredaron muchos terrenos agrícolas. Lo que más le gusta a Joel, es poder esparcir la semilla de su producción, ya que según menciona, “es símbolo de un nuevo objetivo”. En cada cosecha, Joel, viaja al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Pero como joven ambicioso, el desea más adelante abrir una empresa de ganadería, donde pueda criar y comercializar la carne de los animales más comercializados. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, y como socio nuevo de su banco comunal; está orgulloso del progreso obtenido hasta hoy. Con el monto que solicita comprará varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes orgánicos; los cuales esparcirá en sus diferentes sembríos.
texts.en:
22 year-old Joel is a single and hard-working man who lives together with his mom, 43 year-old Elizabeth, his dad, 45 year-old Clemente, and his brother, 12 year-old Paúl.  They live together in their own home which is located in the town of Ricrican.  This responsible young man has been farming for 5 years, helping his mother to get ahead in life.  His main crops are potatoes, peas and vegetables which he grows on a large scale since his parents inherited a lot of farmland.  What Joel likes most is sowing his land with seed since he says "it is the symbol of a new goal".

With every harvest, Joel travels to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.  However, as an ambitious young man, further down the line he would like to open a livestock business where he can raise and sell the meat of animals which make most sales.  This is his first loan with MFP and, as a new member of his community bank, he is proud of the progress he has made up to this point.  He will use his loan money to buy several sacks of manure and organic fertilizer which he will spread on his different crops.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of manure and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Hatantuul

texts.en:
Hatantuul B. is 24 years old and lives with her father and sister the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Her father is retired and both her sister and father stay at home. 

Hatantuul completed her bachelor's degree in 2007 and currently operates a hair salon in a rented space at the local trade center. She started her hair dressing business in 2010 after graduating from a vocational training course as a hairdresser. 

For the future, she hopes to continue operating her business as a stable operation. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase a chair and more hair cutting tools and equipment for her hair salon.

loans.use: To purchase a chair and more hair cutting tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cheese, smoked cheese, cream and curd

loans.name: Masimkan's Group

texts.en:
For everyone who is involved in changing lives of those who are in need, it is twice as pleasant to help somebody’s talent prosper and see the achieved results. Masimkan is one of those who developed her talent thanks to this loan.

Masimkan T., 54, is a leader of this group. She is divorced and lives with a young grandson. For last ten years she’s been doing a small business by offering sewing services. In the beginning she was offering just small services in repairing of clothes. Later she applied for her first loan from Kiva through its Kyrgyz partner, Mol Bulak Finance. It really helped her to promote her business and to realize her new ideas. She brought new innovations into her clothing industry. Step by step she transferred to designing national clothing and to set her level of qualification higher. Soon she tended to have permanent customers ordering new designs on a regular basis. 

With her second loan from Kiva, Masimkan plans to purchase new high-quality fabrics and to design new styles of outfits. Every month she gets income of 7,000 soms, which she spends on daily needs for herself and her grandson. A portion of her profit is reinvested back into the business and the rest is saved. Masimkan was very happy when she saved enough to purchase home electronics and to send her son to Russia to find a permanent job. For Masimkan, this is a second loan offered by Kiva, so she is sure she’ll do her best to repay the loan on time, according to the schedule.

      --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao T. is 34 and lives with her family in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. Mao and her husband are construction workers, earning a daily income of 4 USD. Each month, the family has to spend 60 USD on food and 90 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Mao is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase construction materials to improve her current business. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. In the future, Mao would like to use her additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials to improve business

loans.name: Senia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Senia de 23 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposo Cándido y tienen una hija Evelyn de 2 años de edad, viven en casa de un hermano de Senia.
Se dedica a la administración de una tienda donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad, el horario de venta es de 6:30 am hasta las 7:00pm, ella aprendió de su hermano a llevar el control del negocio, actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería y abastecer el negocio de algunos productos que son más demandados por los clientes, su único riesgo es la venta al crédito, pues algunos clientes no llegan a cancelar lo pendiente.
Su sueño es crecer en el comercio, aumentar la clientela, ayudar cada vez más a su familia pero sobre todo a su hija, para que cuente con lo necesario y tengan un futuro más alentador.
texts.en: Senia, who is 23 years old, lives in Corinto in the Morazán department. She lives with her husband Cándido and they have one daughter, Evelyn, who is 2 years old. They live in Senia's brother's house. She works managing a store where she sells the basic necessities. The shop hours are from 6:30 am until 7:00 pm. She learned the business from her brother. Right now she's requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise and supply the business with some products that are in high demand from her customers. Her only risk is sales made on credit, since some customers don't return to pay off their accounts. Her dream is to grow the business, increase her clientele, and help her family more and more, especially her daughter, so that she has the necessities and they can have a more promising future.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for the business.

loans.name: Marina Filomena

texts.es:
Marina de 55 años, es una mujer trabajadora que por el largo tiempo de su vida a podido especializarse en la costura y confección. Poco a poco con dedicación ha mantenido su taller de confección en una parte de su casa.  

Trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano para terminar los pedidos que le piden. Hace camisas, pantalones, conjuntos etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando pero para ello y tener más ingresos necesita el préstamo para comprar una máquina de coser marca overlot, telas, hilos.
texts.en:
Marina is 55 years old. She is a hard-working woman who has developed the craft of sewing and tailoring over the long years of her life. Little by little, and with dedication, she has been running a sewing workshop in a part of her home.

Marina works every day, starting early in the morning, to finish the orders that her customers place. She makes shirts, pants, outfits, etc. Marina has a lot of aspirations for her business, and she would like to keep working, but in order to do that and to increase her income, she needs to purchase an overlock sewing machine, thread, and fabric.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, thread, fabric

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida P. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Aida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Aida owns & operates a specialized retail store selling coconuts for copras in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Aida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ar: حسن عمره 43 سنة متزوج وله 4 اولاد يعمل في نقل الطلاب والسواح له في عمله15 سنة يحب عمله ويطوره من خلال نقل السواح في المواسم السياحية يتميز بالسعر الجيد والخبرة في العمل يريد تأمين العيش الكريم له ولعائلته ويسعى الى تحسين الوضعين المادي والاجتماعي يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى صيانة الفان خاصته وتحسينه يسعى الى امتلاك نمرة خاصة يرد ان يكون صاحب مهنة خاصة به فهو طموح مثابر ومكب على العمل يحب عائلته وهي كل اهتمامه
texts.en: Hasan is 43 years old and married with four children. He works as a driver for students and tourists. He has 15 years of experience in his field. He likes his work, and he supplements it by working as a driver for tourists during the high seasons of tourism. He stands out in his field through his good prices and his experience. He would like to secure a respectable standard of living for himself and for his family, and he is trying to improve his and his family's material situation and social status. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to have maintenance and touch-ups done on the van he drives. He hopes to one day own his own vehicle, and even more so, he would like to have his own business, as he is ambitious, and devoted to and diligent in his work. He loves his family, and it is what he cares about most in life.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenence to his van.

loans.name: Shemussa

texts.en:
Shemussa is 26 years old and is married with one child, who is 7 years old. She owns a small business selling various styles of African clothes for women. This business is well known and organized. She has two years of experience in this business.

Shemussa has requested her first loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand her business by purchasing more African clothes to sell. Once this expansion is reached, Shemussa will be able to earn more profit. With this extra profit, she plans to build her own house and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Judith

texts.es: Gloria Judith: de 41 años es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos los tres estudian el mayor de ellos trabaja y estudia, ella se dedica a la venta de pan ella tiene su local en la entrada de su comunidad donde vive inicio su negocio hace tres años ella nos cuenta que solicita este credito para la compra de arina para elavorar pan ya que nececita mas capital para trabajar,el sueño de ella es que su negocio crezca y en un futuro con la ayuda de Dios poder vender pollo frito y que sus hijos todos sean unos profecionales y que puedan tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Gloria Judith is 41 and a single mother of 3 children, who are students.  She makes and sells bread out of a shop in the community where she lives.  She began her bakery three years ago and seeks credit to buy flour to increase her production and profits.  Her dream is to see her business grow and expand, perhaps to include other food items such as fried chicken.  She also hopes that her children develop professional skills to have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy flour for bakery production

loans.name: Rogelio Alberto

texts.es:
Rogelio de 45 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de bisuterías y tienen dos hijos mayores de edad. Es asalariado trabaja para una Aereolinea Lan Ecuador. 

El labora en una Aereolinea como almacenista en bodegas, no tiene dificultades en su trabajo. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere invertir en materiales para construcción. En un futuro desea terminar de adecuar su casa construyendo una loza mas en su cas para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Rogelio, who is 45 years old, lives in an urban area in the Orquídeas section of Guayaquil. (Las Orquídeas means "The Orchids", so called because it originally had many orchid flowers).  His wife sells costume jewelry and they have two adult children. He is an employee working for Lan Ecuador airline.

He works for the airline as a storekeeper in the warehouses, and he has no difficulties with his work. With the help of the loan, he wants to invest in building materials. In the future he wants to finish alterations to his home, building a second story on his home so that he can provide the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, sand, paint

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a frozen food business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy frozen foods.

Nemia has been in this business for two years. Nemia earns more income from farming rice and vegetables.

Nemia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy frozen foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food items to cook for resale

loans.name: Isimah

texts.en:
Isimah is 29 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has one child, who does not currently attend school. Isimah has a health clinic business, which he has run for four years. He also has rental houses.
To help expand his business, Isimah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase medicine to sell at the clinic. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Isimah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, he hopes to expand his clinic further.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to sell at his clinic.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 36, believes strong motivation and will power increase one’s chances of being a strong and successful entrepreneur and can be the basis for one to glide over business adversity and periods of burnout. 

The self-starting Jane set the ball rolling in her general merchandise retail trade three years ago in Kihihi in Western Uganda. Retail businesses are highly profitable this side of the country and many people involved in them have been able to improve their circumstances and their families' standards of living.

For Jane, a happy-go-lucky mother of three, this has principally unfolded because she has established strong working relationships with a variety of people, mostly her customers, over the years.

She has also been good at making pivotal decisions and organizing her finances, all aimed at strengthening her business. 

At her shop she sells a variety of general merchandise retail items such as sugar, salt, jerrycans, rice, beans, cooking oil, eggs, etc.

Her strong business notwithstanding, her achievements and strides have been afflicted by inevitable cost issues, lack of sufficient stock when demand is high and envy.
 
She has weathered most of those storms rather successfully and she anticipates that better horizons will open up in the not-so-far future. This, she believes, will happen if she does not rest on her laurels.

Weekly, her gross sales profits are to the tune of UGX 300,000, and she says the purpose of this Kiva loan is to aid her in the purchase of more high-demand retail commodities such as maize flour, cooking oil, sugar, bread, rice and beans to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities such as maize flour, cooking oil, sugar, bread, rice and beans to resell.

loans.name: Adita Mariana

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres 13 De Septiembre.

En este lugar vive la señora Adita, tiene 48 años de edad, está divorciada pero de esa relación tiene seis  hijos, cuatro de ellos  mayores de edad y dos de 17 y 14 años que estudian en colegio, cinco de sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Nuestra amiga lleva más de tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede sacar su negocio adelante.

Nuestra amiga con la finalidad de ganarse para sus sustento diario y el de sus hijos hace ocho años atrás puso un bar en su casa en el mismo vende bebidas  como gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, además de bocadillos para picar como hamburguesas,  empanadas, corviches y productos elaborados, trabaja  de viernes a domingo con la ayuda de sus hijos desde las 14h00 hasta las 22h00.  Gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos después de que se separo.

Este crédito es para comprar, gaseosas, aguas, cervezas, y víveres para preparar los alimentos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un gran negocio y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the community bank named "Mujeres de 13 de Septiembre", meaning "The Women of September 13" meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital city of Manabi, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds.

Here we meet Adita. She is 48 years old and she is divorced, but from that relationship she has six children. Four of her children are grown and the two youngest are 17 and 14 years of age and they attend high school. Five of her children still live at home. Our friend has been with her communal bank for more than three years and she appreciates it becuase it is through loans that she has been able to move her business forward.

Eight years ago our friend set up a bar inside of her house with the goal of earning a daily income for herself and for her children. She also sells soft drinks, juices, beer, and snacks such as hamburgers, savory pastries, and ready to eat products. She works from Friday to Sunday and her children help her from 2:00 pm to 10:00 pm. It is thanks to her work that she has been able to provide for her children following her separation from her husband.

This loan will be used to purchase soft drinks, juices, beer, and grocery products to prepare foods.

Her dream is to have a successful business and to see her children complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, beer, juices, and grocery products.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
This is Elena, 56, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines.  A widow with three children with two are already working while the youngest is still in college. She, together with her children manage their own household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Elena operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Elena hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 41 years old and is a married woman.  She lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur with her family.  She farms for a living.  Shirley grows rice and corn crops on her land.  She earns about 6,000 PHP per month from farming.

Shirley has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs.  She hopes this loan will help her to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Fida'ee

texts.en: Fida'ee is a 40-year-old young man who is married and has two sons. He lives in Ramallah city in Palestine. Fida'ee drives a taxi that he owns and it is the only source of income for the family. He wants to purchase a car repair kit and pay for licensing and insuring the taxi, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Fida'ee takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase the repair kit for the taxi to fix things when needed and to pay for licensing and insuring the taxi so it will be legal. Fida'ee will work extra hours to increase his income and live with his family in better conditions. Fida'ee is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for licensing and insuring his car and to buy a car repair kit.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: Sandra María tiene 34 años, su actividad es una pulpería en donde atiende a sus clientes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. A pesar de ser una comarca muy pequeña ella ha logrado brindar a sus clientes los productos que le solicitan como granos básicos, sopas, enlatados, papel higiénico, fósforos, cigarrillos, golosinas entre otros. Es por eso que se siente motivada a realizar este crédito para la compra de materia prima.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria is 34 years old. She has a small grocery store where she takes care of customers from 7:00AM in the morning until 10:00PM at night. 

Despite being a very small area she has been able to provide her customers with what they want, such as basic grains, soups, canned goods, toilet paper, matches, cigarettes, candy and other items, and this is what motivates her to ask for a loan in order to buy supplies.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soups, canned goods, toilet paper, matches, cigarettes, and candy

loans.name: Fouzia's Group

texts.en:
Fouzia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a rickshaw driver. His rickshaw currently runs on petrol which is very expensive, so he wants to install a CNG kit (set of components and tools that are installed in a vehicle so it can operate using both gasoline and compressed natural gas or CNG) on his rickshaw that will minimize his expenses and increase his rickshaw’s mileage. 
He has been providing transport services to passengers for the past 10 years and Fouzia is very confident that by utilizing the loan he will be able to run his business better and increase his profits. 
Fouzia is 33 years old and she has no children yet, so she spends most of her time doing decorative embroidery which earns her good profits every month. She learned this skill from her mother. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Fouzia”.

loans.use: To install a CNG kit in a rickhsaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Amor De Mujeres Group

texts.es: Socorro es una de las integrantes de Banco solidario Amor De Mujeres, tiene 63 años tiene 6 hijos bajo su cargo, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas, desde hace mas de 18 años, su comarca se llama las mojarras en donde trabaja en su propia vivienda. Este es el primer crédito que solicita para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, bolsas, servilletas entre otros productos. Ya que le permitirá generar ingresos para aportar al hogar y tiene como meta proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda. Al igual que Socorro las otras integrantes del grupo se encuentran muy contentas por este financiamiento ya que cada una de ellas tiene diferentes negocios. En este banco comunal se encuentran Danelia, Otilia, Jeyling, Socorro, Gertrudis, Oneyda, Ana, Meylin, Lourdes, Migdania, Telma, Reyna, Yalma, Martha y Ana.
texts.en: Socorro, 63, is one of the members of the Amor de Mujeres community bank.  She has 6 children, all of whom she supports.  She has operated a business making and selling tortillas for 18 years.  She operates her shop, called Las Mojarras, from her house.  This is her first loan and she will use it to buy maize, quicklime, firewood, bags and other kitchen supplies that she needs for the business.  The loan will help her to increase the income she needs to support her family.  She also wants to make improvements to her house.  The other members of the group have various businesses and, like Socorro, are grateful for the help the bank provides.  The members of the group are: Danelia, Otilia, Jeyling, Socorro, Gertrudis, Oneyda, Ana, Meylin, Lourdes, Migdania, Telma, Reyna, Yalma, Martha and Ana.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food-sales business.

loans.name: Alaa
